loans.name: Zuhra

texts.ru: Зухра женщина 31 года , замужем , имеет пятерых детей.Муж работает мастер по ремонту мобильных трубок.Сама Зухра директор рынка скота на Чайрухском базаре.Зухра вместе со своей семьёй занимается откормом и продажей скота.У неё сейчас 30 баранов.Во время мониторинга Зухра была на работе, поэтому на снимке её старший сын , который кормит баранов.Для увеличения оборотного капитала скота Зухра решила повторно получить кредит.
texts.en:
Zuhra G. is 31 year old and is married with five children. Her husband makes a living by fixing mobile phones. Zuhra is Director of Chakhrui cattle market. Together with her family, Zuhra raises and sells cattle. Now she has 30 sheep. During the monitoring Zuhra was at work, and we could only take a picture of her elder son giving fodder to the sheep. Zuhra is applying for a second loan in order to increase cash flow.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: raise and sell cattle

loans.name: Zulfira

texts.ru: Зульфира Абдуллаева  1976 года рождения , замужем имеет 6 детей.  С Микроинвест сотрудничает с 2004 года по настоящее время. Имеет хорошую кредитную историю. Торгует  мужским нижнем бельем.  Имеет хороший доход от продажи. Зульфира ездит за товаром сама с Уратюбе. Утром ездит вечером она уже  привозит , на следующий день выходит на рынок и продает. Планирует  расширяться и увеличивать ассортимент детской одежды.
texts.en:
Zulfira A. was born in 1976. She is married with six children. She has been a Microinvest client since 2004 and has a good credit history. Zulfira sells men's underwear which she brings from Uratube. She travels to Uratube in the mornings and sells the goods on the market next day. The business is profitable, and Zulfira plans to expand it and increase the assortment of children's clothing.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: business expansion

loans.name: Evalyne

texts.en: Evalyne O. Owuor is a 35-year-old mother of 6 girls, aged 6-20. She sells fish from a stall in the Kasagam area in Kisumu, Kenya. The profit will serve as an additional source of income for her large family. Her husband also works as a carpenter, though times are tough. She will use the funds to continue to grow her business. Evalyne is proud to be working for her family.

loans.use: The purchase of more fish for re-sale

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy S. is thirty-seven years old. She is married with three children. Lucy is resourceful and enterprising. She has supported three children to graduate from high school through her business. She operates a restaurant and sells local dishes like “fufu” and “banku”. Fufu is prepared from cooked pounded cassava and plantain, taken with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains (corn dough) and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. 

Lucy says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she is no longer able to meet her production expenditure. She needs the loan to enable her to inject additional capital into the business to scale up production and maintain quality as well. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. Lucy is a member of a group called “Miracle” Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee and provide support to one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs: meat, fish and vegetables

loans.name: Imuentinya

texts.en: Imuetinya is 31 years old and married without no children. She is a tailor. She also sells sarongs and drinks. She needs the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more sarongs and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Arike

texts.en: Arike is 42 years old and she is married with 6 children. She sells sarongs, shoes, and cosmetics. She started this business in the year 2004. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more sarongs, shoes, and cosmetics to sell. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs, shoes, and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Ajaratu

texts.en: Ajaratu has a machine that she uses to grind vegetables and beans. She needs the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase one grinding machine. She is 42 years old and married with 6 children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase one grinding machine

loans.name: Mujeres Exitosas Group

texts.en:
“Mujeres Existosas”, or Successful Women, is a group of five entrepreneurs seeking their first loan from Esperanza International. This group, as a part of a larger successful microfinance bank, is seeking to utilize loan funds to further establish existing businesses, or in the case of the group’s coordinator, Chisel, to begin a completely new entrepreneurial activity.

Chisel, mother of four (ages: 28, 22, 15, 9) will use her first microfinance loan to begin selling jeans to those in her community. Chisel has seen a need for jeans, especially among the youth, and plans to use her loan to purchase new pairs of jeans in Santiago and in turn sell to her community. As she puts it, Chisel dreams of a “nueva vida”, or a new life, and for this reason plans to use the opportunity of a loan with Esperanza to the best of her ability.

Other members of Chisel’s bank run similar entrepreneurial activities including food, fruit and meat sales.

On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: To purchase jeans to sell to the community

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Fifty years old and married with a child, Comfort wholesales and retails medicine to her customers. She is now requesting a loan of N70, 000 to purchase more medicine to sell. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more medicine to sell.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther sells loaves of bread. She has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan in the amount of N50,000 to purchase more loaves of bread to sell.

Esther is 44 years old and married with six children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more loaves of bread to sell.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en:
Julius sells drinks by retail to his customers. He hopes for a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell.

He is 52 years old and married with six children. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary A. is 30 years old and runs a small shop where she serves tea, mandazi, and chapatti. Mandazi is similar to galub jaman (if you are in India), a plain donut (if you are in the US), or ponczki without jelly (if you are in Poland). Chapatti is similar to a soft, greasy, baked tortilla (if you are in Mexico).

Rosemary buys her supplies from a shop. This loan would allow her to buy in bulk and increase her profit margins.

Rosemary is the proud mother of three children.

loans.use: To buy food supplies in bulk.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria sells palm oil retail to his customers. She hopes for a loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more palm oil to sell.

She is 45 years old and married with five children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell.

loans.name: Vero

texts.en:
Vero sells provisions and foodstuffs. She started this business in 2005. She hopes for a loan in the amount of N60,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell.

She is 54 years old and married with three children. She hopes to expand her business. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To procure electrical goods.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
El señor Pedro Vásquez  vive en casa propia, en la zona  de villa Exaltación de la ciudad de El Alto con su esposa y sus dos hijos.
El señor Pedro trabaja como empleado en una cooperativa Minera en una población cercana a la ciudad de La Paz. y su esposa se dedica a las labores de casa..
Su vivienda, por la antigüedad presenta deterioro de los muros interiores en tres habitaciones, las que serán refaccionadas con el crédito solicitado.
Esta es la tercera que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Pedro Vásquez lives in his own home in the area of Villa Exaltación in the city of El Alto. He lives with his wife and two children. Señor Pedro works as an employee in a mining cooperative in a town near the city of La Paz. His wife is a housewife. Their house, because of its age, has deteriorating interior walls in three rooms, which will be refurbished with the requested credit. This is the third time that they are requesting a loan, and the socioeconomic analysis performed qualifies them favorably so they can gain access to this credit.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The cost of refurbishing the interior walls of three rooms in their house.

loans.name: Beauty

texts.en: Beauty is 31 years old and single. She sells sarongs. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. She hopes to expand her business. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Rogelio

texts.es:
El señor Rogelio C. vive en casa propia, en la zona  de Llojeta, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa, la señora Rosy Callisaya y sus dos hijo.
El señor Rogelio trabaja como joyero, haciendo trabajos para las joyerías de la zona central y su esposa se dedica a las labores de casa.
Con créditos anteriores construyeron tres habitaciones y un baño los que constituyen su vivienda actual.
El crédito es para la construcción de una habitación, que será la cocina que complemente su vivienda.
Esta es la quinta vez que solicitan préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califican favorablemente y pueden acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Señor Rogelio C. lives in his own home in the area of Llojeta on the west side of the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife, señora Rosy Callisaya, and their two children. Señor Rogelio works as a jeweler, making pieces of jewelry in the central zone. His wife is a housewife. With their previous loans, they constructed three rooms and a bathroom, which make up their present home. This credit will go towards constructing a room, which will be the kitchen that will complement their home. This is the fifth time that they are requesting a loan, and the socioeconomic analysis performed qualifies them favorably so they can gain access to a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The cost of constructing a room (a kitchen) for their home

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en: Emmanuel sells ice cream retail to his customers. He has a bicycle that he uses to hawk his ice cream within his community in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. He hopes for the loan amount of N 70,000 to purchase more ice cream to sell. He is 40 years old and married with a child. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more ice cream to sell

loans.name: Rolando

texts.es:
Rolando trabaja de transportista, tiene una movilidad de servicio publico inter- ciudad La Paz El Alto, es su principal fuente de ingreso con la que cubre la manutención de su madre que es una persona de la tercera edad; viven en casa alquilada ubicada en la zona de Rio Seco de la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de llantas para su movilidad para seguir trabajando.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo solicitado por Rolando.
texts.en:
Rolando works as a rickshaw driver transporting passengers. He has an inter-city service in La Paz El Alto. This is his main source of income, with which he covers the cost of caring for his mother, who is elderly. They live in a rented house located in the zone of Rio Seco in the city of La Paz. The credit will go towards purchasing tires for his vehicle so he can keep working. This is his first credit with Impro. The evaluation performed qualifies him so he can receive his requested loan.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of tires for his transportation service

loans.name: Augustus

texts.en:
Augustus T. is fifty-one years. He is divorced with three children. Two of his children are working and the last child is currently in the university. Augustus is a dealer in building materials like cement, nails, roofing sheet, etc. at Madina market. He buys his supplies from importers at Accra Central, at wholesale prices, and sells to his customers at retail prices.

Augustus requests the loan to enable him to procure increased goods to accelerate his business. With the loan, he hopes to increase savings to expand his shop. He would be very grateful for your support. He belongs to the community group called Miracle Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee and support one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To procure building materials for re-sale

loans.name: Viviana

texts.es:
Viviana trabaja como artesana tiene una maquina de tejer a lana, confecciona mantas para señoras de pollera, el esposo es empleado en una empresa de carga. Ellos tienen dos hijos, no tiene casa propia y viven en la casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona Loreto de la Ciudad de El Alto.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de materia prima (lana) de esa forma podrá satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que tiene en su mercado.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por la prestataria.
texts.en:
Viviana works as an artisan. Working on her own loom, she makes traditional woolen blankets and ponchos for local women. Her husband works for a shipping company.She and her husband have two children but do not have their own home. Currently, they live with Viviana's parents in Loreto, in the city of El Alto. This loan will be used to buy wool so that Viviana can satisfy the demand that exists for her products. This is her first loan from Impro, but she has been fully evaluated as a client and has been deemed eligible for the loan she is requesting.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy wool

loans.name: Chizurum

texts.en: Chizurum sells pure water wholesale and retail to his customers. He hopes for the loan amount of N 60,000 to purchase more pure water to sell. He is 33 years old and married without any children. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more pure water to sell

loans.name: Betty

texts.es:
Betty es comerciante, viaja a Desaguadero frontera con la Republica de Peru donde compra por cantidad zapatillas deportivas para comercializarlas por docenas en las ferias populares de la ciudad de El Alto, el esposo trabaja como transportista publico. Estas actividades son su principal fuente de ingreso con  que cubren la manutención de su tres hijos que dependen la pareja, viven en alquiler ubicado en la zona Loreto de la misma Ciudad.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de mercadería, así de esa forma podrá satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que tiene en su mercado.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por la prestataria.
texts.en:
Betty is a trader. She travels to Desaguadero, on the border with Peru, to buy large quantities of sneakers which she then sells by the dozen in El Alto's popular markets. Betty's husband works a taxi driver. These two sources of income are what they use to support their three children and pay the rent for their house in the neighbourhood of Loreto. Betty will use this loan to buy merchandise, so that she can meet the demand that exists for her products. This is her first loan from Impro, but she has been fully evaluated as a potential client and deemed eligible to receive the loan she has requested.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy sneakers

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther sells second-hand clothes. She hopes to expand her business. She hopes for the loan amount of N 60,000 to purchase more second-hand clothes to sell. She is 34 years old and married with 3 children. She says thanks to all who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en: Christopher has a motorcycle that he uses to convey his passengers. He hopes for the loan amount of N 80,000 to purchase one additional motorcycle. He is 36 years old, married with a child. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase a second motorcycle

loans.name: Facunda

texts.es:
Facunda trabaja como artesana y confecciona polleras para damas que  comercializa en las ferias populares de la ciudad de el Alto siendo esta actividad su principal fuente de ingreso con  que cubre la manutención de un hija de esta estudiando en la universidad publica de El Alto; vive en alquiler ubicado en la zona Loreto de la misma Ciudad.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de materia prima (tela) de esa forma podrá satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que tiene en su mercado.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por la prestataria.
texts.en:
Facunda works as an artisan, making traditional skirts for women and selling them in the El Alto's markets. This is her principal source of income, which she uses to pay rent for her house in the neighbourhood of Loreto and also, to support her daughter, who is in university. She will use this loan to buy cloth so that she can meet the demand that exists for her products. This is her first loan from Impro, but she has been fully evaluated as a potential client and deemed eligible to receive the loan she has requested.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes es comerciante, viaja a Desaguadero frontera con la Republica de Perú donde compra por cantidad ropa para damas  para comercializarla por docenas en las ferias populares de la ciudad de El Alto, el esposo colabora con ella porque es desempleado como muchos hombres bolivianos que deciden trabajar con la pareja. Tiene su casa propia ubicada en la zona Estrella d Belen – Rio Seco de la misma Ciudad.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de mercadería (ropa de mujer) de esa forma podrá satisfacer la cantidad de demanda que tiene en su mercado.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado por la prestataria.
texts.en:
Lourdes is a trader. She travels to Desaguadero, on the border with Peru, to buy large quantities of women's clothing which she then sells in El Alto's markets. Her husband helps her with her work, because like many Bolivian men, he is currently unemployed. The couple have their own home, in the El Alto neighbourhood of Estrella de Belen/ Rio Seco. Lourdes will use this loan to buy merchandise (women's clothing), so that she can meet the demand that exists for her products. This is her first loan from Impro, but she has been fully evaluated as a potential client and deemed eligible to receive the loan she has requested.

Translated from Spanish by Sara Sultan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy women's clothing

loans.name: Kwadwo

texts.en:
Kwadwo O. is divorced and the father of one child. He is a thirty-five-year-old businessman. He owns a boutique shop and sells men’s wear such as suits, shirts and trousers, shoes, belts and caps. He has been in business for the past fifteen years.

O. says he purchases his stock from major wholesale outlets in Accra and sometimes travels to China. He wants to inject more working capital into his trade to enable to him purchase bulk quantities during his trips. With the loan, he believes he would be more resourced to purchase good quality stock to satisfy his customers. He hopes that he can increase his profit margin substantially to enable him to support his family, especially to pay for the education of his kids.

O. is in a group called Strong Trust Bank in his community. The members in the group guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan and provide support and assistance to one another in handling repayment.

loans.use: To procure men’s wear for re-sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Increase variety of merchandise offered

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena K. is married and the mother of two kids who are currently in senior high school. She is 31 years old and a trader. She trades in garments, cloths, and lace materials. Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations. She treks to Kumasi to buy her stock of goods.

For lack of adequate working capital, Abena buys a few stocks of lace materials and sells through hawking. She believes the loan will enable her to grow her business to the expected level. With the loan, she wants to purchase bulk stocks of lace materials and textiles. She hopes to use part of her profit to provide her children with quality education. Abena belongs to a village bank called ‘K.’. She hopes to receive GHS 700 to make business progress by re-stocking her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase bulk stocks of lace materials and textiles

loans.name: Mujeres De Dios En Progreso Group

texts.en:
Emilia G. is a mother of nine ranging from 5 to 29 years old. She is the group coordinator for the group called "Mujeres de Dios en Progreso", or in English, "Women of God in Progress." This is Emilia's first loan and with it she hopes to be able to buy a variety of types of clothing and shoes to sell in her clothing business. Emilia said that a friend first told her of the loans she could get with Esperanza, and it immediately sparked an interest in her.

Emilia lives in a community near Puerto Plata called Callejon de la Loma. Some of her future goals are to improve her house and business and to progress more. She is hoping this loan and future loans can help her grow her business. She enjoys working in her home and spending time with her nine children.

On behalf of Emilia G., the Mujeres de Dios en Progreso group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support and awareness of the global issue of poverty, in which your efforts are helping to make a difference.

loans.use: Replenishing supplies for a clothing business

loans.name: Mary Mavis

texts.en:
Mary Mavis N. is seventy-two years old. She is a widow and has three children who are all living independently. Mavis is a dealer in hardware such as assorted paints, nails, roofing sheets, hammers, PVC pipes, etc. at Haatso, a suburb of Accra where she lives with her grandchildren. She buys her supplies from importers in Accra at wholesale prices and sells to her customers at retail prices. 

Mary Mavis requests the loan to enable her to procure increased stock of paints, nails, hammers, etc. to accelerate business progress. With the loan, she hopes to increase savings to expand her shop to include the sale of cement. She would be very grateful for your support. 

Mary is in a group called Strong Trust Bank in her community. The members in the group guarantee for one another as collateral to access the loan and provide support and assistance to one another in handling repayment.

loans.use: To procure hardware for re-sale

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia A. is a 39-year-old trader; she is widowed and the mother of eight children. All her children are now grown-ups. She resides at Wasa Simpa in the western region of Ghana. She divorced three years ago when her husband refused to take care of the children's basic needs.

She is a very resourceful single mother whose hard effort brings livelihood to the family. Felecia supports her kids through the sale of used clothing and bed sheets. Selling of used clothing and bed sheets has a very big market share in Ghana as brand new clothes are very expensive for the economically active poor. Therefore selling of used clothing has created market for many women.

Felicia has been in this business for the past three years. She travels to a nearby city called Kumasi to purchase her stock of goods. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing to increase her inventory; she normally concentrates on bed sheets and used towels. She believes this loan would help her save for her children's future and also to rent a store. Felecia belongs to a village bank called ‘Kyeremaa’. She also hope to receive GHS 600 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more to in taking care of the home.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet Y. is married and mother of two kids who are currently in senior high school. She is a 37-year-old trader. Currently she lives with her husband in a rented apartment together with the children.

She trades in garment cloths and lace materials. Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations. She treks to Kumasi to buy her stock of goods. For lack of adequate working capital, Abena buys a few stocks of lace materials and sells through hawking. She believes the loan will enable her to grow her business to the expected level. With the loan, she wants to purchase lace materials and textiles in bulk. She hopes to use part of her profit to provide her children with quality education. Janet belongs to a village bank called ‘Kyeremaa’. She also hope to receive GHS 600 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase bulk of lace materials and textile

loans.name: Christiana

texts.en:
Christiana is a forty-nine-year-old businesswoman. She is divorced with three kids who are in school. She trades in students’ foam mattress and pillows. She obtains her supplies from the manufacturers and sells at retail prices. She wants to use the loan to buy more supplies of foam mattress and pillows to increase her stock.

Christiana says most of her customers are students. She makes good sales when the academic year begins. Her dreams are to expand her business to include additional stock like door mats, bedspreads, curtains etc. to meet the needs of her customers and make increased income.

Christiana aspires to give her children the best of education she can afford. She is a member of the community group called Miracle Group. Members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan and peer support to repay.

loans.use: To procure students’ mattresses etc. for re-sale

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria tiene una tienda de abarrotes y su esposo es grafico, tiene dos hijos en edad universitaria  
Vive en la zona de villa copacabana de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa propia. 
El crédito será destinado para capital educación de sus hijos, pago de matricula en inscripción en la universidad.
Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago de su crédito.
texts.en:
Maria has a general store and her husband is a graphic artist. She has two college-age children. She lives in the Villa Copacabana zone of the city of La Paz, in a home she owns. The loan will be destined to help her children with their educations, to pay for their enrollment and tuition. This is the second time she requests a loan with Impro. Her history qualifies her as a top client; in other words, she has complied well with her loan repayments.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the college tuition costs of her two children.

loans.name: Evenezer En Cristo Group

texts.en:
In the photo are Magdalena L. and her group, Evenezer en Cristo. Magdalene is the mother of three of the ages of 2, 4, and 6 and runs a business selling a variety of things including clothing, charcoal, and fried food. Her partner's name is Andres, and they have lived in a town near Puerto Plata called Monte Llano for about three years after emigrating from Haiti. She was invited to participate in this bank by a friend that lives in her neighborhood. Between raising her three children and working, she does not get much free time.

Some of her future goals are to grow the business and to own her own house, because she currently rents. This will be Magdalena's third loan through Esperanza.

On behalf of Magdalena L., the Evenezer en Cristo group, and the entire team here at Esperanza International, we thank you for your support and awareness of the global issue of poverty, in which your efforts are helping to make a difference.

loans.use: to buy supplies and goods to sell

loans.name: Olga

texts.en: Olga is married with two children. She sells mill cakes, animal food, sunflower oil and other similar products at the local market in Pavlograd. Olga has been in this business for 9 years. When she started the business, the competition was low. During this time it has not changed. Today there are only 2 or 3 other people that sell similar products at the market. This business is the only source of income for Olga’s family. Olga would like to get a loan of 7,500 UAH to purchase 90 bags of mill cakes. Her business goal is to buy a small truck so she can transport her supplies.

loans.use: to purchase 90 bags of mill cakes for resale

loans.name: Catalina Del Carmen

texts.es:
La microempresaria Catalina del Carmen Gutiérrez G. tiene 35 años de edad, es casada, tiene dos hijos, los cuales estudian y además le ayudan en sus negocios. Doña Catalina se dedica desde hace 12 años al negocio de la comercialización de lácteos (queso y crema). Con este negocio a podido salir adelante en los gastos del hogar. 

Sin embargo esta microempresaria que tiene espíritu de superación, ha incursionado desde hace 2 años a la compra y venta de mariscos (chacalines, jaiba y ostiones). Para este negocio a comprado una pequeña embarcación (cayuco) con un motor fuera de borda en el cual se transporta donde los pescadores artesanales y les compra dicho producto.

Una vez que tiene acopiado (Cuenta con termos y freezer) cierta cantidad de mariscos los traslada a la capital en donde ya tiene compradores, estos son dueños de restaurantes y hoteles que ofrecen estos tipos de platillos.

Esta microempresaria ha tenido por parte de ADEPHCA mas de 6 créditos y en todos a pagado en tiempo y forma, actualmente esta solicitando su crédito numero 2 con Kiva y mantiene los dos negocios, por un lado la venta de lácteos el cual administra su hija y el de los mariscos que personalmente ella lo atiende.

En esta ocasión esta solicitando comprar 300 libras de chacalines los cuales compra a US$ 1.50 dólares cada libra, 20 galones de ostiones que compra a US$ 7.50 dólares cada galón y 80 docenas de jaiba las cuales compra a US$ 5 dólares cada docena.
texts.en:
The micro-entrepreneur Catalina del Carmen Gutiérrez G. is 35 years old, married, and has two children who are in school and also help her with her businesses. For the past 12 years, Catalina has dedicated herself to selling dairy products (cheese and cream). With this business, she was able to get ahead with the household expenses. In addition, this micro-entrepreneur who has a great spirit and desire to supersede, also has seafood business that she’s had for 2 years. For this enterprise, she purchased a small motorboat (cayuco) that she uses to visit the local fishermen to buy her products. Once she has accumulated a certain amount of seafood (she has a Thermos and freezer), she transports them to the capital where she has buyers. These include restaurant owners and hotels that offer these types of dishes. This businesswoman has had six loans with ADEPHCA that she has paid back in full and on time. Currently, she is requesting her 2nd loan with Kiva. She cares for the seafood end of the business personally, while her daughter tends to the dairy side of things. On this occasion, she requests a loan to purchase 300 pounds of shrimp at US $1.50 per pound, 20 gallons of scallops at US $7.50 per gallon, and 80 dozen crabs at US $5.00 per dozen.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase shrimp, scallops and crab.

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi is 52 years old. She is single and lives with her parents. Naomi lives at Wasa Simpa, a suburb of Tarkwa, in the Western region of Ghana. 

She loves selling goods, the business through which she obtains her daily source of income.  She has been selling maize cereals for five years to support her family. Maize is one of the favorite staple foods and supplies carbohydrate in the diet.  She takes delivery of her supplies directly from farmers. This enables her to avoid middlemen who would buy from the farmers and resell to her at higher prices. With this loan, she wants to buy bulk supplies of maize to serve her customers. She hopes to use part of her profit to support her business expansion. 

Naomi belongs to a village bank called ‘Me Hwe Awuarde’ which means "Am looking up to God". She also hopes to receive GH¢600 to make her business grow by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy bulk supplies of maize.

loans.name: Wendy Pilar

texts.es:
Wendy es socia del Banco Comunal Legioncito.
Wendy es conviviente, tiene 22 años y 2 hijos, Wendy se dedica a la elaboración de cremoladas, sus ventas los realiza al por mayor a otros comerciantes y también al por menor de manera ambulatoria en los parques, estadios.
Wendy necesita un préstamo de 800 soles dinero que será invertido como parte de pago de una maquina chupetera.
Los sueños de Wendy son ampliar su negocio y brindarle todo lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Wendy is a member of the Legioncito community bank. Wendy is married common-law; she is 22 years old and has two children. Wendy makes snowcones. She sells wholesale to other merchants as well as retail as a street vendor in parks and stadiums. Wendy needs a loan of 800 soles for a partial payment on a lollipop-making machine. Wendy's dream is to expand her business and give her children only the best.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For a partial payment on a lollipop-making machine.

loans.name: Mirtha Marisol

texts.es:
Mirtha   es socia del Banco Comunal Legioncito.
Mirtha es casada, tiene 38 años y 1 hija, Mirtha se dedica a la elaboración de papa seca (papa sancochada y secada al sol), la papa lo compra de los productores, cuenta con un local alquilado en donde procesa la papa, sus ventas los realiza en la ciudad de Lima.
Mirtha necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de papa.
Mirtha sueña con mejorar su negocio y seguir educando a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Mirtha is a member of the Legioncito cooperative bank. Mirtha is married, 38 years old, and has one daughter. Mirtha dedicates herself to making dried potatoes (parboiled, then dried in the sun). She buys the potatoes from the producers. She has a rented location where she processes the potatoes, and she sells her products in the city of Lima. Mirtha needs a loan of 1,000 soles to invest in the purchase of potatoes. Mirtha dreams with improving her business and continue educating her children.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of potatoes.

loans.name: Aurora

texts.es:
Aurora es socia del Banco Comunal Legioncito.
Aurora es soltera, tiene 50 años y 2 hijos, Aurora vende comida y picarones los días domingos en la feria de las Américas. Además Aurora trabaja como cocinera en un hogar los demás días de la semana.
Aurora necesita un préstamo de 400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de harina, fideo, aceite y arroz.
Los sueños de Aurora son tener capital propio, mejorar su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Aurora is a member of the Legioncito Cooperative Bank. Aurora is single, 50 years old, and has two children. Aurora sells food and picarones (a sweet, ring-shaped fritter with a pumpkin base) on Sundays at the Las Américas market. The other days of the week, Aurora works as a cook in a private home. Aurora needs a loan of 400 soles to invest in the purchase of flour, noodles, oil, and rice. Aurora’s dreams are to have her own capital, to improve her business and provide a good education for her children.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase flour, noodles, oil and rice.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
Soledad es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar.
Soledad es casada, tiene 54 años y 5 hijos, Soledad tiene hospedaje ubicado cerca al mercado central D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. sus hijos y 1 empleado. Además Soledad tiene 2 puestos D. venta D. comida en el mercado Santa Elena y también cuenta con la ayuda D. 1 ayudante.
Soledad necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. sabanas, almohadas y como parte D. pago D. una congeladora.
Soledad sueña con que sus hijos culminen sus estudios y obtengan sus títulos, construir sus puestos con material noble.
texts.en:
Soledad is a member of the Despertar Microfinance Institute.

Soledad is a 54-year-old married mother with 5 children. She owns an inn that is located near the central market of Ayacucho. She runs the business with the help of one of her children and an employee. She also has 2 stalls in which she sells fast food in the Santa Elena market, and has an employee working for her.

Soledad needs a 1,500.00 PEN loan, which will be invested in purchasing bed sheets and pillows. She will also use the rest of the money as one installment for a freezer.

Soledad dreams of seeing her children complete their studies and earn their degrees. She would also like to build her stalls with decent materials.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bed sheets and pillows; give an installment for a freezer

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar.
Rita es casada, tiene 56 años y 4 hijos, Rita tiene un molino en su casa en donD. brinda servicio D. molienda D. cereales, además procesa cereales que luego venD. en los mercados, también en temporadas elabora papa seca.
Rita necesita un préstamo D. 3000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. quinua y trigo.
Los sueños D. Rita son tener una empresa molinera y tener una bodega en su casa.
texts.en:
Rita is a member of the Despertar Micronfinance Institute.

Rita is a 56-year-old married mother with 4 children. She has a mill in her house in which she offers milling services. She also processes grains that she later takes to the market to sell. During certain seasons, she makes freeze-dried potatoes as well.

Rita needs a 3,000.00 PEN loan to invest in purchasing quinoa and wheat.

Rita dreams of having her own milling company and a warehouse in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase quinoa and wheat

loans.name: Eurocina Mercedes

texts.es:
Eurocina es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar.
Eurocina es divorciada, tiene 55 años y 1 hijo, Eurocina tiene un puesto en el mercado 12 de abril en donde vende ropa de niños y bebes, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Eurocina necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones y polos.
Eurocina sueña con ampliar su negocio, construir su puesto y que su hijo culmine sus estudios.
texts.en:
Eurocina is a member of the Despertar Microfinance Institute. Eurocina is a 55-year-old divorcee with 1 son. She has a stall in the 12 de Abril market, in which she sells infant and children’s apparel. She purchases her products in the city of Lima. Eurocina needs a 2,000.00 PEN loan in order to invest in purchasing pants and T-shirts. Eurocina dreams of expanding her business, building her own stall, and seeing her son complete his studies.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pants and T-shirts

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
Gregoria es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar.
Gregoria es casada, tiene 58 años y 9 hijos, Gregoria tiene una bodega en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, carne, verduras, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda D. una empleada.
Gregoria necesita un préstamo D. 1500 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar y leche.
El sueño D. Gregoria son mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a member of the Despertar (“Awaken”) Cooperative Bank. Gregoria is married, 58 years old, and has 9 children. Gregoria has a general store in her home where she sells general groceries, meats, vegetables, an activity she carries out every day with the help of one employee. Gregoria needs a loan of 1,500 soles to invest in the purchase of rice, sugar and milk. Gregoria’s dream is to improve her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of rice, sugar and milk.

loans.name: Paula Isabel

texts.es: Doña Paula Isabel es casada, maestra titulada, es dueña de la propiedad en construccion ubicada frente a la gasolinera Shell en Juigalpa, actualmente esta construyendose en un 80% y está en la parte de detalles que por el tamaño de la obra cada detalle es caro, cuenta con el apoyo de su marido para esta gestion; la inversion será para compra de puertas y ventanas de 8 cuartos que ya estan terminados.  El mayor sueño de doña Paula es ver concluida la obra, ya que estos cuartos son parte de un proyecto para hotel que le generara ingresos adicionales.
texts.en:
Ms. Paula Isabel is married and is a licensed teacher. She is also the owner of the property being built in front of the Shell gas station in Juigalpa. Right now the building is 80% complete and they are putting the finishing touches on. Because of the size of the project, even the small details are expensive. She counts on her husband’s support for this project. This loan will be used to buy doors and windows for 8 rooms that are already built. Paula’s biggest dream is to see this project finished because these rooms are part of a project to build a hotel that will generate extra income.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase doors and windows

loans.name: Lidia Wualberta

texts.es:
Lidia es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar.
Lidia es casada, tiene 30 años y 3 hijos, Lidia tiene un puesto en la galería Mayorista, local es alquilado, en donde vende ropa de adultos, niños, sus productos los adquiere en la ciudad de Lima. Además Lidia junto a su esposo tienen un restaurante en una calle concurrida de la ciudad.
Lidia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de pantalones.
Los sueños de Lidia son comprar un terreno para la construcción de su casa y surtir con mas productos su negocio.
texts.en:
Lidia is a member of the community bank “Despertar” (wake up). She is 30 years old, married with 3 children. She rents a booth at the wholesale market where she sells children’s and adult’s clothing that she purchases in Lima. Lidia and her husband also have a restaurant on a busy street in their city. She is asking for a loan of 2000 soles that she will invest in purchasing pants for resale. Lidia’s dreams are to buy some land to build her house and to offer more products in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase pants for resale

loans.name: Ida Claudia

texts.es:
Ida es socia del Banco Comunal Despertar.
Ida es soltera, tiene 65 años y 1 hijo, Ida tiene cabinas de Internet en su casa, tiene 10 maquinas, las cuales están atendidas por un ayudante, en los últimos meses sus ingresos disminuyeron razón por la cual cambiara de negocio por un restaurante.
Ida necesita un préstamo de 1250 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de utensilios para el restaurante.
Los sueños de Ida son Implementar su restaurante con todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
Ida is a member of the Community Bank “Despertar” (wake up). She is a single, 65-year old with one son. Ida runs an Internet business out of her home. She has 10 computers that are monitored by an employee. In the last few months her earnings have decreased, so she has decided to change her business to a restaurant. She is asking for a loan of 1,250 soles that she will invest in supplies for the restaurant. Ida’s dream is to open her restaurant with everything that she needs.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restaurant supplies

loans.name: Casaorcco Group

texts.es:
El Banco Casaorcco inicia su cuarto ciclo con  17 socias, las socias son D. la comunidad D. Casaorcco que se ubica a 30 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Los pobladores D. la zona se dedican a la agricultura D. papa, maíz.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta abarrotes en general, cereales, lácteos, animales menores, comida y  también  a la agricultura y crianza D. animales.


Como es el caso D. Catalina que es casada, tiene 55 años y 10 hijos, Catalina viaja a las ferias donD. compra cereales, animales, productos que venD. en su comunidad. También se dedica a la agricultura D. papa y arveja.

Por otro lado Ana es conviviente, tiene 29 años y 2 hijos, Ana tiene una tienda pequeña en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su esposo, además Ana por las noches venD. salchipollos en la puerta D. su casa.

Mientras que Lucia es casada, tiene 56 años, Lucia junto a su esposo viajan a las ferias, pueblos D. donD. compran animales que luego venden en la feria D. animales.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total D. 9,750 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra oveja, cerdo, arroz, azúcar, fideo, aceite, maíz, trigo, abono.

Los sueños D. las socias son mejorar sus negocios, tener casa propio y brndar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Community Bank of Casaorcco starts its 4th loan cycle with 17 members. The members are women from the community of Casaorcco, located 30 minutes from the city of Ayacucho. The people in this area work in agriculture, growing potatoes and corn. The members have different jobs like selling groceries in general, grains, dairy, small animals, prepared food and also working on the farm and raising animals. Catalina, who is 55 years old, married and has 10 children travels to different markets to buy grains and small animals that she sells to the community. She also grows potatoes and peas. Another member is Ana, who is 29, lives with her common-law husband and has 2 children. Ana has a small store in her home where she and her husband sell groceries, fruits, and vegetables. At night, she sells “salchipollos” (a typical Peruvian food prepared with chicken and potatoes) from her front door. A final example is Lucia, who is 56 years old and married. She and her husband travel together to the markets and other towns where they buy animals that they later sell at the local animal market. Each member is asking for a different loan amount—for example, 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles or 900 soles. The total loan amount for the group is 9,750 soles. The loan money will be used to buy sheep, pigs, rice, sugar, pasta, cooking oil, corn, flour and fertilizer. The dreams of the members are to improve their businesses, own their own homes and proviD. their children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase small animals, cooking supplies and fertilizer

loans.name: Hatun Ayllu De Aqchapa Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Hatún Ayllu D. Aqchapa que significa Gran Familia D. Aqchapa en quechua, inicia su cuarto ciclo con  15 socias, todas las socias son D. L. misma comunidad, las actividades principales son L. agricultura D. verduras, hortalizas y crianza D. animales.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta cereales, animales menores, abarrotes en general, comida, medicina natural, tara y también se dedican a L. agricultura y crianza D. animales.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 600soles,  haciendo un total D. 9,600 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra D. trigo, cebada, azúcar, arroz, medicinas, abono, remedio, animales y para el pago D. peones

Los sueños D. las socias son que sus hijos estudien para ser profesionales, mejorar sus negocios, mejorar sus viviendas.
texts.en:
The Community Bank “Hatún Ayllu D. Aqchapa”, which means “the Big Family of Aqchapa” in Quechua, begins its 4th loan cycle with 15 members. All of the members are from the same community and they mainly work in agriculture, growing vegetables and produce, and raising animals. The members all have different jobs like selling grains, small animals, groceries, prepared food, natural medicine and tara powder and they also work in agriculture and raise animals. Each members needs a different loan amount, some need 300 soles, others 600 soles. The total loan amount for the group is 9,600 soles. The loans will be used to buy wheat, barley, sugar, rice, medicine, fertilizer, animals and will also be used to help pay the farm workers. The group’s dreams incluD. seeing their children study and become professionals, improving their businesses and improving their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wheat, barley, sugar, rice, etc.

loans.name: Aquiles Lanao Flores Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Aquiles Lanao Flores, inicia su noveno ciclo con 18 socias. 

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como L. venta helados, CD, DVD, condimentos, ropa, abarrotes en general, tubérculos, libros, medicina natural, cosméticos, brindar servicio D. cosmetología y tejidos D. chompas.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600soles, 900 soles, haciendo un total D. 11,250 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en L. compra helados, lanas D. diferentes colores, DVD, cremas, perfumes, tintes, chompas, pantalones, arroz, azúcar, aceite, papa.

Los sueños D. las socias son tener capital propio, mejorar su negocio, tener casa propia y local estable.
texts.en:
The Community Bank “Aquiles Lanao Flores” begins its 9th loan cycle with 18 members. The members all have different jobs like selling ice cream, selling CDs and DVDs, clothes, groceries, root vegetables, books, natural medicines, cosmetics, sweaters, and offering cosmetology services. Each member is asking for a different loan amount, such as 300 soles, 450 soles, 600 soles or 900 soles. The total loan amount for the group is 11,250 soles. The loan money will be used to buy ice cream, different colored wool, DVDs, lotions, perfumes, makeup, sweaters, pants, rice, sugar, cooking oil and potatoes. The group’s dreams incluD. having their own capital, improving their businesses, owning their own homes and being in a peaceful place.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ice cream, wool, DVDs, cosmetics, clothing, food items

loans.name: Guillerma

texts.es:
Guillerma es socia del Banco Comunal Los Claveles.
Guillerma es casada, tiene 45 años y 5 hijos, Guillerma vende frutas de manera ambulatoria en la puerta del cementerio de la ciudad, para lo cual cuenta con un triciclo, además Guillerma vende jugo de naranja que ella misma prepara.
Guillerma necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de frutas.
Los sueños de Guillerma es mejorar su casa construir mas pisos, y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Guillermo is a member of the Community Bank “Los Claveles.” She is 45 years old, married and has 5 children. She sells fruit as a street vendor at the entrance to the city’s cemetery. She has a tricycle to help her and she also sells freshly-squeezed orange juice. Guillerma is asking for a loan of 1,000 soles that she will use to purchase fruit. Guillerma dreams of improving her home by adding more floors, and providing her children with a good education.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy fruit

loans.name: Lisbeth Yurico

texts.es:
Lisbeth es socia del Banco Comunal Los Claveles.
Lisbeth es casada, tiene 21 años y 1 hijo, Lisbeth tiene una ferretería, su local esta ubicado en una avenida en la casa de su mama, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de personas, también vende agregados.
Lisbeth necesita un préstamo de 3000 soles dinero que será invertido como parte de pago de un carro.
Lisbeth sueña con construir su casa y comprar un carro para repartir sus productos a domicilio.
texts.en:
Lisbeth is a member of the Community Bank “Los Claveles.” She is 21 years old, married, and has 1 son. She has a hardware store that is located in her mother’s home. Several people help her and she also sells little trinkets. Lisbeth is asking for 3,000 soles that she will use to help pay for a car. Lisbeth dreams of building a home and buying a car in order to go door-to-door selling her products

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: help pay for a car

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura es socia del Banco Comunal Los Claveles.
Maura es casada, tiene 59 años y 8 hijos, Maura tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, frutas, también elabora gelatinas, chupetes, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su esposo e hijos.
Maura necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de aceite, atun, fideo, leche, azúcar.
Maura sueña con ampliar su tienda y que sus últimos 2 hijos obtengan sus títulos.
texts.en:
Maura is a member of the Community Bank “Los Claveles.” She is 59 years old, married, and has 8 children. She has a store in her home where she sells general grocery items, fruits and vegetables. She also makes jello and suckers that her husband and kids help her with. Maura is asking for 1,000 soles that she will use to buy cooking oil, tuna, pasta, milk and sugar. Maura dreams of expanding her store and also hopes to see her 2 youngest children earn their degrees.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy cooking oil, tuna, pasta, milk and sugar

loans.name: Maena Rosa

texts.es:
Maena es socia del Banco Comunal Los Claveles.
Maena es conviviente, tiene 31 años y 2 hijos, Maena junto a su esposo tienen un taller D. Carpintería en un local alquilado, realizan trabajos a pedidos y en época D. demanda cuenta con el apoyo D. personales.
Maena necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido como parte D. pago D. L. compra D. una casa (ultima cuota).
Maena sueña con construir su casa e implementar un hostal y tener una empresa carpintería granD..
texts.en:
Maena is a member of the Community Bank “Los Claveles.” She is 31 years old, lives with her common-law husband, and has 2 children. Maena and her husband rent a carpentry workshop where they make custom-order furniture. During peak seasons they count on the help of several employees. Maena is asking for 1,000 soles that she will use as part of her last house payment. She dreams of building her house and opening a hostal, and also of having a big carpentry business.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: help make a house payment

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
Martha es socia del Banco Comunal Los Claveles.
Martha es conviviente, tiene 27 años y 1 hijo, Martha tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado ubicado cerca del cementerio de la ciudad en donde vende comida oriental, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo.
Martha necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de materiales de construcción para su casa.
Los sueños de Martha son construir su casa y tener otra sucursal.
texts.en:
Martha is a member of the Los Claveles (“The Carnations”) Cooperative Bank. Martha is married, 27 years old, and has one son. Martha has a restaurant in a rented space, located near the city cemetery. She works alongside her husband selling Asian food. Martha needs a loan of 1,200 soles to invest in the purchase of construction materials for her house. Martha’s dreams are to build her home and have another location.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of construction materials for her house.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria Teresa de 48 años de edad, esta solicitando su 6to credito para la construccion que inicio con el credito anterior como es construir el frente de los cuartos y poner lavamanos y servicios higienicos, si el credito se lo permite hara embaldozado, tiene un hijo a su cargo, el que esta estudiando la escuela primaria. Actualmente se desempeña como consejal en la Alcaldia de Juigalpa iniciando en el mes de Enero 2009.  Ella se ha planteado la meta de ampliar su casa, ya que es una casa de proecto construida por el gobierno español.  Su credito anterior lo pago por adelantado para solicitar otro nuevo y continuar con la construccion.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa, 48 years old, is requesting her 6th loan for a construction project she started with a previous loan. She is building the front of the rooms, and adding a washbasin and bathroom facilities. If the loan permits her to, she would like to tile. She has one child in her care who is in primary school. Currently, she is a councilwoman in the mayor’s office of Juigalpa, which she joined in January of 2009. Her plans are to expand her home, which is part of a governmental construction project. Her previous loan was paid early, so she could take out another to continue with her construction efforts.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of a room and bathroom facilities.

loans.name: Milagros Group

texts.es:
El Banco Milagros inicia su tercer ciclo con  19 socias.

Las socias realizan diferentes negocios como la venta D. abarrotes en general, verduras, cereales, ropa, cosméticos, comida, pescado y animales.

Como es el caso D. Marcelina es casada, tiene 42 años y 3 hijos, Marcelina tiene una tienda en su casa en donD. venD. abarrotes, frutas, verduras, actividad que realiza todos los días.

Mientras que Melania es separada, tiene 48 años y 2 hijos, Melania venD. ropa, sus ventas son al crédito y los realiza a domicilio y en los mercados.

Las socias necesitan diferentes montos D. prestamos como 300 soles, 450 soles, 600soles, 900 soles  haciendo un total D. 12,450 soles D. prestamos en el Banco Comunal. 

Sus prestamos serán invertidos en la compra D. arroz, azúcar, uniformes escolares, animales, trigo, cebada, verduras, frutas.

Los sueños D. las socias son salir adelante con sus negocios, tener capital propio, sus hijos culminen sus estudios y prosperen.
texts.en:
The Milagros (“Miracles”) Bank starts its third cycle with 19 members. The members have different types of businesses, such as selling groceries, vegetables, cereals, clothing, cosmetics, food, fish and animals. This is the case for Marcelina who is married, 42 years old and has 3 children. She has a store in her home where she sells groceries such as fruits and vegetables every day. Meantime, Melania is separated, 48 years old and has two children. She sells clothing, her sales are on credit, and she realizes them door-to-door and in the markets. The members need different loan amounts such as 300 Peruvian soles, 450 soles, 600 soles and 900 soles, for a loan total of 12,450 soles in the cooperative bank. Their loans will be invested into the purchase of rice, sugar, school uniforms, animals, wheat, barley, vegetables and fruits. The members’ dreams are to help their businesses get ahead, to have their own working capital, and for their children to complete their educations and prosper.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, school uniforms, wheat, barley, vegetables, fruit.

loans.name: Deylin

texts.es: Deylin es casado, tiene 2 niños pequeños, es propietario de una pequeña bloquera en donde fabrica bloques, lavanderos, postes de concreto y ladrillos artificiales, lo mismo que fogones y productos de adornos de concreto, el credito lo solicita para invertirlo en la reparacion de la cocina de su casa que es de 4 x 4 mts cuadrados y el entechado de la misma, pues se encuentra en malas condiciones.  El mayor sueño de Deylin es poder tener una vivienda digna para su esposa y su hijo.
texts.en:
Deylin is married, has two small children, and owns a brickworks where he makes cinder blocks, washbasins, concrete posts, and artificial bricks. He also makes fire pits and concrete decorations. He is requesting the loan so he can invest in making repairs to his house’s kitchen, which is 4 x 4 square meters in size. He would also like to install a new roof since it is in bad condition. Deylin’s biggest dream is to be able to have a dignified home for his wife and son.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair his kitchen.

loans.name: Kuska Llankasun De Rumichaca Baja. Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal se autodenomina "kuska llankasun D. rumichaca baja"; Este banco lo conforman 16 miembros, todos ellos D. la comunidad D. Rumichaca baja, esta situado a 13 minutos D. la población D. Urubamba, movilidades que llevan a este banco son las motos taxi, Esta comunidad recientemente cuenta con servicio D. luz.

Los integrantes socios D. este banco comunal D. la zona D. Rumichaca, se dedican entre sus actividades domésticas a la agricultura, sembrando maíz, papa, hortalizas, entre otros productos y dependiendo a la época; también algunos socios se dedican a la artesanía, y algunas socias a la venta D. velas simples para el alumbrado D. su hogar, otras socias crían aves D. corral para su próxima venta, y animales vacunos y venta D. derivados.

Estos socios agradecen la ayuda prestada, puesto que la zona en la que ellos viven no cuentan con accesibilidad a la banca financiera justa y que se adecué a sus necesidades y a sus limitaciones, por lo que agradecen el préstamo otorgado y se comprometen el pago en su totalidad del préstamo adquirido en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
This cooperative bank calls itself "kuska llankasun D. rumichaca baja”. This bank is comprised of 16 members, all of whom are residents of the lower Rumichaca community, located 13 minutes from Urubamba. The predominant moD. of transportation used is “moto-taxi”. Electrical service arrived in this area only recently. The members of this community bank in the Rumichaca zone dedicate themselves to various activities such as farming, planting corn, potatoes, vegetables and others, depending on the season. Some members also dedicate themselves to handmaD. crafts, as well as the sale of simple candles for illuminating their homes. Yet other members raise poultry, cows, and dairy products. These members give thanks for the help provided to them, as the area they live in doesn’t allow easy access to banking services for their financial needs. They are grateful for the loan provided, and are committed to repaying it in its entirety and in the time-frame allotted.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, livestock and poultry.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es: Inés tiene 42 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos menores en su propia casa. Se dedica a la  crianza de  animales y a la siembra de sus tierras de cultivo desde hace 5 años, lo cual realizaba como una actividad más para aumentar sus ingresos, pero ahora se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos que le sirve para mantener a su familia. Es por eso que se levanta muy temprano para realizar sus quehaceres, pastar a sus animales y cuidar de sus cultivos, regresando a su casa al final del día. Inés quiere seguir progresando, por lo que desea emprender un nuevo negocio para prevenir posibles decadencias económicas. Es la tercera vez que Inés tiene un préstamo con MFP, ella disfruta de cada reunión de su banco comunal, y es una de las que persevera en la renovación de su crédito. La cantidad que solicita es para la compra de sacos de abono para sembrar papa y también para adquirir una máquina de coser para iniciarse en el negocio de la costura.
texts.en:
Inés is 42 years old and lives with her husband and three small children in a house they own. She has dedicated herself to raising animals and planting crops on her farmland for the past 5 years. She started these activities in order to supplement her earnings, but now these undertakings have become the primary means of sustenance for her family. It’s for this reason that she rises very early to do her chores, graze her animals, and tend to her crops, returning home at the end of the day. Inés wants to continue to progress, which is why she wants to start a new enterprise to prevent any possibly financial deterioration. This is the third time Inés has a loan with MFP. She enjoys the meetings of her cooperative bank, and is one of the members who perseveres to renew her credit. The sum she requests is for the purchase of bags of fertilizer to plant potatoes, and also to purchase a sewing machine to start a business as a seamstress.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es: Basilia tiene 36 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su propia casa. Se dedica al cuidado de  su establo para vender la leche de sus vacas, lo viene haciendo desde hace 10 años. Se levanta muy temprano para cortar el pasto que será el alimento de sus animales, por las mañanas sale a vender la leche que ordeña, hasta 60 litros por día, la que vende a una empresa procesadora de productos lácteos, con esta actividad Basilia puede solventar los gastos de sus hijos.  Pero también hay riesgos, como por ejemplo que sus vacas se enfermen por el clima tan frío que están atravesando actualmente en su zona, por lo que está tomando las medidas de precaución cuidando que su establo este bien protegido del frío. Para el fututo le gustaría ampliar el espacio donde cría a sus vacas, para incrementar la cantidad de estas y con ello producir más leche. Es la tercera vez que  Basilia tiene un préstamo con MFP, es una de las integrantes más dinámicas que promueve la unidad y sobre todo disfruta del trabajo en equipo con su grupo. Con el dinero que está solicitando comprará una vaca de raza para mejorar su producción. La vaca está valorizada en 3000 soles.
texts.en:
Basilia is 36 years old and lives with her husband and their three children in their own house. She tends to her barn and sells her cows' milk, and has been doing so for 10 years. She wakes up very early to cut the grass to feed her animals. During the morning she goes out to sell the milk she's collected, up to 60 liters per day. She sells it to a company that processes milk products, which covers her children's expenses. There are risks, however; for example, her cows get sick with the type of cold weather they're experiencing in their area right now. Because of this, she is taking precautionary measures to protect her barn from the cold. In the future, she would like to expand the space where she raises her cows to increase their number and produce more milk. This is her third loan from MFP. She is one of their most dynamic members, promoting unity and above all enjoying working with her group. With this loan, she will buy a breeding cow to improve her production, which costs 3000 soles.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a good breed of cow

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 39 years old and operating a barbecue store (food vending). Her first loan from ASHI served as her initial capital in this business. She has been in the business for almost 2 years. She has realized that this business will  increase her profit and her customers. Her neighbors and laborers serve as her customers. 

She is married and blessed with 2 children that inspire her to pursue her dreams.  Her business generated more income and she started accepting orders from another town. Her income has begun to help her family's income grow to become a potential for their dreams.

loans.use: additonal capital to purchase pork, hotdogs, chicken liver, and feed, etc.

loans.name: Mrs. Sopha Koem Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank loan, which consists of twenty-three people, is located in Preaek Pang village in Kandal province and all the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sopha K. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a grocer in the local village. Aside from this business, she is a pig breeder. In this business, her pigs are growing bigger and bigger and she does not have enough money to buy pig food to feed thE..  She decided to ask for a loan to buy food for her purpose. She is a widow with two children who both assist their mother in the business activities. Mr. Bra H. and Mr. Mon S. did not attend the loan meeting but their wives did, so they are presented in the picture instead.

loans.use: To buy pig food.

loans.name: Mrs. Noav Peang Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twenty-four people who all live in Preaek Pang village in Kandal province make up the village bank loan group.  All the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. N. P. is a village bank president. She is a vegetable seller in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Toem Vanny, is a pig breeder. Since his pigs grow bigger and bigger, he does not have enough money to buy pig food to feed them. Thus, Mrs. N. P. decided to ask for a loan to buy pig food for her husband. Mrs. N. P. is 46 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom help their parents in the business activities, while the youngest one is attending the local school. Mrs. Nimul N. did not attend the loan meeting but her husband did, so he is presented in the picture instead.

loans.use: To buy pig food for her husband's business

loans.name: Mrs. Kunthea Hun Village Bank Group

texts.en: The village bank group, which consists of twelve people, is located in Preaek Pang village in Kandal province. Mrs. Kunthea H. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice to earn a living. In this plantation, she now faces a small problem because she does not have enough money to buy rice seeds to cultivate. She decided to ask for a loan to buy seeds for her plantation.  She would use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizers to support the field to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Seng Thuch, is a recycling collector who gathers wastes such as empty bottles, cans, plastics and so on to re-sell in a recycling factory. Mrs. Kunthea H. is 37 years old and the mother of three children who are all attending the local school. Mr. Sophany L. did not attend the loan meeting but her husband did, so she is presented in the picture instead.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizers for her plantation.

loans.name: Peang

texts.en: Peang O., 59, is a widowed farmer who lives with her old mother and two sisters in the Kampong Cham province. She and her sisters have been farming since 1980 to earn a living and they are able to make about USD $1 every day. Besides this activity, Peang also sells grocery products from her home. On average, she can make USD $8 in revenue per day. Mrs. Peang has one child who stays at home to help her sell grocery items. She would like a loan to expand her grocery store by adding more products to meet her clients' demands. (Mrs. Peang O. is third from the left in the photo.)

loans.use: Expand grocery inventory

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en: Mrs. Sophea K. lives in Tadock Pong village in TaK. province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Touch Vuthy, is a motorbike taxi driver who makes a small income. Although they work hard, they do not earn enough to support the family; especially, their children's education. They have four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others attend the local school. In order to improve their children's education, Mrs. Sophea K. decided to ask for a loan to buy a computer for their children's education. Her husband is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a computer

loans.name: Thon

texts.en:
Thon C. is 27 years old and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She stays at home and raises pigs. Besides doing this activity, she also sells sugar cane. On average, she makes USD $4 a day, while her husband makes USD $4 by running a moto-taxi business. This couple has two children, one of whom is in school and one other is too young to attend school.
Mrs. Thon C. is asking for a loan to expand her livestock by adding more pigs.

loans.use: To buy more pigs

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Mrs. Phan B. was born in 1961 and she now lives in Tadock Pong village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. She is a widow with a child who sells bread in the local village. Since this business is going well, he wants to expand it so Mrs. Phan B. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy motorbike for her child to transport bread to sell door-to-door. She hopes to increase her income and improve their living conditions with this new loan.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike

loans.name: Eng

texts.en: Eng S. is 37 years old and resides with her husband in Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She has run a grocery store since 2002 to earn a living, and she makes USD $3 a day. Her husband is a recycler in the village. Every day, he walks his trailer from house to house to buy recycling items. On average, he makes USD $4 a day. This couple has five children, three of whom are in school and two who are too young to attend school. Mrs. Eng S. would like a loan so she can purchase more grocery products to meet her client’s demand.

loans.use: Increase store inventory

loans.name: Phal

texts.en: Mrs. Phal N. is a farmer in Srae Vong village in Takeo province. She has a small piece of land where she cultivates rice for a living. Her husband, Mr. Bich Sean, is a fruit and vegetable seller in the local village. He has difficulty transporting his products to the market. So Mrs. Phal N. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a new motorbike for her husband's business. She is 32 years old and the mother of four children; two are enrolled in the local school and two are too young to work or study because they are only two and five years old. Her husband appears on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike for her husband's business.

loans.name: Sot

texts.en: Sot T., 29, is married and resides with her husband, her elderly mother and two of her children in the Kampong Cham province. She is a rice farmer who typically makes US$1 per day. Her husband is a worker who breaks rocks and sells them. On average, he makes US$4 per day. Two of their children are students. Mrs. Sot T. would like to take out a loan of US$600 to purchase a motorbike and tools to make ice cream. She will start a new business selling ice cream. (Mrs. Sot is pictured with her husband, two of her children and her mother.)

loans.use: Ice-cream-making tools and a motorbike

loans.name: Sophon

texts.en: Mrs. Sophon K. is a farmer in Ponley village in Takeo province. She has a small piece of land where she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Moeurng Meng, helps her on the plantation. Although they try to work hard they still earn less income than they need to support the family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Sophon K. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. She hopes to improve their living conditions after she sells the cow.  Mrs. Sophon K. is 53 years old and the mother of three children. Two of the children work in a garment factory and the youngest attends the local school. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Bee

texts.en:
Bee N., 47, is a rice farmer who resides in the Kampong Cham province with her husband. She typically makes about $3 per day. Her husband, pictured here, has a business running a moto-taxi and makes $3 a day. One of their two children is a professional tailor.

Mrs. Bee N. is asking for a loan to purchase a sewing machine for her child to expand the tailoring business.

loans.use: purchasing a sewing machine

loans.name: Vith

texts.en: Mr. Vith R. was born in 1943 and now lives in Traing Roka village in Takeo province. He is a farmer who owns a small piece of land in which he cultivates rice for a living. He faces a small problem because the soil in his field is infertile, so he is asking for a loan to buy fertilizer. He will use some of the loan to buy pesticides to kill insects affecting his field. His wife, Mrs. Sim Khet, shown in the left in the photo, and their child help Mr. Vith R. in his farming.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to make his rice field fertile and pesticides to protect it from insects.

loans.name: Loy

texts.en:
Loy Y. is 46 years old and lives with her husband in the Kampong Cham province. She sells desserts to earn a living, and is able to make about $3 per day. Her husband earns $2 by running a moto-taxi. This couple has three children, two of whom are construction workers.

Mrs. Loy Y. would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a moto-taxi business.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen Y C. is a widow who lives with two of her children in the province of Kampong Cham. She operates a grocery store and makes US$3 a day. She is aided by two children who each work as a taxi driver and a grocery seller in the village. Mrs. Sen would like to take out a loan to purchase more groceries to meet her clients' demand.

loans.use: groceries to increase inventory

loans.name: Mrs. Youeng An Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loA., which consists of 23 people, is located in Koek Romiet village in Kandal province, and all members will use the loA. for different purposes. Mrs. YouE. A. is a village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land for cultivating vegetables to earn her living. In this farm, she faces a small problem: she does not have enough vegetable seeds to cultivate. She has decided to ask for a loA. to buy these seeds. Her husband, Mr. Chhit Lin, helps her in her farm. Mrs. YouE. A. is 58 years old and the mother of a child who is employed in a garment factory. 

This is a village bank loA. consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Nineteen members have end-of-term loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loA. until the very end of the loA. term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it offers the most benefit to Cambodia’s poor. It allows tH. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to.
