In this group, members act as guarantees for one another as social collateral to access loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To procure beauty salon supplies

loans.name: Nozim

texts.ru: Нозимжон  Вахобов 1970 года рождения женат имеет троих детей. Он занимается откормом скота.   Жена и дети помогают ухаживать за скотом, таким образом они поддерживают его бизнес. В регионе где он живет, основная деятельность это откорм и продажа скота. Первый кредит получил в 2007 году. Кредит потратил на покупку скота и сена для коров. Теперь он развивает свой бизнес и увеличивает скот. Нозимжон планирует в дальнейшем сотрудничать с Микроинвест и продолжить откорм  и продажи скота.
texts.en:
Nozim V., born in 1970, is married and has three children. He raises livestock, a business which his wife and children assist in by helping to care for the animals. Raising and selling livestock is the primary livelihood in the district they live in. Nozim received his first loan in 2007. That was used to buy livestock and hay for cows. Now he is further developing his business and expanding his herd. Nozim plans to continue working with Microinvest in the future as he continues raising and selling cattle.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en:
Khaled is a 49-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Khaled has been working as a taxi driver since 1992. He has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his car. This is the first time that Khaled has requested a loan.

Khaled is special in his work because he is good in timing. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. He decided on doing his business because he wanted to be independent. In the future, he plans on purchasing a bus in order to organize trips.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his car

loans.name: Mhammad

texts.en:
Mhammad is a 53-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Mhammad has owned a sweet shop for four years. He makes and sells typicA. Lebanese sweets. Mhammad has requested a loan of 1200 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to purchase raw materials and merchandise for his shop.

This is Mhammad's second cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loan helped him improve his shop and improve his income. Mhammad is speciA. because he does his sweets well and is known for them. His clients can be anybody. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials and merchandise for his sweet shop

loans.name: Milka

texts.en: Milka A. is a 40-year-old mother of 5 children, aged 20, 19, 17, 14, and 8. She sells clothes to pay for their schooling and to keep up their house. She is asking for a loan because she hopes to continue to expand her business, but does not have the capital to buy clothing in bulk. She would like Kiva users to know more about her family -- something we may follow up with in a journal.

loans.use: To purchase clothing in bulk

loans.name: Vugar

texts.en: Vugar is 27 years old and single. He lives in the Khachmaz region, in the village of Bagbanli. Three years ago he started a general store. Now he needs a loan of 950 AZN to buy food for expanding his business.

loans.use: To buy food items

loans.name: Fadel

texts.en:
Fadel is a 48-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Fadel has been working in agriculture since 2002. He plants bananas, oranges, mandarins, and other type of fruits. He has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase tools for his work.

This is Fadel's third cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him improve his field as well as his work. Fadel is special in his work because he knows how to take good care of his fruits and they are tasty.

loans.use: To purchase tools for his work.

loans.name: Abdo

texts.en:
Abdo is a 44-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Abdo has been selling fruits since 1988. He has requested a loan of 500 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his business.

This is Abdo's third loan cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him improve his business and diversify his merchandise. Abdo is special in his work because he has a good variety of fruits. His clients can be anybody. When he first started, he had difficulty purchasing merchandise. In the future, he plans on improving his sales and purchasing the shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his business

loans.name: Hamdi

texts.en:
Hamdi is a 25-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon. Hamdi has owned a coal shop since 1990. He has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars in order to purchase coal for his business. This is the first time that Abdo has requested a loan.

Hamdi is special in his work because he is the only one in his area who sells coal. His clients are his family members, friends and neighbors. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase coal for his business.

loans.name: Ahror

texts.ru: Ахрор Тошматов  1963 года рождения, он женат имеет 3 детей. Дома он содержит скот, который откармливает и продает через некоторое время. Бизнес он начал 10 лет назад, сотрудничать с Микроинвест в 2007 году, когда не стало хватать оборотных средств. Его жена не работает , по этому ему приходиться также подрабатывать на жизнь разнорабочим , он мастерит дома квартиры.
texts.en:
Ahror T., born in 1963, is married and has three children. At home he keeps some livestock which he feeds and sells after a time. He began this business 10 years ago, and started working with Microinvest in 2007, when he was running low on capital. His wife does not have a job, so in order to make a living he also works as a construction worker, building apartment complexes.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Meer Ahmad

texts.en: Meer Ahmad is the son of N. M.. He lives in district 16 in Kabul, Afghanistan. He has a family of four, and his son is going to get married. Meer Ahmad needs money for his son’s wedding expenses. As many people know, Afghan people have different customs and they are obligated to spend more money on weddings, so he has requested an individual loan of 30000 Afghani for a term of 10 months. He would like to say that this loan process is the best because it can support those who really need money.

loans.use: For wedding expenses

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 43-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their three children. Ali has been selling fruits and vegetable since 1996. He sells fruits and vegetable from his van, which means he is a mobile salesman. He has requested a loan of 800 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase vegetables for his business.

This is Ali's second loan cycle and he has always paid on time. His previous loan helped him diversify his merchandise. His clients are his friends and neighbors, and small markets. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the start-up. He decided on doing his business because of his experience in sales. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables for his business

loans.name: Mhammad

texts.en:
Mhammad is a 44-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their four children. Mhammad has owned a mini market for two years. He has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is the first time that Mhammad has requested a loan.

Mhammad is special in his work because he stays open until late in the evening. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. Mhammad decided on doing his business because he needed to improve his income. In the future, he plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is forty years old. She is married and has four children, and currently three of her children are in school. She owns and operates a boutique where she sells ladies’ clothes, slippers, and dressing bags. She has been in this business for the past six years. She mostly takes stock on credit and pays the suppliers back after sales. She is, however, convinced that her business can grow better with increased working capital and therefore wants a loan to buy more clothes, slippers, and dressing bags to increase her stock. Monica believes this will decrease her purchase costs very significantly, enabling her to raise a good income and expand the business. She belongs to the community group called Fine Trust Group. Members in this group stand as a guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To procure ladies' clothes

loans.name: Zaher

texts.en:
Zaher is a 23-year-old man who lives in Saida, souther Lebanon. Zaher has been selling fruits and vegetables since 2001. He sells potatoes, beans, apples, tomatoes, cucumbers, cabbage, and other type of fruits and vegetables depending on the season.

Zaher has requested a loan of 700 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase purchase merchandise and buy taxi car. The taxi car is because he wants to start a new business. This is the first time that Zaher has requested a loan.

Zaher is an active man who does his best to earn enough in order to supplement his family's income. His clients are his friends, neighbors and others. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the start-up capital. Zaher decided on doing his business because he likes working and he likes his work. In the future, he plans on expanding his business and purchasing a taxi car.

loans.use: To purchase purchase merchandise and buy a taxi car

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 41-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their child. Youssef has been working as a taxi driver since 2000. He has requested a loan of 1200 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his car. This is the first time that Youssef has requested a loan.

Youssef is special because his car is clean and he is punctual. His clients are family members, friends, neighbors and other passengers. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the start-up capital. Youssef decided on doing his business because he wanted to have independent work and likes the contact with the clients. In the future, he plans on purchasing a new car.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his car

loans.name: Tuychiboy

texts.ru: Туйчибой мужчина в возрасте 29 лет , женат имеет троих детей.Жена работает в столовой поваром.Сам Туйчибой занимается бизнесом продажи запасных частей по ремонту автомашин, а также и шланги для полива земли.Его друзья по бизнесу посоветовали увеличить товарооборот в кредит , для чего и обратился Туйчибой в Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Tuychiboy is 29 years old, married, and has three children. His wife is a cook in a cafe. Tuychiboy has a business selling spare automobile parts, as well as irrigation hoses. He applied to Microinvest after his friends in business advised him to use a loan to increase sales turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of spare parts

loans.name: Ata Mohammad

texts.en: Ata M. is the son of M. N.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with 8 children. He is a farmer and he very much enjoys working and expanding his business. He wants to take an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for a term of 12 months to buy essential tools. He admires this process and wants to say many thanks to Kiva lenders and the other lenders around the world.

loans.use: To buy farming tools

loans.name: Sadriniso

texts.ru: Садринисо очень добросовестная и пунктуальная женщина, которая кредитуется в Микроинвест уже 6 год.Она каждый свой кредит использует для пополнения сезонного ассортимента.Следующий кредит хочет использовать для закупа весеннего ассортиментов детских тапочек.Муж на заработках в России.Садринисо живёт вместе с младшим сыном и невесткой,часть дохода она тратит на проживание семьи, и конечно же на расширение бизнеса.
texts.en:
Sadriniso is a conscientious and diligent woman who has been a client of Microinvest for six years. She uses each loan received to fill her seasonal inventory. The next loan will be used to buy the spring inventory of children's sandals. Her husband is working in Russia. Sadriniso lives with her youngest son and his wife. Her income is used to support the family, and of course to expand the business.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of children's shoes and socks

loans.name: Umriniso

texts.en: Umriniso K. has been a client of MicroInvest since 2008. This permanent business development has increased her business production. She would like to take an additional loan. She has not had any loan repayment delays so she is recommended as an executive and reliable client. Umriniso is engaged in gold fabrics selling. She imports it from Turkey and works with others who want to sell the gold fabrics. Umriniso has been engaged in the gold selling business for 5 years. She has applied to KIVA for a business development loan of 2300 STJ for 8 months to import new goods from Turkey.

loans.use: To import goods from Turkey

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is 45 years old and the mother of three children. The children are currently in school. Selling of used clothing has a very big market in Ghana as brand-new clothes are very expensive for the economically active poor. Therefore, selling of used clothing has created a market for many women like Regina. She would like to use her loan to buy more bales of used clothing to increase her inventory. She believes this loan would help her save for her children’s future and also to rent a stall to sell her goods in. She is a member of the group called Winners. Members agree to stand as guarantees for each other as social collateral to access and repay loans.

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes

loans.name: Aygun

texts.en: Aygun is 25 years old and single. She lives in the Guba region, in the village of Yalavadj. Four years ago she started a clothing sales business, and now needs a loan of 950 AZN to buy clothes.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Inoyat

texts.en: Inoyat A. is 36 years old. She lives in the high-mountain region of Tajikistan where livestock is the general development business for rural residents. Inoyat is married with 3 children. She works in a collective farm but livestock brings in the family income. It is the family business, so Inoyat helps her husband take care of the animals and she is also engaged in milk-making and selling. Inoyat has worked with livestock for 7 years and she is skilled in this business. She makes sour-milk products that she sells in the local bazaar. Inoyat is asking Kiva for a business development loan of 1000 TJS for 6 months to purchase special milk-making equipment. It will help her pasteurize the milk using modern methods of pasteurization.

loans.use: To purchase pasteurization equipment

loans.name: Ravshan

texts.en: A. Ravshan applied to MicroInvest in 2009 for the first time but she appears to be a reliable client since she has not had any delays in repaying prior loans. She wants to take the next step and increase turnover to expand her existing business. Ravshan has been selling vegetables for 8 years. She works directly with collective farmers and she has lower prices than the bazaar prices. Ravshan sells mostly  tomatoes, cucumbers and onions. Ravshan also works in the local library. Ravshan is applying for a business development loan of 500 STJ for 6 months to import goods on a large-scale. She thanks KIVA for its support and help.

loans.use: large-scale good importing

loans.name: Lul Mohammad

texts.en: Lul Mohammad is the son of A. A.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is 50 years old and married with six children; three are daughters and three are sons. He is a farmer and works his own land. He would like to expand his business and buy the materials needed to improve his land. He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for 12 months. He is very happy with the loan process in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To buy materials to improve his land

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is 36 years old. She is married with three children who are all currently in school. Emily works to support her husband. She sells porridge and groundnuts in her neighborhood in the mornings. Porridge is one of the local foods that is popular for breakfast. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, boiled and taken hot with sugar, milk and bread. With her large customer base, she wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, sugar and milk to increase production. She hopes to generate enough income to support her children’s education. She is a member of a group called Jacob Trust Group. In this group, members act as social collateral to guarantee each other's loans and provide peer pressure to repay the loans.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize, millet, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Zubridin

texts.en: A. Zubridin lives in Shahristan, the high-mountain region of Tajikistan. He is married and has two children. Zubridin works in the livestock business and because he is experienced, he also works on the collective farm. He has one cow and four rams. Zubridin wants to have a big flock so he works hard to accomplish his dream. Zubridin has worked in livestock for 5 years and his sons help him in this family business. Zubridin is applying for a business support loan of 1500 STJ for 6 months to build a new barn.

loans.use: To build a barn

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: Малика женщина 39 лет , мать троих детей,работает в поликлинике медсестрой.По бизнесу ей помогает её старшая дочь , которая на снимке.А сама Малика во время мониторинга отсутствовала, была на работе,но после работы она сменяет свою дочь.Малика оптом покупает сахар и продаёт его в розницу.Для увеличения ассортимента товаров Малика решила получить кредит в размере 16оо сомони.
texts.en:
Malika is a 39 year old woman, a mother of three children. She works as a nurse in a hospital. In her business her oldest daughter, who is pictured, is helping her. Malika herself was not available because of work, and after work she take over her daughter. Malika buys sugar wholesale and resells it retail. To increase the assortment of her merchandise Malika decided to take out a loan for 1600 somoni (US$450).

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar and eggs

loans.name: Kathryn

texts.en: Kathryn A. is 44 years old. She is married with four children. She lives with her family in Abeka, a suburb of Accra. For the past eight years she has been selling plastic materials like plates, buckets, bowls etc.  She is requesting a loan to buy more plastic materials to sell. She believes the loan will enable her to increase her income used to support her family. Kathryn is a member of a community group called Winners Trust Group. Members in this group guarantee and provide assistance to one another to repay the loan. It is Kathryn’s dream to help her husband provide their children with the best education.

loans.use: To purchase plastic products

loans.name: Jackline Adhiambo

texts.en: Jackline Adhiambo O. is 26 years old and sells clothes in the Kibuye market in Kisumu in Western Kenya. She is hoping to make her business more successful because she is saving money to buy land and build and rent houses. Recently, she has struggled to save because her stock is reduced due to a lack of money and to the high inflation rate of Kenya's economy.

loans.use: To buy new clothes

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace A. is a married, 38-year-old mother of 7 children. She sells second-hand clothes in Kisumu, Kenya, and hopes to purchase more clothing to sell with her loan. She says she is challenged by school fees and transportation costs when it comes to getting her clothes. She would like to thank the people that fund her loan.

loans.use: More used clothing

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en: Pamela O. is a 38-year-old salon owner who lives and works in the Manyata slum in Kenya. She has five children, ages 9-23. Her first two children have finished of school and one lives in Frankfurt, Germany. She is still paying school fees for the rest. She likes running her own business because of the freedom it gives her. She will buy hairdryers and other products she needs for her salon so that it can grow.

loans.use: Equipment for the salon

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary O. is sixty-two years old. She is married and has six children, two of whom are currently in school. She trades in maize and palm-nuts. Mary buys her goods from nearby farming communities and distributes it to retailers and food vendors. 

Her major challenge is raising funds to support the business. She requests a loan to enable her to buy maize and palm-nuts in bulk so she can expand her business and increase sales.

Mary hopes to increase her savings to support her children’s education, so she can help to give them better future career opportunities. She belongs to the community group called the Winners Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral and assist one another to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy maize and palm nuts

loans.name: Rose Atieno

texts.en: Rose Atieno O. was born in Nairobi, but she has lived and worked in Kisumu, Kenya as a hairdresser since 2001. She admits that she likes Nairobi more, but her husband is from Kisumu. She has two children, Mike and Stephanie, and lives with her husband who also works as a businessman. Her customers are all women and she enjoys working on them.

loans.use: To buy chemicals for hair

loans.name: Siprose

texts.en: Siprose A. (pictured with her daughter Lucy) is an H.I.V. positive mother of four children. She is also a widow and has been raising her children by herself for the past three years. She sells chips (French fries) in Manyata slum where she lives. She uses the profits to pay for her children's school fees and to expand her business. She says she wants people to know that she sees goodness in being involved in her kind of business.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline A. is a 32 year old mother of four children. She is raising the children with her husband who works for an NGO. She runs a fish stall and her customers typically purchase meals during lunch or after work. She wants to purchase some utensils she can use for cooking. With her profit, she will buy clothing for her children. She wants Kiva lenders to know that she loves her children.

loans.use: To purchase utensils for cooking

loans.name: Veronica Adhiambo

texts.en: Veronica Adhiambo O. is a 26 year old mother of three children, ages five, ten and 12. She wants to sell vegetables and fish from a stall in Kisumu, but is lacking the start-up capital. The loan will be used to buy stock and to grow her business into something sustainable.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fish to sell

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa M. is thirty-five years old. She is married with three children who are currently in school. She sells porridge and groundnuts at her neighborhood. Porridge is one of the local foods that is often enjoyed for breakfast. It is prepared from milled maize or millet grains, which is boiled and eaten with sugar, milk and bread. 

With a large customer base, Hawa wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, millet, sugar and milk to increase production. She hopes to earn a good income to support her younger brother in school. 

She is a member of a group called Jacob Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access their loans and peer pressure to repay their loans.

loans.use: To buy bags of maize, millet, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Amor Y Paz Group

texts.en:
Amor y Paz ("Love and Peace") is a group of 5 women hoping to receive their 5th loan. The members of this group come from a very poor area in San Pedro, Dominican Republic. 

Cecilia A. is the representative of this group and a great leader. She has always been a hard worker, but never had access to credit before Esperanza International. She knew she could run a small business successfully, but she never had an opportunity. 

Cecilia is the mother of five young children, and she was having a hard time feeding and providing for all those children. A couple of years ago, she came to Esperanza and received her first small loan. With that small loan, she started a small business selling used clothing in her area. Through hard work and dedication, she started to increase the size of her business. 

Today she is hoping to receive her 5th loan, and she continues to increase the size of her business. She finally is able to provide all her children with the basic necessities. She dreams of sending all her children to a university, and giving them a better life than she had.  

She is very excited about the future of her business and of her family. She is happy that she finally has something of her own, and is ready to continue increasing its size! Thank you for all of your support!!

loans.use: To purchase clothing for a small business

loans.name: Margret Akinyi

texts.en: Margret Akinyi O. lives and works in the Nyamasaria slum in Kenya. She has a daughter named Emily Adhiambo who is four years old. Her husband sells timber and she sells vegetables to supplement his income. She believes her customers really like what she sells.

loans.use: Tomatoes, Onions

loans.name: Poderoso 1& 2 Group

texts.en:
Marie and Ludine N. are 39 and 29 years old. They are members of the Poderoso (Powerful) Bank of Hope. These borrowers live in Los Guaricanos, a wide area located in the northern outskirts of Santo Domingo. The people in this area suffered severely from unemployment after the closing of the state cement factory a couple years ago, so they have been moving to different activities since then. 

Marie is married and has four children. Ludine also has four children, but she is not married. Marie has no formal education, while Ludine has some college education. Both of them, as well as all the group borrowers, are in clothing sales. They purchase large quantities of clothing that contain a variety of items for men, women and children. 

Marie and Ludine hope that this second loan they are taking from Esperanza International will allow them to have merchandise available for a longer time in order to meet their customers' demands. Ludine also hopes her profits are good enough so she can go back to college and finish her career.
 
On behalf of Esperanza International, thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: Purchase clothes in bulk for resale

loans.name: Mujeres Con Futuro Group

texts.en:
“Mujeres con Futuro” or "Women with a Future," is a microfinance bank composed of ten entrepreneurs seeking their first loan from Esperanza International.  

The community in which this microfinance bank is located has suffered greatly over the past two years.  Less than two years ago, tropical storm activity and rapid flooding destroyed all the member’s homes; in the community and hundreds were killed.  The Dominican government has since provided a new housing community for these affected.  The bank members have been living for less than nine months in government-funded housing and are beginning the process of reestablishing their business activities.  

Gladys, a mother of three (ages: 18, 12, 3) is one of the coordinators for this group in the city of Santiago.  Gladys runs a nail salon and hopes to use her first microfinance loan from Esperanza to buy the materials that she needs for her business, including hand creams and a fan. Each day, Gladys serves between 2-4 clients and dreams of expanding her business so that she may continue to provide for her family.  

Other members of Gladys’s bank run similar entrepreneurial activities, including "colmados," which are small grocery stands and clothing sales.  

On behalf of Esperanza and this group of business entrepreneurs, we would like to thank you for your support!

loans.use: Purchase supplies for nail salon

loans.name: Buena Fe 4 Group

texts.en:
Buena Fe group 4 is made up of 5 people looking to receive their very first loan. Each member is currently living in extreme poverty, and is not living with any of the luxuries that we often take for granted. Each member is hoping to take this first loan and get started on their very own small business. The ideas range from clothing stores to food markets. This loan will give an opportunity to 5 people who have not had many good opportunities in their life, and give them a chance to change their future.

Santa J. is the representative of this group and is extremely excited about this opportunity. Santa is the mother of two young children and realized she needed to do something when she couldn't afford school for both her children. Santa wants nothing more than a better life for her children, and she knows that getting them an education is the only way to do that. She wants to start a small business selling clothing in her area. She plans to buy the clothing from Santo Domingo where she can buy clothing cheap, and then sell it for a profit in her area. She is excited to have something of her own and believes that this is her chance to change her family's life!

Thank you for giving Santa a chance at changing her future!!

loans.use: Buy clothing for their business

loans.name: Las Reinas 1 Group

texts.en:
The members of this group from Las Reinas Bank of Hope are receiving their first loan through Kiva's partner, Esperanza International. These enthusiastic entrepreneurs expect to improve their income and quality of life with their business activities.

Mari B., 25, and Robinson R., 30, are two of the group members. They are both single. Mari has three children and Robinson has one child. Mari sells personal-care products and Robinson sells fruits and vegetables at the local market. Since neither of them completed high school (Mari only reached middle school), both of them are very committed to providing a better education for their children so they can have a better life and hopefully, break the poverty cycle they've been born in.

On behalf of Esperanza International, thank you for supporting these new entrepreneurs!

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for resale

loans.name: Las Reinas 3 Group

texts.en:
Group 3 from Las Reinas Bank of Hope is starting their entrepreneurship adventure with Esperanza International. This is their first loan. They live in Los Guaricanos, a large neighborhood in the northern part of Santo Domingo. Because it is so isolated from the city, employment opportunities are very scarce. People who work in the city have to commute long distances, relying on a very deficient public-transportation system. Under these circumstances, a lot of people have decided to start new businesses and become self-employed.

Emilia H. and EsteL. V. are two of the group members. Emilia is 54, has no children and sells personal-care products. Emilia did not have the opportunity to attend school. EsteL. is 28 and single, with four children that depend completely on her. She runs a small butcher shop. She dreams of making her shop grow so she can become a meat supplier for larger markets.

Thank you for helping these entrepreneurs in their initiatives to build a better future for themselves and their communities!

loans.use: Purchase new products for resale

loans.name: Rashad

texts.en: Rashad was born in 1981. He lives in Khachmaz town. This single man has been in the furniture-making business for five years. Now he needs a loan of 950 AZN to buy the necessary materials for the improvement of his furniture-making business.

loans.use: To buy materials for furniture making

loans.name: Colaboradores 3 Group

texts.en:
Colaboradores 3 is made up of five people trying to receive their third loan with Kiva's partner, Esperanza International. Each member has already started their very own small business, and has started to experience some sort of success.

This group is from an extremely poor area in San Pedro, Dominican Republic, and most have lived in this area their entire lives. Before receiving their first loans, each member was having a hard time providing for their families, let alone themselves. Hopefully this next loan will enable each member to increase the size of their small business, and to improve their standard of living.

Dilcia G. is the representative of this group, and was more than happy to talk to us about her situation and life. Dilcia lives with her husband and her six young children (all under the age of 17). Each day has been a struggle for Dilcia and her husband to feed her six children, and also make sure they are getting to school. She knows that going to school and receiving an education is the only way for her children to break the cycle of poverty, and for that reason she does whatever she can to get them to school.

Before receiving her first loan, Dilcia was not bringing in an income, and just relied on her husband's job. She felt useless, and felt that she was not an important piece of the family. Dilcia took out her first loan and started a small business making and selling food in her area. Since she is an excellent cook and a hard worker, her business did well and she was able to pay back all her loans and save some money.

Now she is going on her third loan, and hopes with this next loan she can expand her business even more. She said she finally feels like a contributer to the family, and feels like she is going to be able to provide her children with everything they could need! She is so happy about having her own small business, and is excited for the future for the first time in her life.

She wants to thank everyone for the help they have provided her! Thanks for all your support and for enabling people like Dilcia to change their future!

loans.use: To buy more products for her food stand

loans.name: Candida Rosa

texts.es: La señora Candida reside en villa reconciliación, tiene 37 años de edad, su negocio es la venta de tortillas, películas de cd y productos de cosméticos, tiene siete años de estar administrando este negocio, inicio con dinero propio y ahorros, y luego con préstamos que Afodenic a otorgado esta es su quinta solicitud la cual va invertir en comprar materia prima como maíz, maseca, leña y gas butano para hacer sus ricas tortillas. Sus planes a corto plazo es poder crecer en inventario, captar clientes.
texts.en:
Candida lives in Villa Reconciliación and is 37 years old. Her business is selling tortillas, DVDs and cosmetic products. She has been running this business for seven years, starting with her own cash and savings and continuing with loans from Afodenic. This is her fifth loan, which she will invest in the purchase of raw materials such as corn, Maseca corn flour mix, firewood and butane gas to make her delicious tortillas. Her short-term plans are to increase her inventory and attract new customers.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase corn, Maseca corn flour mix, firewood and butane gas

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi A. is a fifty year old widow and the mother of five children. All her children are still in school. She is a trader who trades in plantain, cassava, and yam. She buys her stock in bulk from Oda and supplies them to her customers. She is, however, convinced that her business can grow better with increased working capital. She therefore wants this loan to buy more cassava, plantain, and yam to increase her stock and earn a larger income to finance the education of her children.

Esi belongs to the community group called Winners Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and act as peer pressure to repay the loan. Esi desires to work harder to give her children the best education.

loans.use: To buy more cassava, plantain, and yam to sell.

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora A. is a widow and the mother with five children. One of her children is in the training college, while the rest are in the senior and junior high school. She lives with her family at Wasa Simpa in the western region of Ghana. She is 52 years old. She has sold children's wears, like shirts, straight dress, napkins and skirts, underwear, slippers, and dressing bags for over nine years.

She is, however, constrained by funds in running the business. She needs a loan to inject more working capital into the business in order to scale up business progress. She believes the loan will help her to be more resourced. She would be able to purchase a large quantity of high quality goods, upgrading her inventory. She would also be able to cater for the children in school.

Dora says she would be grateful for that assistance. She belongs to a village bank called "Me Hwe Awuarde" which means "Am looking up to God." She also hope to receive GH¢500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase underwear, dressing bags, slippers, and other inventory to sell.

loans.name: Maria Salome

texts.es: Maria Salome mujer trabajadora, su negocio es la venta de fritanga desde hace seis años inicio con ahorros y con prestamos que Afodenic a otorgado. Tiene 44 años de edad, reside en villa reconciliación, con esta solicitud de crédito es la quinta la cual va invertir en comprar productos de consumos diarios, como carnes, granos básicos, verduras y otros para invertir más en su negocio y poder vender a sus clientes la variedad de platillos ricos. A futuro es mejorar la infraestructura del negocio para dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maria Salome is a hardworking woman. Her business is selling fritanga (a fried meat dish), which she started six years ago with her savings and loans from Afodenic. She is 44 years old and lives in Villa Reconciliación. This is her fifth loan, which she will invest in the purchase of daily inputs like meat, basic grains, vegetables and others to be able to sell a variety of dishes to her customers. In the future, she would like to improve the infrastructure of her business so she can improve the service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Trisha Bury, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase meats, basic grains and vegetables to prepare delicious dishes

loans.name: Collins

texts.en:
Collins is thirty-six years old. He is married with two kids, both of whom are in the basic school. He is a taxi driver and has been driving for the past six years. Taxi driving has been his major occupation and the main source of livelihood for his family. He picks passengers up from the local lorry station and takes them to the nearby towns at a transport fare of 50 pesewas (0.5 cedis) per head.

However, his business is in crisis of late because his car has broken down and he needs money for repairs. He therefore requests a loan to enable him to maintain his taxi cab. This will allow him to resume business and earn income to support his family and get his kids back to school.

Collins belongs to the community group called Fervent Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loans and act as peer pressure to repay the loan.

loans.use: To repair his taxi cab.

loans.name: Atta

texts.en:
Atta A. is a 58 year old mother of one child. Her son is called Ebo and he has successfully gained admission to the polytechnic. She lives, along with her husband, and works at Wasa Simpa in the western region of Ghana. Her husband is a crops farmer in the village. Atta is very hard working and resourceful for her family. She trades in charcoal and the sale of bathroom slippers in her neighborhood market. Charcoal is very popular source of energy for cooking in almost all Ghanaian traditional homes.

Atta has been in business for the past ten years. She obtains her supply of charcoal from the surrounding villages of Wasa Simpa and treks to the big cities where she purchases her slippers. She then retails them to her customers. She wants to use this loan to buy a bulk supply of charcoal and bathroom slippers to increase her inventory. She hopes the loan would enable her to increase her savings to pay her child's educational fees.

Atta belongs to a village bank called Cynthia. She also hopes to receive GH¢400 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy a bulk supply of charcoal and bathroom slippers.

loans.name: Karen Maritza

texts.es: La joven Karen reside en un bario que se llama Arlen Siu en la ciudad de Managua, tiene 24 años de edad, reside en Arlen Siu del madroño 6 c al este, con dos hijos de 2 y 7 años edad, su esposo tiene un taxi que trabaja todos los días para llevar el sustento de su familia. Karen se desempeña  como promotora de ventas en un supermercado, ya tiene cuatro años de estar trabajando, con este crédito va a comprar materiales de construcción para hacer mejoras a su casa ya que es de madera y esta ya en mal estado, su anhelo es poder tener una casa segura y digna para su familia. Sus meta es poder seguir estudiando para tener un futuro mejor.
texts.en:
Karen is a young woman who lives in the Arlen Siu del Madroño neighborhood of Managua. She is 24 years old and has two children, 2 and 7 years old. Her husband works every day driving a taxi in order to support their family. Karen works as a sales promoter in a supermarket. She has been working for 4 years and will use this loan to buy construction materials for home improvements. Her house is made of wood and is in poor condition—her desire is to have a safe and dignified home for her family. Her goal is to be able to continue with school so she will have a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction materials for home improvements

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca O. is thirty-four years old. She is married with four children: two girls and two boys. All her children are currently in the elementary school. Rebecca works hard to support her husband to take care of the home. She runs a cold store in the local market square. She sells fresh fish and meat, such as chicken, pork, beef, and turkey. She procures her goods from big cold stores in Tema and retails them to her customers. Most of her customers are food vendors in her community.

Rebecca has been in business for five years. She wants a loan to buy goods in bulk and also acquire bigger refrigerators. She hopes to increase her profit margin to enable her save more to support her family, especially her children’s education. Rebecca is a member of Winners Trust Bank group in which the members guarantee for one another as collateral to access loans.

loans.use: To buy fish and meat in bulk and also acquire bigger refrigerators.

loans.name: Tofig

texts.en: Tofig is 33 years old. He lives in the Khachmaz region in the Ashagi-Zeyid village. He is married and has two children. Five years ago he started a cattle breeding business. Now he needs a loan of 950 AZN to buy two calves to improve his cattle breeding business.

loans.use: To buy two calves.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia A. is 27 years old. She is a married woman with three kids. Her first-born is in the junior high school while the rest are still in the elementary school. She lives with her family at Tarkwa in the western region of Ghana. For the past four years Cecilia has been baking bread to take care of her household. In spite of the challenges, Cecilia is making business progress. She bakes bread and retails them to her customers. She says that she gives the best value for the money by making sure that her food quality meets her customer’s expectation. Her customers book their orders in advance and before they come it is ready. She also retails to individuals for their morning breakfast.

Cecilia says that the prices of commodities are increasing, which makes it difficult to buy more raw materials from the market. The daily demand for bread is high: she bakes up to 500 loaves of bread in a day. Cecilia needs a loan to buy more bags of flour, sugar, margarine, milk, and firewood. She says that your assistance would be much welcome. Cecilia belongs to a village bank called Cynthia. She also hope to receive GH¢700 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast, and firewood.

loans.name: Vlas

texts.en:
For more than 11 years Vlas Atanasie has been in the business of growing red fibber, cabbage and melons. Using advanced technology and buying seeds from specialized enterprises, he grows both in his greenhouse and in an arable field located in the delta, thereby ensuring steady access to water. 

Assisted by his family, Vlas sells his produce to the wholesale market in Cahul district. Oleg performs all the work that is necessary, control, execution, production, etc. The business could be a very profitable one if vegetables will be cultivated in a larger area. Oleg's future plans are to increase the number of greenhouses.

loans.use: To increase the number of greenhouses.

loans.name: Gniné

texts.fr:
Madame Gniné Samaké est âgée de 30 ans et vit avec ses  4 enfants et son mari dans une famille monogamme  dans le quartier Faraba de Bougouni(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
 Elle fait le commerce d’articles divers qu’elle commença dès son âge auprès de sa mère. Avec une expérience de 15ans Madame Gniné Samaké maîtrise son activité et est appréciée des habitants de Bougouni.
Afin d’obtenir une ressource financière  complémentaire, Madame Gniné Samaké décida de collaborer  avec Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son premier individuel.
Elle veut  acheter, 15 draps de lit et de 50 paires de chausures de toutes catégories  au Burkina Faso et à Bamako (capitale de republique du Mali). Elle effectue ses ventes dans les differents quartiers de Bougouni mais aussi au marché les jours de foires. 
Elle compte réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000 FCFA. Avec ce bénéfice elle envisage agrandir son entreprise afin de devenir grossiste.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gniné Samaké is 30 years old and lives with her 4 children and her husband in a monogamous household in the Faraba district of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). She has a business selling various items, which she started at a young age with her mother. With over 15 years of experience, Mrs. Gniné Samaké has mastered her business and is valued by the residents of Bougouni. In order to obtain additional financial resources, Mrs. Gniné Samaké decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom she is on her first individual loan. She would like to buy 15 bedsheets and 50 pairs of shoes of all types in Burkina Faso and in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali). She makes her sales in different areas of Bougouni and also at the market during market-days. With this loan, she intends to realize a monthly profit of 30,000 FCFA. With this profit, she foresees enlarging her business with the goal of becoming a wholesaler.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bedsheets and shoes

loans.name: Tahira

texts.en: Tahira, 45 years old and the mother of one child, lives in Khachmaz Region, in Armud-Padar village.  She has six years of experiences in cattle breeding, and is now requesting a loan of 950 AZN to buy two calves to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy two calves.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
The married mother of two children who are currently in school, 37-year-old Cynthia P. lives with her family in the western part of Ghana. For three years, this very hardworking woman has been trading in garment cloths and lace materials, the latter of which are very popular in room and office decorations. She treks regularly to Kumasi to buy her stock of goods, but a lack of working capital prevents her from buying in bulk, so she is now requesting a loan to purchase bulk supplies of lace materials, garment cloths and textiles.

Cynthia, who belongs to a village bank called ‘Cynthia,’ believes the loan will enable her to grow her business, and she hopes to use some of her additional profit to provide quality education for her children.

loans.use: To purchase bulk lace materials and textiles.

loans.name: Maryuri Elisabeth

texts.es: Maryuri a sus 23 años de edad, tiene un negocio de prendas de plata y oro laminado, negocio que inicio con ayuda en microfinacieras, tiene cuatro años de estar en las ventas y ha captado muchos clientes ya que vende con la facilidad al crédito. Abecés hay clientes que no le paga la mercadería el cual es una perdida económica. Tiene 23 años de edad, reside en el barrio Manuel Fernández tiene una niña de 7 años de edad, que cursa el primer grado, su esposo trabaja en una empresa de atónica como pulidor. Con este préstamo va a invertir en más prendas de oro y plata ya que se vende bastante y espera comprar variedad que gusten a sus clientes y a si poder vender y ganar más dinero.  Sus planes es poder tener su propia casa ya que vive en la casa de la mama en un cuarto. Da las gracias Afodenic por el apoyo que le ha brindado con los préstamo a si espera seguir invirtiendo para hacer su casa ya que es uno de sus anhelo
texts.en:
Maryuri is 23 and has a silver and gold-plated jewelry business that she began with the help of micro finance. She has worked for four years in sales and has attracted many customers since she sells with the ease of credit. Sometimes there are clients who do not pay for their merchandise and this is an economic loss. She is 23 years old, resides in the Manuel Fernández neighborhood, and has a daughter who is seven years old and is in first grade. Her husband works for a company as a polisher. She will invest this loan in more gold and silver jewelry since it sells pretty well and she hopes to buy an assortment that her customers will like and then be able to sell more and earn more money. She plans to be able to have her own house since she lives in a room in her mom's house. She thanks Afodenic for the support they have given her with the loans and she hopes to continue investing to be able to make her own house since it is one of her desires.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy gold and silver jewelry

loans.name: Jairo Joel

texts.en:
Jairo Joel R., the 30-year-old married father of a five-year old son, has been running a discount retail store for over ten years, having risen during that time from being a simple market vendor of goods to the owner of his own shop. Through the help of other loans with Fundación León 2000, Jairo Joel has been able to build a consistent clientele, increase his monthly revenue, and thereby improve his family’s life.

Jairo Joel is asking for a Kiva loan in order to increase both his inventory of discount goods and the breadth of his contact with potential clients. He dreams of opening a larger shop with a much greater variety of products, and believes he can accomplish this goal with the assistance of Kiva lenders. Jairo Joel is asking you to support a loan of C$4,600, to be paid back over the course of eight months.

loans.use: To increase the variety of products in his shop.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es: Luzmila tiene 59 años, vive con su esposo y el menor D. sus hijos D. 24 años. DesD. niña se ha dedicado a las tareas agrícolas porque nunca se alejó D. su tierra natal donD. hasta ahora vive, pero por la avanzada edad que tiene ahora, optó por vender animales, principalmente cerdos. Luzmila tiene 2 cerdos hembras que cada 4 meses dan cría, después D. 1 a 2 meses D. nacidos los venD., obteniendo las ganancias necesarias. Todas las mañanas sale a cortar el pasto D. sus cultivos para darles D. comer a sus animales, D. esta manera ya no es un gran gasto el alimentar a sus animales. Luzmila reconoce que existen algunos riesgos en la crianza D. animales, como el que las crías D. sus cerdos mueran a temprana edad, lo cual disminuye sus ganancias, sin embargo, sigue trabajando para salir adelante en la mejora D. su granja. Es la tercera vez que Luzmila tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está muy satisfecha por la labor que desempeña en su banco comunal donD. toda oportunidad es buena para mantener unido al grupo. La cantidad que está solicitando es para invertir en la mejora D. la infraestructura D. su pequeño establo. Arreglará el techo y también comprará 2 sacos D. abono para una pequeña extensión D. terreno donD. tiene sus cultivos, ya que su cosecha le sirve para su consumo propio.
texts.en:
Luzmila is 59 years old and lives with her husband and their youngest son, who is 24 years old. Since she was a girl, she has been dedicated to agricultural chores becuase she has never moved away from the land where she was born, which is where she still lives today. However, due to her old age, she has chosen to sell animals now, mainly pigs. Luzmila has two female pigs that are each four months pregnant; after a month or two, she will sell the piglets, obtaining a necessary earning. Every morning she goes out to cut the pasture so she can give the animals something to eat; this way feeding the animals is not a big expense. Luzmila recognizes that there are some risks in raising animals, such as if the newborn piglets died at a young age decreasing her earnings. Nevertheless, she continues working to improve her farm.

This is the third time that Luzmila has accepted a loan form MFP, and she is very happy that the work she does in her community bank gives them an opportunity to keep a good united group. The quantity that she is requesting is to invest in the improvement of the structure of her little stable. She will fix the roof and also buy two sacks of manure fertilizer for a little extension of land where she has her fields, since that her harvest there is for her family's consumption.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fix her stable

loans.name: Etibar

texts.en: Etibar, 28 and single, lives in Khachmaz Region, Armud-Padar village, where he started a cattle-breeding business three years ago. He is now requesting a loan of 950 AZN to buy three calves for his business.

loans.use: To buy three calves

loans.name: Adwoa

texts.en:
Adwoa Y., a 50-year-old food vendor and member of a village bank called ‘Cynthia,’ lives in the village of Wasa Simpa in the western part of Ghana with her husband, who is a farmer, and their five children, one of whom has finished senior high school, while the others are still in school.  

Adwoa has been in business for the past six years selling kenkey as well as maize. Kenkey, prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and eaten with hot pepper and fried fish, is enjoyed by many Ghanaians for breakfast, lunch and supper. Adwoa therefore has a good base of customers and is now requesting a loan to buy more raw materials including bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood, hoping to thereby increase her savings to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials including bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es: Mery tiene 43 años, vive con  su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Tiene más de 10 años de experiencia en la crianza de animales, todos los días cuida y alimenta a sus vacas de donde extrae diariamente su leche, la cual llega a vender diariamente hasta 20 litros. Su principal comprador es una empresa de productos lácteos que viene a comprarle todos los días en las mañanas, por lo que cuida mucho de que sus vacas para que sigan produciendo la misma o mayor cantidad de leche. Ahora  Mery está planeando aumentar la cantidad de vacas que tiene para vender  más litros de leche, su deseo es tener un establo lechero de gran demanda. Esta es la tercera vez que  Mery tiene un préstamo con MFP, y durante este tiempo es una de las que promueve la unidad del grupo que integra. Además, le agrada trabajar en su banco comunal porque tiene sus ahorros. Con el dinero que solicita comprará un par de carneros para aumentar la cantidad animales que tiene. Cada carnero está valorizado en 250 soles por ser de buena raza.
texts.en:
Mery is 43 years old, and lives with her husband and two children in a house they own. She has more than 10 years of experience in the raising of animals, caring and feeding her cows on a daily basis. She obtains milk from them, selling up to 20 liters each day. Her primary buyer is a dairy products enterprise that buys from her every morning. For this reason, she takes great care of her livestock so that they will continue producing as much – or more – milk. Currently, Mery is planning to increase the number of cows she has so she can sell more liters of milk. Her wish is to have a dairy stable that is in great demand. This is the third time Mery has a loan with MFP and, during this period, she is one of the ones who most promotes unity among the group she belongs to. In addition, she enjoys working with her community bank because she has her savings. With the funds she is requesting, she will purchase a pair of rams to increase the number of animals she has. Each ram is valued at 250 Peruvian soles for being from a good breed.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a pair of well-bred rams.

loans.name: Gutu

texts.en: Gutu N. has 1.5 hectares of grapevines and grows several varieties of grapes for making wine. The vineyard was inherited from his parents, and he has continued their business of selling the grapes to the processing plant in the village for the production of wine. He also has approximately 4 hectares of arable land and this year he grew 2.5 hectares of tobacco, 1.5 hectares of maize and the rest in sunflowers. He can generally expect a large harvest. Gutu also works with animals and has done so for more than 12 years, raising pigs and sheep for his own consumption as well as for selling. He needs a loan from Microinvest in order to purchase chemicals for spraying and to buy other supplies necessary for the maintenance of his vines.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals for spraying and other supplies to maintain grapevines.

loans.name: Asociacion De Cristo Group

texts.en:
Asociacion D. Cristo is a group comprised of 15 people, all from the same area in San Pedro, Dominican Republic. Each member has already received a previous loan, and gotten a start on their own small business. This will actually be the third loan that each member receives, and each member has experienced success with their previous two loans. Many members didn't have any form of income before their first loan, so this is their opportunity to change their lives, and to have a more hopeful future.

Alicia P. is the chosen group representative, and it's obvious why because she is fun and outgoing. She is the mother of 4 children and lives with them and her husband. Before her first loan she didn't contribute any money to the family and had to rely completely on her husband. She felt useless and wanted to do more. She loves her children more than anything and knew that she needed to start making some money to help give them a better life. She then went to Esperanza International and took out her first loan. With the loan she started a small fruit and vegetable business in her area. She is a diligent worker and through time she was able to pay back all her loans and save some money.

Now she is hoping to receive her third loan, which will enable her to start selling a wider variety of fruits and vegetables. She is happy with the way her business is running and believes that she can continue to expand. She is now an important contributor to her family and feels that she can proviD. for her children. She dreams of putting all her children through college, and she is on the right path! For the first time in her life she is excited for the future and knows she is going to break the cycle of poverty. On behalf of Alicia and Esperanza International---- Thank you for your support!!!

loans.use: Buy more products to sell

loans.name: Merlyn Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Merlyn tiene una pulpería que administra desde hace cinco años, ella inicio con apoyo de su papa el cual presto dinero para que iniciara una venta para que se ayudara. Tiene 39 años de edad, reside en el barrio Francisco Salazar, con tres hijos, uno trabaja y dos estudian, sus planes es poder ayudar a sus hijos que estudien para que sean personas de bien, con este préstamo que esta haciendo es para comprar productos de consumo diario como, carnes, pollo, granos básicos que son del sustento diario de la población. Sus objetivos a corto plazo es poder crecer en inventario para cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y poder dar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Merlyn has had a grocery store for five years. She started out with her father’s help, through a loan he gave her to start a business so she could help herself. She is 39 years old and lives in the Francisco Salazar neighborhood with three children. One of her children works, and the other two are still in school. Her plans include supporting them with their educations so that they will become people of means. With this loan she is taking she will buy basic staples such as meats, chicken, grains, all of which make up part of the population’s daily sustenance. Her short-term objective is to grow her inventory to meet customer demand and provide a better level of service.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase meats and basic grains.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A. is a 37 year old local restaurant operator. She is married and has three children but only two of them attend school. She lives at Berekum in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Comfort's husband is very supportive and provides for the basic needs of the family.   

She prepares and sells local foods like fufu, banku and other local dishes. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, taken with all kinds of soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and is taken with hot pepper or soup. With her tasty meals she has attracted lots of customers from the area.  It has become necessary to employ additional workers to assist her in her food delivery service. 

Comfort says prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her to meet her production expenditures. With the loan she wants to purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to prepare the meals. She would be grateful for that assistance. Comfort belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyame Bekyere’ meaning ‘God will provide’. She hopes that restocking her inventory will make her business progress. This would enable her to save more money and to help her husband take care of the children's educational needs.

loans.use: To buy raw materials like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Elchin

texts.en: Elchin is 25 years old and single. He first opened his general store two years ago.  He lives in Armud-Padar village in the Khachmaz region. He needs a loan to buy more products in order to improve his business.

loans.use: Buy more products

loans.name: Dionicio Guadalupe

texts.es: El señor Dionicio tiene un taxi que desde hace diecinueve años compro con ahorros, y es el  que trabaja día a día en toda la ciudad de Managua, para el sustento de su familia. Tiene 52 años de edad, reside en villa reconciliación, su esposa le tiene cuatro hijos de 10, 19,20 y 22 años de edad, el mayor trabaja y los otros van a clase. Con esta solicitud que esta haciendo es su cuarto ciclo el cual va invertir en comprar materiales de construcción para construir su casa y poder ofrecer a su familia una casa digna. Sus objetivos es poder comprar otra unidad de taxi para dar un mejor servicio a  sus clientes.
texts.en:
Dionicio has a taxi that he bought nineteen years ago with his savings. He works each and every day throughout the city of Managua to provide sustenance for his family. He is 52 years old, and lives in Villa Reconciliación with his wife and four children ages 10, 19, 20 and 22. The oldest works, and the others attend school. With this request he is making his fourth loan, which he will invest in construction materials to build his house and be able to offer his family a dignified abode. His objective is to buy another taxi so he can provide a better service to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to make improvements to his house.

loans.name: Mujeres En Gloria 1 Group

texts.en:
Mujeres en Gloria 1 is a group consisting of 5 strong women who want to take out a loan. This is not a gift they are asking for, but a loan from which they can start their own small business. In the area they come from, credit is not readily available unless they borrow from a loan shark who charges unreasonable interest. In the immense poverty they live in, it is hard to find jobs and hard to support a family. For that reason Mujeres en Gloria are hoping to receive a loan and start their own business. This group is ready to work to try and break the chains of poverty.

Isaura N. is the group leader and their representative, and she is very excited about being given the honor. She lives with her husband and her one child. She has not had an easy life. She has had to live in extreme poverty her entire life. Isaura received a high school education, which is more than most in her area. She knows that education is something that is very important if you want to break out of poverty, and for that reason she dreams of sending her child to a university someday. Isaura has a small food stand where she sells items she cooks, but with a loan she will be able to increase the variety of food she sells, and hopefully increase her profit. She is an intelligent, hard working woman who wants nothing more than to improve the life of her child. She is ready to expand her business and is excited about the opportunity. She knows this is the first step in achieving her dream of putting her child through college, and she is ready to take the first step. On behalf of Isaura, the group, and Esperanza International----- Thank you for your support!!!

loans.use: Buy products for food stand

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary A. started selling fish five years ago in Kato, a suburb of Berekum in the Brong Ahafo region where she lives. Mary prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish and, because of that, many customers buy from her stand. She is now 48 years old, divorced, and the mother of one child who is currently a senior in high school. Mary is requesting a loan to increase her stock of assorted fish which will increase sales and income. The additional income will be used to support her child's education and to grow the business. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Awurade Yekese’ which means ‘God is Big’.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of smoked and dried fish.

loans.name: Abdurahim

texts.ru:
Абдурахим парень 30 лет, женат и воспитывает 2 детей. 10 лет назад он пошел учеником к мастеру по выпечке национального таджикского хлеба – лепешки. Постепенно он выучился этому ремеслу и решил открыть свое дело. Для того чтобы реализовать свою затею он переехал за 100 километров от своего дома из Худжанда в Исфару. Поначалу его бизнес был маленьким и приносил мало дохода. Постепенно он приобрел постоянных клиентов которые стали брать у него лепешки и продавали на местных рынках. Дальше к нему присоединился его старший брат, который непосредственно выпекал лепешки, а Абдурахим в свою очередь стал заниматься реализацией. На сегодня Абдурахим за день выпекает 600 лепешек, которые распределяет между 4 магазинами и базаром. За эти 10 лет он не только поставил на ноги свой бизнес, но женился, купил дом и обставил его мебелью. 
Абдурахим также создал 3 рабочих места и сейчас планирует нанять еще одного работника для развоза лепешек по другим базарам. Узнав о Микроинвест Абдурахим решил подать заявку и планирует приобрести муку и уголь для своей лепешечной.
texts.en:
Abdurahim is a 30 year old man, he is married and raises two children. Ten years ago he became and apprentice to a baker learning how to make national Tajik flatbreads. Gradually he became good at this craft and decided to start his own business. To make his idea possible he had to move a hundred kilometers away from his home in Khudjanda to Isfara. In the beginning his business was small and brought little profits. But gradually he has acquired regular customers who bought his flatbreads and resold on local markets. Later his older brother joined his business who also helped with baking the breads and Abdurahim went into distribution. Today Abdurahim produces 600 flatbreads a day which he distributes among four stores and a market. During these ten years has not only developed his business, but also married, bought a new house and furnished it. Abdurahim also created three jobs and plans to hire another employee for delivery of the breads to other markets. When he heard about MicroInvest Adburahim decided to apply for a loan to buy flour and coal for his bakery.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour and coal

loans.name: Fatima De Los Angeles

texts.es: Doña Fátima es una mujer trabajadora, vende ropa usada ya que es un negocio rentable por que sus clientes compran mucho por sus precios accesibles y bonitas prendas de vestir. Tiene 52 años de edad, reside en laureles norte, con un hijo mayor que le apoya. Con la solicitud de crédito quiere comprar más ropa para tener un mayor inventario. Sus planes es poder mejorar la infraestructura de su casa a si como poner una tienda de ropa con vitrinas para atraer  a los clientes lo cual espera lograr a corto plazo.
texts.en:
Fátima is a hard-working woman who sells used clothing, which is a profitable business. Her customers buy a great deal of her products due to her reasonable prices and attractive clothes. She is 52 years old, and lives in Laureles Norte with a grown son who supports her. With the request for this loan, she would like to buy more clothing to increase her inventory. Her plans include improving the infrastructure of her house, as well as to install a clothing store with display cases to attract customers. She hopes to accomplish this soon.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Issah

texts.en:
Issah B. has been trading in the local market of Berekum in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana, where she lives with her family. She is 48 years old, divorced, and the mother of three children; one is in school. She is a busy petty trader who sells tomatoes and other foodstuffs like beans, onions, peppers, and ginger, on the top of a table in the market. She does not have sufficient working capital to run the business which retards her business progress.

Issah buys her stock of goods from Kumasi. With the loan, she wants to inject more working capital into the business to purchase increased stocks to revive the business. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyame Tumi’ which means ‘God’s Power’. She hopes to receive GHS 600 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase increased stocks of onions, tomatoes and ginger, etc.

loans.name: Bahtier

texts.ru: Бахтиёру 33 года, женат, воспитывает 3 детей. За свою жизнь он занимался разными видами предпринимательства, но на сегодня остановился на купле продаже поддержанных автомобилей. Это приносит основной доход в его семью.  Жена нигде не работает и на Бахтиере лежит вся тяжесть семейных расходов. Бахтиер планирует на полученный займ добавив свои собственные средства приобрести поддержанный Опель.
texts.en:
Bahtier is 33 years old, married and has three children. All his life he had many different businesses, but today he has chosen to continue selling used vehicles. This gives a steady income for his family. His wife does not work anywhere and Bahtier carries the sole responsibility of household expenses. Bahtier plans to use the loan and some of his own money to buy a used Opel.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a used Opel

loans.name: Nabiya

texts.ru: Набия работает в государственном учреждении в городе Исфара. Ей 44 года, воспитывает 4 детей. Недавно она засватала за своего сына девушку и собирается организовать торжественное бракосочетание. Для осуществления своего плана ей не хватило некоторой суммы денег и поэтому она обратилась за займом.
texts.en:
Nabiya works in a government agency in the city of Isfara. She is 44 years old and raises four children. Just recently her son got engaged to a girl and she is planning to organize a festive wedding ceremony. She is short on a certain amount of money so to realize her plans she is asking for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To host a wedding celebration

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
This is an entrepreneur who believes in hard work. She has been in the sale of foodstuffs like maize and crates of eggs for the past seven years. She is called Mary K. and she is 56 years old, married with eight children. All her kids are in school.

Mary lives at Berekum, a suburb of Sunyani, in Ghana. She treks to the surrounding villages to buy her foodstuffs (maize) and crates of eggs and transports them to the regional capitals for sale. She says it is a very lucrative business. Trading in foodstuffs has been her major source of livelihood because it has a big market share.

Her major challenge has been with adequate funds to make business progress. Mary requests this loan to buy more maize (cereals) and crates of eggs to increase her inventory even in the lean season. Mary belongs to a village bank called ‘Haggai’. She hopes to receive GHS 800 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: to buy more maize (cereals) and crates of eggs

loans.name: Ayub

texts.ru: Мелиев Аюб молодой парень, неженат. Проживает со своими родителями и чтобы помочь своим родителям занимается мелким предпринимательством – выпекает национальный хлеб лепешки. Оборот его бизнеса небольшой, но приносит хорошую прибыль и поддерживает семейный бюджет. Чтобы увеличить количество выпекаемых лепешек Аюб решил получить займ. На полученные деньги он собирается купить муку и уголь.
texts.en:
Ayub M. is a young man, he is not married. He lives with his parents and helps them by running a small business - he bakes Tajik national flatbreads. His turnover is not very big, but gives him a good income which supports the family budget. To increase the amount of his production of flatbreads Ayub has decided to get a loan. He will use the loan to buy flour and coal.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour and coal

loans.name: Mujeres En Victoria 2 Group

texts.en:
"Mujeres en Victoria 2" is a group comprised of 5 women who are hoping to receive their first loan. Each member comes from an extremely poor area in Santo Domingo, and most have no form of real income. Each member sees this as a chance to change their future and provide their families with a better life. With these loans the members hope to start their own small business, or for some, to enhance the small business they have. If these members can start a small business and pay back their loans on time they can receive a second larger loan, and hopefully continue to raise their incomes.

Daleni P. is the representative of this group, and a great worker. Daleni received a high school education which is more than most people in her situation. She started a small stand a while back, but does not have the resources to really make her business grow. She hopes to take this loan and invest it into her business, and create a bigger store with a variety of products. She has one child, and wants to be able to provide her child with everything he will need to break out of poverty. She knows that education is the key and wants to send him to a university someday. She has always dreamed of having college-educated children, and she says she is going to make that dream a reality. She is ready to break out of her poverty, and is ready to work hard. She knows she has a bright future, and her children an even brighter one! Thank you for your support!

loans.use: Buy products for store

loans.name: Kurbon

texts.ru: Охонов Курбон в прошлом работал председателем небольшого джамоата. Ему 66 лет, женат, воспитал 6 детей. Все его дети уже обзавелись своими семьями и кроме самого младшего сына проживают отдельно от родителей. Зарабатываемых сыном денег вполне хватает на сносную жизнь. После выхода на пенсию Курбона назначили помощником директора средней общеобразовательной школы. Недавно Курбон отремонтировал свой дом и решил обставить его мебелью. Подсчитав свои сбережения Курбон решил получить займ, так как  немного не хватило на покупку всей мебели. Для этого он обратился в МикроИнвест.
texts.en:
Kurbon O. has worked in the past as a president of a small local government organization. He is 66 years old, married and has raised six children. All of his children already have their own families and everyone besides his youngest son live separately from parents. His son's money are more than enough for a decent living. After his retirement Kurbon received a position as an assistant principle in a secondary school. Just recently Kurbon has remodeled his house and decided to furnish it. After counting his savings he decided to get a loan because he was a little bit short on money to buy all of the furniture. He has come to MicroInvest for the loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: для покупки мебели

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida K. is married and the mother of three kids who are currently in school. She is a 32-year-old trader. She lives with her husband and children in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. She is a very hard-working woman who has been struggling to cater for her children for five years now. She trades in garment cloths and lace materials. Lace material is very useful in room and office decorations.

Vida treks to Kumasi to buy her stock of goods. For lack of adequate working capital, Vida buys only a few stocks of lace materials and garment cloths and sells through hawking. For this reason she is requesting loan support for her business to make business progress.
