Vida believes the loan will enable her to grow her business to the expected level. With the loan, she wants to purchase lace materials, garment cloths, and textile in bulk. She hopes to use part of her profit to provide her children with quality education. She belongs to the village bank called ‘Awurade Yekese’ which means ‘God is Big’. She hopes to receive GHS 600 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase lace materials and textiles in bulk

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet O. has been trading in the local market of Berekum in the Brong Ahafo Region of Ghana, where she lives with her family. She is 42 years old, married with three children. Her husband is a trader. She is a busy petty trader who sells tomatoes and other foodstuffs such as beans, onions, peppers, carrots, green peppers and salad leaves on top of table in the market.

Janet does not have sufficient working capital to run the business which retards her business progress. With the loan, she wants to inject more working capital into the business to purchase increased stocks to revive the business. She believes the loan will enable her to purchase good quality stock to upgrade her inventory. She would be grateful for your assistance. Janet belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyame Tumi’ which means ‘God’s Power’. She hopes to receive GHS 800 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase increased stock of palm oil, tinned tomatoes, yams, onions, beans, maize, dried fish, etc.

loans.name: Nosirhucha

texts.ru: Носирхуча потомственный пекарь. Его дед, затем отец, а теперь и он занимаются этим ремеслом. Каждый день Носирхуча рано утром уже раскладывает готовые лепешки (национальный таджикский хлеб) на прилавке и в течении нескольких часов полностью продает их. Носирхуче 24 года, он женат. Оборот его бизнеса большой и позволяет содержать не только семью самого Носирхучи, но и родителей и своего старшего брата. На сегодняшний день цена на муку и уголь низкие и поэтому Носирхуча решил получить займ, чтобы закупить их оптом.
texts.en:
Nosirhucha is a hereditary baker. His grandfather and father were too, a now he has inherited this skill. Every day, early in the morning Nosirhucha is already putting up the flatbreads (Tajik national bread) for sale on the counter and sells them out in a few hours. Nosirhucha is 24 years old, he is married. The turnaround of his business is big which allows not only support Nosirhucha's family, but also his parents and older brother. Today the price for flour and coal is low and this is why Nosirhucha decided to apply for a loan to buy the stuff in wholesale.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour and coal

loans.name: Jose Armengol

texts.es: El señor José Armengol Pavón habita en el barrio San Caralampio de la concepción junto a su esposa y hijos, la esposa tiene una pulpería ubicada en la casa de habitación, don José es agricultor y comerciante; él vende en el mercado de Rivas ya que tiene hermanas que habitan en ese sector, ellos tiene a su cargo un hijo ya que el mayor de ellos trabaja y le apoya con los gastos del hogar. Don Armengol tiene siete ciclo trabajando en Afodenic y esta contento con el apoyo que se le ha brindado lo cual ha mejorado tanto en el  cultivo, como sus condiciones de vida. Esta vez necesita financiamiento para la compra de fertilizantes y aplicarle al cultivo de piña para obtener una buena cosecha y vender a mejor precio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Mr. José Armengol Pavón lives in the neighborhood of San Caralampio de la Concepción with his wife and children. His wife has a small grocery store located in the house in which they live. José is a farmer and merchant; he sells in the market in Rivas given that he has sisters that live in that area. Jose and his wife have under their charge one child as the older one works and helps with household expenses. Mr. Armengol is on his seventh loan cycle with Afodenic and is happy with the support that they have given him which has improve his crops as well as his standard of living. This time he is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizers to apply to his pineapple crop to obtain a good harvest which he will be able to sell at a better price in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides to improve his crop.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth Y. is 50 years old. She is a married woman with three kids. Her first-born is at the university whilst the rest have also completed school. She lives with her family at Dorma Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. For the past five years, Elizabeth has been baking bread to earn a living for her household. In spite of the challenges Elizabeth is making business progress. She bakes bread and retails it to her customers. She says, she gives best value for money by making sure that her food quality meets her customers' expectations. Her customers book their order in advance and before they come it is ready. She also retails to individuals for their morning breakfast.

She says the price of commodities is increasing which is making it difficult to buy more raw materials from the market. And the daily demand for bread is high. She says she bakes at most 600 loaves of bread in a day. Elizabeth needs the loan to buy more bags of flour, sugar, margarine, milk and firewood, etc. She said your assistance would be most welcome. Elizabeth belongs to a village bank called ‘Nyame Tumi’ which means ‘God’s Power’. She hopes to receive GHS 700 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast, and firewood, etc.

loans.name: Máximo

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León el señor Máximo A. se dedica a su negocio de venta de artesanías como lo son alcancías elaboradas con barro las cuales son comercializadas en su puesto de venta que con mucho esfuerzo posee.

El motivo por el cual ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel es para obtener un crédito para la compra de las mercancías puesto que se le están agotando y requiere adquirirlas de inmediato para así continuar con su negocio en su localidad.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Telicia of the city of León, Máximo A. dedicates himself to his business in the sale of handicrafts, particularly clay piggy banks which he sells at his sales stand which he owns after much effort. The reason for which Máximo is looking for the support from Ceprodel is to obtain a loan to purchase merchandise given that his stock is running out and he needs to acquire more immediately to be able to continue running his business in his locale.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase handicrafts.

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es:
El señor Eleuterio M. se dedica a su trabajo de venta de artesanías en el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León. Es importante destacar que el señor Eleuterio es viudo y con cuatro hijos que mantener y es por esta razón que duplica sus esfuerzos para mantener a sus amados hijos.

Al darse cuenta que las artesanías como lo son las alcancías de barro se están agotando ha solicitado un crédito para la compra de dichos productos ya que le es de mucha necesidad adquirirlos en este momento.
texts.en:
Mr. Eleuterio M. dedicates himself to his work in the sale of handicrafts in the municipality of Telica in the city of León. It is important to emphasize that Eleuterio is widowed with four children whom he supports and it is for this reason that he doubles his efforts to be able for maintain his beloved children. When he noticed that his handicrafts, which are clay piggy banks, were running out he solicited a loan for purchase of said products given that it is very necessary for him to acquire more at this moment.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase handicrafts.

loans.name: Pedro Simón

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León el señor Pedro B. se dedica arduamente a su trabajo de ganadería y a la crianza de aves y gallinas.

Al darse cuenta de la necesidad de invertir en su actividad, el señor B. ha decidido construir el local donde guarda los animales y para esto requiere de ciertos materiales de construcción para llevar a cabo esta obra pero muy confiadamente ha acudido a Ceprodel confiando que su crédito será otorgado y de esta forma saldrá adelante en su actividad.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Telica in the city of León, Mr. Pedro B. arduously dedicates himself to his livestock and to raising birds and chickens. When he recognized the need to invest in his work, Mr. B. decided to construct a place to keep his animals and for this he requires certain construction materials to accomplish the task at hand. Trustingly he has sought Ceprodel believing that his loan request will be granted and with this he will be able to move forward in his work.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a chicken coop.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce K. is 32 years old. She is married and has given birth to two children who are in school. She has been selling silverware and plastic utensils like plates, buckets, bowls, cooking utensils etc. for three years now. Recently she added the sale of sachet mineral water which is frequently demanded by her customers to her product line. For the cooking utensils, she sells through hawking, that is, door-to-door selling. She manages to balance that with the sale of the sachet mineral water. Demand for her goods is booming. She sells during the market days that fall on Monday in Dorma Ahenkro market.

She is requesting a loan to augment her working capital to buy more stock of silverware and plastic materials to sell. She believes the loan will enable her to raise more income to support her family. Joyce belongs to a village bank called ‘Haggai’. She also hope to receive GHS 900 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more to support her children in school.

loans.use: To buy more cooking utensils and plastics bowls and oranges

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
El señor Francisco S. se dedica a la actividad de crianza de cerdos en su localidad del municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León. Es importante destacar que el señor S. ha logrado salir adelante y mantener su núcleo familiar que tanto requiere de él.

La razón por la cual ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los cerdos ya que así lo requiere y de esta forma sale adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
Señor Francisco S. is dedicated to the breeding of hogs in his area of the municipality of Telica in the city of León. It is important to emphasize that Señor S. has managed to do well and to maintain his nuclear family that needs him so much. The reason why he has contacted Ceprodel is to request a credit for the purchase of hogs, since he requires it and in this way he will get ahead in his business.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de cerdos

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Married with two children, Ruth G. is a fifty-one-year-old trader. She trades in maize. She has been trading for the past twenty years and has been very resourceful to her family. She treks to the farming communities such as Techieman in the Brong Ahafo region to buy her foodstuffs and retails them to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy a larger supply of maize to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country. She hopes to receive GHS 700 to make business progress by restocking her inventory. This would enable her to save more to support her children in school. Ruth belongs to a village bank called ‘Enoch’.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of maize

loans.name: Jose Leonel

texts.es: El señor José Leonel tiene la edad de 38 años, habita en el kilómetro. 11 ½ carretera a Masaya entrada Esquípulas, todavía no es casado vive con su mamá y trabaja como Administrador de cybernik, los sueños de don José es llegar a tener su propio negocio y lograr mejorar la casa de su mamá ya que en un futuro piensa casarse y formar una familia .La mayor necesidad que tiene es la falta de financiamiento, ya que lo que el gana aporta parte para la casa y sus propios gastos. El solicita la cantidad de C$ 8.000.00 para comprar materiales de construcción y poder mejorar parte de la vivienda y poder sentirse sastifecho con los logros
texts.en:
Señor José Leonel is 38 years old and lives in the 11 1/2 km of the highway to Masaya entering Esquípulas. As of yet he is not married. He lives with his mother and works as a Administrator of an Internet cafe. José dreams of one day owning his own business and to manage to improve his mother's house, since in the future he hopes to be married and to form a family. His greater need is for financing, since what he earns he contributes partly for the house and partly for his own expenses. He requests the amount of C$ 8.000 ($400 US) to buy building materials to be able to improve part of the dwelling and to be able to feel satisfied with the progress.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Comprar materiales de construccion para hacer mejoras a la casa

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes A. is 48 years old. She is married and the mother of six children. Through this business, Agnes has supported two of her children to finish senior high school, and the others are currently in school. Agnes lives with her husband who is a farmer, together with the children in Berekum in the Brong Ahafo region.

Agnes is a food vendor and sells "kenkey" as well as maize. Kenkey is prepared from milled maize grains, cooked and taken with hot pepper and fried fish. She has many customers since many Ghanaians enjoy kenkey as breakfast, lunch and supper. In addition, she also sells grocery products just in front of her house.

Agnes wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, firewood and grocery products like sugar, evaporated milk, etc. She hopes to increase her savings to support her children's education. Agnes belongs to a village bank called ‘Enoch’. She hopes to receive GHS 500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, firewood and grocery products

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora is 23 years old. She is married and has 1 young child, but her husband doesn’t currently live in Guatemala. Maria Auxiliadora supports herself and her family by selling food every weekday morning at a nearby school. In the afternoon Maria tries to spend time studying. In addition to her food sales, she also sells perfume and the income from both businesses helps to pay for her daily expenses. Maria is requesting a loan in order to increase the variety of food products that she can offer her customers. She dreams of increasing her income so that she can finish studying and better her life. 


*********************************************************************************************


Maria Auxiliadora, es casada, tiene 23 años de edad y tiene solo un niño pequeño. Su esposo actualmente no vive en Guatemala.  Ella  vende comida en una escuela para niños, todas las mañanas de lunes a viernes de cada semana, por las tardes dedica su tiempo para estudiar. Además ella también vende productos de perfumería, y con esos ingresos se ayuda para todos los gastos de su casa.  El préstamo lo necesita para tener más productos para su negocio de venta de comida. Su sueño es contar con mejores ingresos que le permitan terminar sus estudios y salir adelante en la vida.

loans.use: Increase variety of food products to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence B. is 36 years old and a married woman with four children. Currently all her kids are in school. Florence lives with her nuclear family at Dorma Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Her husband is a security man in a certain company in her community. 

Florence has been selling frozen foods like chicken, pork, mutton, fish, sausages, etc. in the local market of Dorma for three years now. She does not have adequate funds to support her business. This has affected her operation, especially in the face of increasing food prices. With the loan, she wants to purchase more cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, and pork to enable her to raise enough income to expand her sales. With your support she feels it would bring lots of transformation to her business. Florence belongs to a village bank called ‘Enoch’. She also hope to receive GHS 550 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken, mutton, etc

loans.name: Ronaldo Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Ronaldo G. es muy trabajador por la razón de que se dedica a su actividad de elaboración de canastos y otros objetos derivados del bambú. Ha adquirido mucha experiencia en este ramo por lo que se ha catalogado como un excelente trabajador del bambú en la ciudad de Masaya.

Es importante destacar que actualmente atraviesa una necesidad como lo es la de adquirir su material de trabajo por lo que ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiado con un crédito para dichas compras y así continuar en su actividad beneficiando a su pequeña hija que tanto requiere del apoyo de su padre por lo que está en edad escolar.
texts.en:
Mr. Ronaldo G. is a very hard worker, dedicating himself to making baskets and other objects from bamboo. He has gained a lot of experience in this arena, and has become well-known in the city of Masaya for his excellent work in bamboo crafts. It’s important to highlight that he currently is going through a time of need that involves purchasing the raw materials for his work. For this reason, he has sought out the backing of Ceprodel to become the recipient of a loan for said purchases. In this manner, he can continue his work, which is of great benefit to his young daughter. She very much needs her father’s support, as she is still of school age.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for his work.

loans.name: Felecia

texts.en:
Felecia A. is 51 years old. She is married and the mother of six children. Three of her children are in school and are doing very well. She is a professional training teacher who graduated from the training college. Her husband works with the Ghana National Fire Service. Felecia is an entrepreneur who is dynamic and very dedicated to her work.

Apartment from teaching, she is also a local manufacturer of palm oil for over 25 years. Palm oil is produced from palm nut fruits. She produces and supplies it to food vendors to prepare their meals. She even treks to the villages to purchase the finished goods elsewhere when demand becomes very high.

In addition to the above business she is also a retailer of charcoal and firewood in her local community. Charcoal and firewood are very popular sources of energy for cooking in most traditional Ghanaian homes. Felecia buys her supply of charcoal and firewood from the villages and resells it to her customers.

She wants to use the loan to buy more palm nut fruits, charcoal and firewood to increase her efficiency and produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business and raise more income to support her husband in providing food for her family and financing her children's education.

Felicia belongs to a village bank called "Yesu Din No," which means "The Name of Jesus." She hopes to receive GH¢500 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy more bags of palm nut fruit

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: La señora Rosa B. tiene 31 años de edad, habita en el barrio San Juan de la Concepción, Junto a su esposo e hijos la señora es comerciante y agricultura al igual que su marido; ellos tiene  a su cargo dos hijos los cuales todavía estudian su primaria, la hija de 11 año le apoya con los quehaceres del hogar ya que ella vende en el mercado oriental , los planes de doña Rosa es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia ya que para ello tiene que darle un buen  mantenimiento a la pitahaya para vender en un precio accesible de ganancias , lo cual necesita comprar insumos para aplicarle al cultivo de pitahaya. Ya que esta se vende mucho cuando la cosecha se da por su rico sabor.
texts.en:
Rosa B. is 31 years old, and lives in the San Juan de la Concepción neighborhood with her husband and children. She is a merchant and a farmer, like her husband. They have two children who are still in primary school. The daughter, 11 years old, helps her with the household chores since Rosa sells at the Asian market. Rosa’s plans include improving the standard of living of her family, which is why she must take good care of her pitahaya (“dragon fruit”) crop so she can sell it for a good profit. She can use these earnings to buy the supplies necessary for the farming of pitahaya. This fruit sells well when harvested because of its delicious flavor.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and agricultural products for better crop production.

loans.name: Faustina

texts.en:
Faustina D. is a 53-year-old trader. She is a divorced mother with six children plus three orphans she is taking care of. Two are grownups. She resides at Dorma Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana.

She divorced nine years ago when her husband refused to take care of the children's basic needs. Since then she has been struggling to provide the needs of her children's education and that of the orphans. She is a very resourceful single mother whose hard effort brings livelihood to the family.

Faustina supports her kids through the sale of used clothing, bed sheets and the sale of grocery products. Selling of used clothing and bed sheets has a very big market share in Ghana as brand-new clothes are very expensive for the economically active poor.

She has been in this business for the past two years. She travels to a nearby city called Kumasi to purchase her stock of goods. She wants to use the loan to buy more bales of used clothing to increase her inventory. She normally concentrates on bed sheets and used towel sales. She is also selling grocery products like evaporated milk and sugar. This she believes would help her earn additional income.

She believes this loan would help her save for her children's future and also to rent a store to trade. Faustina belongs to a village bank called "Enoch." She hopes to receive GH¢600 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy bales of used clothing

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora K. is 41 years old. She is a married woman with three kids. All her children are in school. She lives with her family at Dorma Ahenkro in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. For the past eight years, Dora has been baking bread in taking care of her household in spite of the challenges she faces. She bakes sugar bread, wheat bread, etc and sells it to her customers. She says she makes sure her food quality meets her customer’s expectations. Her customers book their orders in advance so that before they come it would be ready. She also retails to individuals for their morning breakfast. 

Dora says the price of commodities is increasing, which is making it difficult to buy more raw materials from the market while the daily demand for bread is high. She says she bakes at most 550 loaves of bread in a day. Dora needs the loan to buy more bags of flour, sugar, margarine, milk, and firewood, etc. She said your assistance would be much welcome. Dora belongs to a village bank called ‘Enoch’. She also hope to receive GH¢600 to make business progress by restocking her inventory.

loans.use: To buy baking ingredients and firewood

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.en:
Nicolas A. is a 39 year old trader. He is married with four children, all in school. He trades in maize cereals. He has been trading for the past eleven years and has been very helpful to his family. He treks to farming communities such as Techieman in the Brong Ahafo region to buy his food stuffs and sell them to his loyal customers. He has targeted the poultry farms and the boarding senior high school as his prime focus for his business. 

He hopes to receive GH¢600 to increase his business by restocking his inventory. In the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country,  he would buy a larger supply of maize and dried pepper to serve his customers throughout the season.  This would enable him save more to support his children in school. Nicolas belongs to a village bank called ‘Enoch’.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of maize cereals and dried pepper.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: El señor Víctor Manuel, habita en el barrio San Juan ubicado en la Concepción junto a su esposa y tres hijos, la esposa de don Victor se dedica al comercio desde hace veinticinco años y él es agricultura; los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de sus hijos ya que todos duermen en un mismo cuarto, los sueños de don Victor es llegar a establecer mas cultivo de pitahaya para obtener mas ingresos y darle un mejor futuro a sus pequeños. Con el financiamiento quiere comprar fertilizantes para aplicárselo al cultivo y así obtener una mejor producción y vender a mejor precio al mercado.
texts.en:
Mr. Victor Manuel lives in the San Juan neighborhood, located in La Concepción, together with his wife and three children. Victor’s wife has dedicated herself to commerce for the past twenty-five years, and he is a farmer. His plans for his family include providing better living conditions for them, since they all sleep in the same room. Victor dreams of being able to plant more pitahaya (“dragon fruit”) crops, so he can earn a better income and provide a brighter future for his young ones. With the financing, he would like to buy fertilizers to apply to his crops. In this manner, he can have a better rate of production and sell his goods for a better price at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and agricultural products to improve his production.

loans.name: Josefa Del Carmen

texts.es: Josefa del Carmen Hernández tiene 54 años, su estado civil es soltera, y tiene seis hijos. La actividad económica de Doña Josefa es la venta de mercadería en general como ropa, zapatos y perfumes. Hace más de 12 años que se dedica a este negocio. Los propósitos de Doña Josefa para su negocio son de salir adelante con su negocio para que este se desarrolle. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo destinado a la compra de productos. Sus deseos son de realizarles mejoras a su vivienda para que el día de mañana  obtenga un lugar cómodo y tranquilo donde vivir. La cantidad que necesita es de C$ 19.500 córdobas a un plazo de 13 meses.
texts.en:
Josefa del Carmen Hernández is 54 years old, single, and she has six children. Her economic activity is selling general merchandise like clothes, shoes, and perfumes. She has been dedicated to this business for 12 years. Doña Josefa's intentions for her business are to continue growing. The financing is for working capital to purchase products. Her desires are to make improvements to her house so that in future days she will have a comfortable and peaceful place to live. The quantity that she needs is for C$ 19.500 córdobas (currency of Nicaragua) for a period of 13 months.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase stock of jewelry

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: Justina E. M. tiene 66 años, su estado civil es casada, y tiene 1 hijo. Doña Justina tiene la actividad económica de una pulpería. Hace más de 4 años que se dedica a este negocio ya que dio inicio con una pequeña venta de productos como mangos, naranjas, shampoo y granos básicos y decidió realizar un financiamiento que le ayudara a crecer con su negocio y lo consigue. Y ahora sus propósitos son de comprar más vitrinas para exhibir sus productos y así crecer con su negocio. Sus deseos son superar los obstáculos que se le presenten para llevar a cabo sus propósitos que no por ser pequeñas dejan de ser importantes. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 2.200 a un plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Justina E. M. is 66 years old, married, and has one son. Doña Justina's economic activity is a local store. She dedicated her self to this business four years ago, beginning with a few sales of products like mangos, oranges, shampoo, and basic grains; she decided to do some financing to help her business grow and so she got a loan. Now her intentions are to buy more glass cases to exhibit her products. Her objective is to overcome any obstacles that present themselves and achieve her goals; just because her goals are small does not mean that they aren't important. The quantity that she is requesting is C$ 2.200 over a period of 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a greater variety of products for the general store

loans.name: Justo Pastor

texts.es: El Señor Justo Pastor M. M. tiene 63 años, su estado civil es soltero. Tiene nueve hijos y todos sus hijos trabajan. La actividad económica de Don Justo es el servicio de billares hace mas de 9 años que Don Justo se dedica a este negocio, no  poseía un lugar propio para su local pero con los prestamos solicitados ha logrado establecerse en su propia vivienda. Los propósitos para su negocio son de proporcionarle mejoras a su negocio ya que le gusta ofrecerles a sus clientes lo mejor. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo que será utilizado para la compra de productos como gaseosas, galletas, pan y cigarrillos. Los deseos de Don Justo son de ampliar su negocio y así ofrecer más diversión a sus clientes. La cantidad que solicita son de C$ 9.000 córdobas a un plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Señor Justo Pastor M. M. is 63 years old and single. He has nine children and they all work. Don Justo's economic activity is billiards services, which he has been dedicated to for nine years. He does not own his own place for his business but with loans he has obtained his own home. His goal for his business is to improve it because he likes to offer his clients the best. The financing is for working capital that will be used to purchase products like soda, cookies, bread, and cigarettes. Don Justo's desires are to increase his business and in this way offer more fun to his clients. The quantity that he is requesting is C$ 9.000 córdobas for a period of nine months.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve the billiard hall and buy more items for customers to purchase

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ramona Auxiliadora

texts.es: Ramona Auxiliadora S. S. tiene 40 años, su estado civil es casada, y tiene un hijo. Doña Ramona tiene la actividad económica de la venta de mercadería en general como ropa, calzado y cosméticos. Hace más de 10 años que se dedica a su negocio. Los propósitos de Doña Ramona son de abastecer su negocio para que de esta forma no tenga carencia de productos. El financiamiento solicitado es para capital de trabajo por lo que necesita realizar la compra de su mercadería. Sus sueños son de innovar cada día con su negocio ya que todos los días se promociona un nuevo producto. La cantidad solicitada es de C$ 15.000 córdobas a un plazo de 14 meses.
texts.en:
Ramona Auxiliadora S. S. is 40 years old, married, and has one son. Ramona’s job is to sell general merchandise like clothes, shoes and cosmetics. She has worked in this business for the past 10 years. Ramona’s goal is to stock up on merchandise so she won’t lack any products. The loan is for the capital needed to purchase her merchandise. Her dream is to be innovative with her business and promote a new product every day. The amount she is asking for is C$ 15.000 córdobas that will be repaid in 14 months.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase volume of goods sold

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: Madame S. kossiwa habite le quartier d’agoè telessou, elle a pour activité le commerce de de pagnes et de sucres, elle fait ce commerce depuis 1999, elle s’approvisionne au grand marché de Lomé où ce commerce est très développé et très rentable, actuellement elle souhaite agrandir son stock de marchandises c’est la raison pour laquelle elle se tourne envers wages pour demander un crédit de 150000F  pour acheter 8pièces de pagnes et 4 sacs de sucres. Elle n’est pas mariée mais elle a un enfant, c’est avec le revenu issu de ce commerce qu’elle arrive à entretenir son enfant.
texts.en:
Mrs Kossiwa S. lives in the Agoè Telessou neighborhood, and since 1999, her business has consisted in reselling pagnes (colorful African cloth) and sugar. She gets her supplies at the grand market in Lomé, where this kind of activity is very much developed and profitable. At this time, she would like to bolster her stock. This is why she turned to Kiva's partner WAGES to seek a loan in order to purchase 8 large pagnes and 4 sacks of sugar. She's not married, but she has one child, who she supports with the income she gets out of her business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell 8 large pagnes (colorful African cloth) and sugar

loans.name: Talifaia

texts.en:
Talifaia N., 50, married with six children, has three years of experience in the ice-cake and popcorn business, selling to the villagers and public seven days per week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 370 Tala (~154 USD).

Talifaia received one previous loan from SPBD, her only source of capital since she has never qualified for a loan from the traditional banks. Part of the money will be used to buy ingredients for her business and part to acquire equipment for home improvements.  Talifaia has two working children and one who is overseas, each giving her financial help to support her business and family needs.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients such as sacks of sugar, foam cups, peanut and corn seeds for her business.

loans.name: Sina

texts.en: Sina I., 43, is married with three children. She has one year of experience in the pancake business. She sells to the public three days a week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be $145.  SPBD loans are Sina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase flour, sugar, cooking oil and cooking utensils for her pancake business.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, cooking oil and cooking utensils

loans.name: Alma Godety

texts.es:
En el municipio de Nagarote de la ciudad de León la dama Alma F. se dedica a atender su pulpería que ha logrado surtir gracias a sus grandes esfuerzos en su negocio.
Es de importancia destacar que ha logrado salir adelante beneficiando a su familia la cual ama mucho. La dama Alma con el propósito de continuar mejorando su pulpería hoy en día requiere de la inversión en productos para la venta y es por este motivo que ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para la compra de dichos productos y de esta manera continuar en su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Nagarote in Leon, Nicaragua, Ms. Alma F. works in her grocery store that has become successful thanks to her great efforts. It is important to highlight that she has achieved success while benefiting her family, whom she loves very much. Alma, with the goal of continuing to improve her store, now requires an investment in products to sell. For this reason she is asking for a loan with Ceprodel in order to buy those products and continue to support her business.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: expand merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Martina Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Martina Tellez es una feliz dama que ha iniciado su negocio de pulpería en el municipio de Nagarote de la ciudad de León. Actualmente ha logrado salir adelante llevando el bienestar a su casa de habitación la cual necesita de su apoyo.

Es importante destacar que como todo negocio en proceso de desarrollo, la pulpería de la señora Martina requiere de inversión en la compra de los productos y por esta sencilla razón es que ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para la compra de la mercadería y de este modo salir adelante logrando la satisfacción de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martina Tellez is a happy woman who has started her own grocery store in the municipality of Nagarote in Leon, Nicaragua. She has been able to overcome her obstacles and bring a sense of well-being to her home, which needs her support. It is important to highlight that like all developing businesses, Martina has to invest in her store by purchasing more products. For this simple reason she has asked for Ceprodel’s help in purchasing merchandise. In this way she will get ahead and gain the satisfaction of her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: merchandise

loans.name: Peati

texts.en: Peati (Betty) M., 28, is married with one child.  She has five years of experience in the barbecue business. She sells to the public five days a week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be $145.  SPBD loans are Peati’s only access to capital because she cannot qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. All of the loan will be used to buy ingredients needed for making the barbecue she sells at her business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients needed to run the BBQ business

loans.name: Rosa Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Rosa O. es una dama con un gran espíritu de superación en su negocio de pulpería el cual atiende en el municipio de Nagarote de la ciudad de León de donde es originaria. Es de importancia destacar que actualmente tiene tres años de poseer su negocio y ha logrado suplirlo y beneficiar a su familia.

Hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los productos y por esta razón espera que su crédito sea aprobado y de esta forma salir adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa O. is a woman with a great spirit for overcoming adversity in her grocery store that she owns in Nagarote, Leon, Nicaragua, where she is from. It is important to note that she has owned her business for three years and she has been able to keep it stocked to benefit her family. Now she has approached Ceprodel in order to benefit from a loan in order to buy products for her store. For this reason she hopes that her loan is approved [funded] and in this way she will get ahead and giver her business the necessary support.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: merchandise

loans.name: Paula

texts.en: Paula T., 35, is married with six children.  She has three years of experience in the barbecue business. She sells to the public five days a week. She has three previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be $166.  SPBD loans are Paula’s only access to capital because she has not been able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to pay for her children's school fees and school uniforms and also for buying ingredients needed to run her barbeque business.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making BBQ and to help with her children's school fees

loans.name: Siula

texts.en: Siula T., 37, is married with one child.  She has three years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the public two days a week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be $125.  SPBD loans are Siula’s only access to capital because she cannot qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. All of her loan will be use to buy farming equipment and fertilizer for her business. Her husband helps her with the farming.

loans.use: To buy farm equipment and fertilizer for the plantation

loans.name: Natalia

texts.en:
Nataliya is married with two daughters who are 11 and 15 years old and who need her care and support. She sells clothing at the market in Pavlograd city and has a very good location that brings many clients her way. Her business does well. Nataliya has been in this business for four years, ever since she saw that women's clothing is one of the few products that sell well and produce a stable income. Nataliay's husband works in a mine. 

Nataliya would like to get a loan of $600 in order to build her own kiosk. A kiosk would improve her business as well as her working conditions, as she would not need to hang all the clothing every day and re-bag it at the end of the work day.

loans.use: To build a kiosk

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine S., 32, is married with three children.  She has two years of experience in the retail business. She sells to the public five days a week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  Josephine expects her weekly net cash flow to be $166.  SPBD loans are her only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used only to buy more goods for her shop.

loans.use: To buy goods for the shop

loans.name: Marlon Mauricio

texts.es: El señor Marlon Mauricio habita en el barrio San Juan de la Concepción Junto a su esposa , la esposa de don Marlon trabaja como comerciante en el mercado de Masaya , ellos tiene a su cargo una hija de tres años , la mamá de don Marlon le apoya con el cuido de la pequeña ya que el trabaja como agricultor en sus tierras y la esposa es comerciante , los planes hacia su familia es poder terminar su vivienda ya que esta le hace falta zinc , puertas y ventanas , actualmente vive en la misma casa de su mamá . El necesita un financiamiento ya que sus cultivos necesitan fertilizantes para poder tener una buena producción y con la ganancia terminar su vivienda ya que es uno de sus anhelo.
texts.en:
Mr. Marlon Mauricio lives in the neighborhood of San Juan de la Concepcion together with his wife, who works in the market in Masaya. They have a 3-year-old daughter and Marlon’s mother helps them care for her since he works as a farmer and his wife as a businesswoman. His plans for his family are to be able to finish his home—he still needs to buy zinc (for the roof), doors and windows. Currently his family lives in his mother’s house. He needs a loan because his crops need fertilizer in order to produce a lot—with the earnings from his crops he will finish his home since that is one of his dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: fertilizer

loans.name: Asotasi

texts.en: Asotasi M., 30, is married with 5 children.  She has 3 year(s) of experience in the Plantation business. She sells to the publics 3 days per week. She has 2 previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD).  SPBD loans are Asotasi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy farming equipments and pay for her children school fees. Her husband helps her with the business.

loans.use: Purchase to buy farming equipments and help with her children school fees

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: La Señora María Esperanza R. tiene 35 años, y su estado civil es casada. La actividad económica a la que Doña María se dedica es pulpería. Hace más de cinco años que se dedica a este negocio ya que surge por la necesidad de una fuente de ingresos. Doña María tiene los propósitos de aumentar su negocio por que sus clientes buscarían los productos que ofrece. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo como granos básicos, gaseosas, golosinas y cosméticos. En sus deseos esta el obtener la reputación necesaria en su comarca y así vender lo que el cliente necesita. La cantidad solicitada es de C$ 15.000 córdobas a un plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Esperanza R. is 35 years old and married. Maria works in her grocery store that she has owned for the past 5 years. She started it due to the need for a source of income. Maria plans on expanding her business because her customers will seek out the products she offers. The loan is for the purchase of basic grains, soft drinks, candies and cosmetics. She hopes to gain a good reputation in her area by selling what her customers need. The amount needed is C$ 15.000 córdobas to be repaid in 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Talosia

texts.en:
Talosia S., 62, is married with five children. She has four years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the public two days per week. She has had three previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (about $166).

SPBD loans are Talosia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to pay for her children's school fees and for purchasing timber to renovate her house.

loans.use: Pay for her children's school fees and for home improvement

loans.name: Ventura Del Carmen

texts.es: Ventura del Carmen López tiene 63 años, su estado civil es casada. Todos sus hijos son mayores de edad. La actividad económica de Doña Ventura es una pulpería en la que ofrece productos como granos básicos, cosmético, ropa y otros. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio. Sus propósitos son de invertir cada día en su negocio. El financiamiento es destinado para la compra de más productos para su negocio. Sus deseos son que esta pulpería pueda convertirse en una distribuidora y así generar más ingresos para su familia. La cantidad que necesita es de C$ 18.000 córdobas a un plazo de 9 meses.
texts.en:
Ventura del Carmen López is 63 years old and married. All of her children are grown. Ms. Ventura’s job is to run her general store where she offers products like basic grains, cosmetics, clothes, etc. She has worked in the store for more than 6 years. Her plans are to invest every day in her business. The loan is destined for the purchase of more products for her store. She hopes that her store can be converted to a distributor and therefore generate more income for her family. She needs C$ 18.000 córdobas to be repaid over 9 months.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Maria De Jesus

texts.es: María de Jesús Gonzales F. tiene la edad de 32 años, es soltera y no tiene hijos. La actividad económica de Doña María es la venta de mercadearía en general. Hace más de diez años que se dedica a esta actividad, además Doña María recibe la ayuda de su Mama ya que no tiene tiempo para sus 2 trabajos ya que labora como maestra en una escuela. Doña María tiene los propósitos de brindarle mejoras a su negocio ya que la mayor parte del tiempo es su Mama quien se encuentra en el local. Es por eso que ha solicitado un financiamiento con el fin de invertir en sus productos ya que con esto podrá comprar productos como calzado, ropa y cosméticos. Sus deseos son poseer 2 negocios para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. La cantidad que solicita es de C$ 23.000 córdobas a un plazo de 18 meses.
texts.en:
María de Jesús Gonzales F. is 32 years old, single, and has no children. Maria works selling general merchandise. She has earned her living this way for the past 10 years and she also gets some help from her mother since she doesn’t have time for her two jobs—she also works as a schoolteacher. Maria would like to make improvements to her business since for the most part it is her mother who attends to the store. Because of this she is asking for a loan with the idea of investing it in merchandise like clothing, shoes and cosmetics. She hopes to eventually have 2 locations in order to satisfy the demand of her customers. She is asking for C$ 23.000 córdobas to be repaid in 18 months.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Paulo Mauricio

texts.es: Paulo Mauricio S. Campo tiene 42 años. la actividad económica de don Paulo es la venta de electrodomésticos como televisores, radios, grabadoras y  refrigeradoras y dice que esta es su única fuente de trabajo y ayuda. Hace más de diez años que se dedica a este negocio la venta de estos equipos la realiza de manera ambulante ya que los prestamos son la ayuda que el necesita para que su negocio pueda salir adelante. Los propósitos de Don Paulo son de poseer un lugar propio donde pueda ofertar sus electrodomésticos. Sus desafíos son de mantener su negocio ya que la situación en el país es muy difícil. La cantidad necesaria es de C$ 24.000 córdobas a un plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Paulo Mauricio S. Campo is 42 years old and works selling household appliances like televisions, radios, tape recorders and refrigerators. This is his only source of income and support. He has worked in this job for the past 10 years and he sells the appliances as a street vendor. The loan is the help he needs for his business to get ahead. Paulo would like to own his own space to sell his appliances from. His challenge is to maintain his business even though the situation in his country is very difficult. The amount he needs is C$ 24.000 córdobas to be repaid in 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth T. Z. tiene 35 años,su estado civil es casada. La actvidad economica de doña Elizabeth es la venta de cosmeticos y ropa. hace mas de tres años que se dedica a este negocio. sus propositos para su negocio son de establecer una pulperia y vender los cosmeticos en su casa de habitacion. el financiamiento es para capital de trabajo ya que tiene que comprar lo necesario para ofrecerlos a sus clientes.sus deseos son de proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda por lo que es su mayor necesidad.la cantida solicitada es de C$7.000 cordobas a un plazo de 12 meses.
texts.en:
Elizabeth T. Z. is 35 years old. Her civil status is married. The economic activity of doña Elizabeth is the sales of cosmetics and clothes. For more than 3 years she has been dedicated to this activity. Her goals for her business are to establish a small grocery store and to sell the cosmetics from her home. The financing is for working capital since she has to buy the necessary things to offer to her clients. Her wish is to provide improvements to her dwelling, which is her greatest need. The amount requested is C$7.000 ($350 US) for a period of 12 months.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital - to buy cosmetics and clothes for resale and to fix up her home as a small store

loans.name: Germary Danayra

texts.es:
La microempresaria Germary Danayra D. C. tiene 25 años es madre de una niña menor de edad, es casada, estudia en la universidad y desde hace 3 años se dedica al negocio de venta de piñatas y artículos para cumpleaños tales como candelitas, pitos, gorritos entre otros.

Además vende repostería la cual obtiene de una panadería de su mama lo que le permite tener ciertos ingresos aparte de la venta de las piñatas. Su negocio de las piñatas lo hace por encargo de personas que conocen a su mama y la cual la recomienda. En el caso de la venta de repostería la vende en su casa ya que esta ubicada frente a un colegio de secundaria y los estudiantes llegan en horas del recreo a consumir este producto.

La joven madre Germary tiene planes de poder ampliar su negocio con otros productos que son solicitados tales como refrescos naturales, gaseosas y jugos, sin embargo actualmente requiere el financiamiento para comprar lo siguiente:

15 Piñatas pequeñas las que compra a US$ 5 dólares, 25 piñatas medianas las que compra a US$ 8 dólares y 25 piñatas grandes las que compra a US$ 9 dólares.
texts.en:
The micro-entrepreneur Germary Danayra D. C. is 25 years old, the mother of a young daughter, married, and a student at the university. For the past 3 years, she has dedicated herself to the business of selling piñatas as well as birthday party supplies such as candles, whistles, hats, and other items. She also sells pastries that she obtains from her mother’s bakery, which allows her an additional source of income besides her piñata sales. Her piñata business is carried out based on orders placed by friends of her mother’s on her recommendation. In the case of her pastry sales, she sells these from her home since she is located across the street from a secondary school. During their recess, the students visit her to buy her products. The young mother Germary has plans to expand her business with other products sought out by her customers such as natural beverages, soft drinks and juices. Currently, she needs financing to buy the following: 15 small piñatas that she buys for $5 USD, 25 medium piñatas that she buys for $8 USD, and 25 large piñatas that she buys for $9 USD.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase small, medium and large piñatas.

loans.name: Sefau

texts.en:
Sefau K., 81, is married with nine children. She has four years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the public two days per week. This is her first loan with SPBD, Kiva's partner. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (about $166).

SPBD loans are Sefau’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. All of her loan will be used to buy farming equipment while her husband does the work with the help of two sons.

loans.use: Purchase farming equipment

loans.name: Teab

texts.en: Teab S., 34, is married and lives in Siem Reap, Cambodia, with her husband and four of her children. To earn a living, she runs a grocery store from her home and is able to make US$6 per day, while her husband works as a journalist (Phnom Penh Post) and earns US$280 per month. Mrs. Teab S. will use this loan to expand her grocery store by adding more products to meet her client’s demand.

loans.use: To expand a grocery store.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao H., 41, has a business selling wood in the Siem Reap province. Her business has been around for about five years and she makes $2.50 every day. Her husband is a security worker at Angkor Wat temple and earns $1 per day. This couple has five children: Two are in school, three are souvenir sellers, and one is a construction worker.

Mao H. would like to purchase a souvenir store in the market for her children.

loans.use: To purchase a souvenir store

loans.name: Mrs. Chantha Thon Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Twelve people who live in Svay Chuor village in Kandal province have formed this village bank loan and all the members will use the loan which they obtained for different purposes.

Mrs. Chantha T. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a fish seller in the local market. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more fish to resell to earn more income. Her husband, Mr. Pao Puch, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from having this plantation, he is a construction worker.

Mrs. Chantha T. is 34 years old and the mother of two children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy more fish to resell.

loans.name: Laiy

texts.en:
Laiy R., 54, sells rice noodles in the local market of her Siem Reap province. She is married with four children. Two of her children are in school while two others work as mechanics with their father.

She typically makes about $2.50 each day, and would like a loan to invest in a new business. In order to increase her profits, she is asking for $1,000 to start a new groceR. business and to purchase mechanic tools for her children.

(Mrs. Laiy R.'s husband is pictured at home.)

loans.use: To start a grocery business and purchase mechanic tools

loans.name: Chheoum

texts.en:
Chheoum S., 46, has business grinding rice crops and recharging batteries from her home in Siem Reap province. She is able to make $7 per day, while her husband, pictured here, earns $4 working as a construction foreman and renting music equipment. This couple has nine children, seven of whom are in school, while two are too young to attend.

Chhoeum S. would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband for commuting to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Mrs. Savy Put Village Bank Group

texts.en: Nineteen people who live in the Svay Chuor Village in the Kandal Province form the village bank loan, and all the members will use the loan which they've obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Savy P. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She sells vegetables in the local market. Her husband, Mr. Noav Chhroeng, helps with her business. Since their business is doing well, they want to expand it by purchasing more vegetables to resell in order to earn more income to support their family. Mrs. Savy P. is a 34-year-old mother of four children, one of whom is a vegetable seller while two others are enrolled in the local school, and the remaining is too young to work or study. Mrs. Srey T. is not present, but her husband, instead, is shown in the picture with the village bank members.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to resell

loans.name: Pich

texts.en:
Pich S. is 38 years old and works as a local teacher in the Siem Reap province. She started teaching in 1990 and is able to make $2 every day. Her husband, pictured here, is a moto-taxi driver and makes $3 a day.

This couple has three children: Two are in school and one is a barman.

Pich S. is asking for a loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband to operate a moto-taxi business.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Makerita

texts.en:
Makerita T., 57, is married with eight children. She has two years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the public two days per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD, Kiva's partner. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (about $166).

SPBD loans are Makerita’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. All her loan will be used for buying chemicals and farming equipment to fund her business while husband does all the farming.

loans.use: To buy chemicals

loans.name: Alaimalo

texts.en:
Alaimalo S., 37, is married with four children. She has one year of experience in the cattle-farming business. She sells to the public one day per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD, Kiva's partner. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (about $208).

SPBD loans are Alaimalo’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. All of her loan will be used to purchase fence to secure the cows from escaping. Her husband helps her with the business.

loans.use: Purchase a fence to secure the cows

loans.name: Faaniniva

texts.en: Faaniniva T., 34, is married with two children.  She has one year of experience in the Cattle Farming business. She sells to the village people /public one day per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).  SPBD loans are Faaniniva’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. All of her loan will be used to buy a fence and nails to secure the cows.

loans.use: Purchase a fence and nails to secure the cows.

loans.name: Julia

texts.en: Julia A., 26, is married with one child.  She has 2 years of experience in the Sewing/Cattle business. She sells to the public two days per week. She has two previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  SPBD loans are Julia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy fabric and a new sewing machine.

loans.use: Purchase fabric and a new sewing machine

loans.name: Vaisuni

texts.en: Vaisuni M., 38, is married with 3 child.  She has four years of experience in the Plantation and the Cattle Farm business. She sells to the public two days per week. She has had 5 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).  SPBD loans are Vaisuni’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase for farming equipments and to pay for her childrens school fees.

loans.use: Buy farming equipments and pay for childrens school fees

loans.name: Iemaima

texts.en:
Iemaima P. is 41 years old and is married with five children. She has two years of experience in the plantation business. She sells her products to the public two days a week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).

She has never borrowed money from SPBD before. SPBD loans are Iemaima’s only access to capital because she can't qualify for a loan from the traditional banks. Iemaima will use her loan to buy farming equipment and sacks of fertilizer to improve her plantation business.

loans.use: Buy farming equipment and fertilizer

loans.name: Veronika

texts.en:
Veronika S., 21, is single with no children. She has only begun her business of planting, harvesting, and selling  bananas and taro. She sells to the villagers and general public two days a week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (~104 USD).

She has never borrowed from SPBD before. SPBD loans are Veronika’s only access to capital because she can't qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She really needs this loan to help her focus on the business, so she can provide financial support to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for planting

loans.name: Tatupu

texts.en:
Tatupu R., 43, is married with 7 children. She has two years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the villagers and general public three days a week. Tatupu expects her weekly net cash flow to be 260 Tala (~108 USD).

Tatupu has had two previous loan(s) from SPBD. SPBD loans are Tatupu’s only access to capital because she can't qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. She also sells vegetables as another source of income and to compliment her plantation business.

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her plantation business

loans.name: Kimlang

texts.en: Mrs. Kimlang C. is a villager in the Srae Boeng Village in the Takeo Province. She is a rice soup seller who earns an insufficient income. Her husband, Mr. Em Sovan, is a laborer, and he is also a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. On his plantation, he faces a problem because he does not have enough money for his production. Thus, Mrs. Kimlang C. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and fuel in order to support the field to make the crops more productive. She is 42 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a farmer who helps with the father’s plantation while the other is attending the local school. Her husband is presented on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizers, pesticides, and fuel

loans.name: Phorng

texts.en: Mr. Phorng T. lives in the Krang Samroung Village in the Takeo Province. He is a chicken breeder. Aside from his breeding, he sells ice cream in the local village. Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it; thus, he decided to ask for a loan to buy a motorbike to transport his ice cream to sell door-to-door. His wife, Mrs. Nget Saran, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mr. Phorng T. is 30 years old and the father of two children who are too young to work or study. His wife is shown on the left of the photo.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike to sell ice cream door-to-door

loans.name: Fia

texts.en: Fia E., 41, is married with 6 children.  She has 2 year(s) of experience in the production and selling of Samoan handicrafts and products. These are sold as souvenirs. She sells her products at the Fugalei market and to the general public, 5 days per week. She has had 3 previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (~104 USD).  SPBD loans are Fia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. This money will be used to improve her business, her home and to meet her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy tools use for her craft.

loans.name: Fuailelagi

texts.en:
Fuailelagi A., 55, is married with seven children. She has three years of experience in the plantation and fishing businesses. She sells to the general public/villagers four days per week.

She has had two previous loans with SPBD, Kiva's partner. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 1000 Tala (about $416).

SPBD loans are Fuailelagi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase a new fishing canoe, fishing gear and chemicals for the plantation.

loans.use: To buy a new canoe, fishing gear, goggles and chemicals

loans.name: Sourm's Group

texts.en: This group of borrowers consists of four members. Its leader S., 29, has two children; both of them are students. She is a widow and owns a general store selling eggs, sugar, plastic, noodles, sweets, etc in front of her house. She is a manageable mother and a responsible neighbor. She earns a good income because her store is located in the middle of a busy street. To help with her family's expenses, S. plans to increase her income by purchasing more products for her store. The loan will help the family attain a better standard of living. There are three other members of the group: Y., 38, who owns a number of rental rooms, is applying for a loan to buy a number of ventilation fans for her rental rooms. K., 44, who raises pigs and grows vegetables, is applying for a loan to buy a motorbike for her business. C., 42, who grows vegetables, is applying for a loan to buy more vegetable seeds for her plantation. They all live in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: To buy more products for her store

loans.name: Luaupu

texts.en:
Luaupu F., 30, is married with four children. She has four years of experience in the bingo business. She sells to the general public/villagers three days per week. She has had three previous loans with SPBD, Kiva's partner. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 750 Tala (about $312).

SPBD loans are Luaupu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will help pay her children's school fees because the business is running well and it is generating enough income for her family to survive on.

loans.use: To pay her children's school fees

loans.name: Freida

texts.en:
Freda S., 41, is married with five children. She has five years of experience in the cattle farm/plantation business. She sells to the general public/villagers four days per week.

She has had six previous loans with SPBD, Kiva's partner. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 1250 Tala (about $520).

SPBD loans are Freda’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Freida's loan will be used to buy chemicals, knives and sacks of fertilizer for her plantation business.

loans.use: To buy chemicals, knives and sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Iloai

texts.en: Iloai J., 27, is married with 2 children.  She has 1 year of experience in the vegetable gardening business. She sells to the general public and villagers, 4 days per week. She has never had a loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 750 Tala (~250 USD).  SPBD loans are Iloai’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy things needed to upgrade her vegetable garden like a plant sprayer, a wheelbarrow, knives, a spade and other tools.

loans.use: To buy gardening tools such as; a plantsprayer, a wheelbarrow, knives, chemicals and a spade,

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Mr. Sor S. is a villager in the Krang Touch Village in the Takeo Province. He raises ducks and operates a poultry business. Since his business is doing well, he wants to expand it by purchasing more ducks for his duck breeding business to earn more income. His wife, Mrs. Yong Sath, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Mr. Sor S. is a 45-year-old father of four children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while another is attending the local school, and the remaining is too young to work or study. His wife is shown on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To buy more ducks to breed

loans.name: Fiaaluae

texts.en: Fiaaluae S., 37, is married with 1 child.  She has 1 year of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public and local villagers, 4 days per week. She has had no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD).  SPBD loans are Fiaaluae’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy a plantsprayer, chemicals and sacks of fertilizers to maintain and improve her business.

loans.use: To buy a plantsprayer, chemicals and sacks of fertilizer.

loans.name: Huon

texts.en: Mr. Huon S. lives in the Krang Roung Village in the Takeo Province. He is an ice cream vendor in the local district. His wife, Mrs. Cheat Rith, is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. On her plantation, she does not have enough money to cultivate rice during the dry season; nor does she have the sufficient materials needed such as fertilizer, pesticides, and hired laborers to work in the field. In order to deal these problems, Mr. Huon S. decided to ask for a loan for his wife’s purpose. He is 29 years old and the father of two children who are too young to work or study. His wife is shown with him in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticides, and to hire laborers to work in the field

loans.name: Mena

texts.en: Mena F., 72, is married with 3 children.  She has 3 yearsexperience in the plantation business. She sells to the general public and villagers, 4 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 750 Tala (~312 USD).  SPBD loans are Mena’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy equipment needed to run the business. She said the remainder of her loan will help her pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy a plantsprayer, chemicals, fertilizer and knives

loans.name: Yin

texts.en: Mrs. Yin K. lives in Ang Kor Ky village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. She now is requesting a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn income. She is 62 years old and a widow with three children, one of whom is a beautician while the others two are laborers.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding.

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mao S. is 46 years old and lives with four of her children in the Siem Reap province. She is a widow who has a business selling grocery products at the market to earn a living. She is able to make about $5 every day and is supported by one child who works as a butcher.

Mao S. would like to take out a loan to invest in a butcher stand.

loans.use: To invest in a butcher stand

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en: Epenesa L., 52, is married with 6 children.  She has 3 year experience in the fishing business. She sells to the general public and villagers, 4 days per week. She has made 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~250 USD).  SPBD loans are Epenesa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy a new canoe to replace the old one, some fishing equipment and a fishing net.

loans.use: To buy fishing equipment such as; fishing net, goggles, fishing spear, canoe and fishing suit

loans.name: Khut

texts.en: Khut K., 45, is married and lives with her husband in Siem Reap, Cambodia. She is a farmer and makes $2.5 USD per day, while her husband is a pig breeder and makes rice wine. On average, he makes $5 USD per day. This couple is also supported by two children who are construction workers. The rest of her children are in school. Khut K. would like to take out a loan to purchase a grinding mill and pigs.

loans.use: To purchase a grinding mill and pigs

loans.name: Fiaola

texts.en: Fiaola S., 40, is married with 5 children.  She has 3 years of experience in the BBQ  business. She sells to the General Public, 6 days per week. She has made 2 previous loan(s) with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~200 USD).  SPBD loans are Fiaola’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to buy ingredients needed to run her BBQ business and material for home improvement

loans.use: Purchase two boxes of drumsticks, a cooking stove, pots, a cooler and roofing materials

loans.name: Meak

texts.en: Meak P., 55, is a wedding chef in Siem Reap province. She has been in this business for  about six years and she typically makes USD $4 per day. Her husband, pictured here, grows sugar cane and sells it in the market. He earns approximately USD $3 per day. They have one employed child. Meak P. would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike for her child to use to commute to work. This will help reduce the transportation cost that her child must spend every day.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Yon

texts.en: Yon T., 28, sells fish in the local market in Siem Reap province. She is married and has four children who are still living at home. Her husband works as a farmer. She typically makes about USD $5 each day, and would like a loan to expand her husband’s cultivation. In order to increase profits, she is asking for a loan of  USD $1000 to purchase land and fertilizer. (Her husband is pictured at their home)

loans.use: To purchase land and fertilizer

loans.name: Eam

texts.en: Eam H., 40, lives in Siem Reap with her husband and four children. She makes and sells cakes, which she has done since 2004. She earns approximately USD $1 per day. Her husband raises pigs and earns USD $5 a day. All of their children are in school. Mrs. Eam H. would like to take out a loan to purchase materials so that she can increase the number of cakes she sells each day.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients

loans.name: Kheoun

texts.en: Kheoun L. is 29 years old and lives with her husband in Siem Reap, Cambodia. She and her husband are farmers and, combined, they typically make about USD $5 a day. This couple has three children, one of whom is in school and the other two are too young to attend. To have another source of income to help raise her standard of living, Kheoun L. is asking for a loan to raise cows.

loans.use: To raise cows

loans.name: Seng

texts.en: Seng K., 32, is married and resides with her husband and three children in the Siem Reap province. To earn a living, she sells fish in the local market. She earns approximately US$5 per day. Her husband pictured here, works as a farmer. He grows rice two times a year and makes US$8 per day. Two of their children are in school and one is too young to attend. To expand cultivation, Seng K. has requested a loan to purchase land and fertilizer.

loans.use: To purchase land and fertilizer.

loans.name: Kann

texts.en: Kann T., 44, is married and resides with her husband in the Siem Reap province. Since 1999 she has been selling wood to earn a living. She is able to earn about US$2 per day. Her husband works as a farmer growing rice. He plants rice two times a year and makes US$10 per day. Mrs. Kann T. would like to take out a loan to purchase a grinding mill which she can rent to the local farmers and increase her profit.

loans.use: To purchase grinding mill.

loans.name: Seum

texts.en: Seum S., 34, is married and lives with one young child in the Siem Reap province. She and her husband are farmers who typically make about US$5 each day. They also raise pigs and make rice wine. In light of today's economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US$400 to purchase a cow. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.

loans.use: To purchase a cow.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
She is a single parent, and works hard for her only child who is in the 4th year of high school. She’s been eager to make her existing business a bigger one. She is Mrs. Maria I., 42 years old, who resides at Pasil Irasan, Roxas Zamboanga Del Norte.

Anybody who knows her will be captivated to learn how she started her business. With only US$4 in capital and assorted grocery items to sell, she was able to generate an income and have a well-managed sari-sari store.  Now she wants to keep a part of her income for her child’s future, so she applied for membership at Paglaum MPC on January 28, 2009. She liked the credit and savings services of the Cooperative and applied for a loan of 5,000 Php (about US$125) to increase the inventory of her store. Her labor today is all for the bright future of her child.

loans.use: Purchase of additional inventory of grocery items

loans.name: Dan

texts.en: S. is 52 years old and a resident of Banteay Meanchey, Cambodia. He has six children: one is married and lives separately; two work in Phnom Penh, a city in Cambodia; and the rest are attending school. S. is married to Dy, 45, who earns a living by selling junk food through the commune. S. has been a motor taxi driver since 1990. He is known for being a very innocent person and a struggling father. He gets up early every morning to take his customers to work and he takes them back in the late afternoon. He has a net income of $5 per day. S. recently faced some difficulty when his son needed transportation for his job. So S. is applying for a loan of $800 to buy a motorbike for his son and his family. The loan will help the family attain a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his son and family

loans.name: Sorm

texts.en:
C., 52, is a resident of Banteay Meanchey Province in Cambodia. She has four children: One is married and lives separately, two work as motor-taxi drivers, and another one is attending school. C. is married to Sameoun, 62, who owns a number of rental rooms for construction workers.
