C. has sewn clothes since 2000 and earns a good income, for she famous in her skill. Therefore she has a lot of customers who buy her clothes in bulk. Recently, C. is facing difficulty with her accommodation. So C. is requesting a loan of $300 to build a small bridge with bamboo poles to her house. The loan will make the family a more comfortable living.

C. was not available during the photograph so her husband is in the photo instead.

loans.use: To build a small bridge with bamboo poles to her house

loans.name: Roman

texts.en: Roman is 22 years old. This single man has an orchard. Roman lives in the Khachmaz region, in the Ashagi-Zeyid village. Two years ago, he started this business. Now he requests a loan of $2500 (2000 AZN) to buy fertilizer, seedlings, and pesticides for improving his orchard.

loans.use: Buy fertilizer, seedlings, and pesticides for the orchard

loans.name: Phach

texts.en:
C. is 22 years old and a resident of Pursat province, Cambodia. She is married to Sokleng, 29, who earns a living by working as a local construction worker. C. has been a local farmer for more than 3 years, and earns a good income of $5 per day. She always sells her rice in bulk three times per year for a good price to the customer.

C. plans to reduce her family's expenses for farming. She is tired of hiring her neighbor's oxen to plow her farmland. So C. is requesting a loan to buy a pair of oxen for her farmland. The loan will help the family attain a better standard of living.

loans.use: Buy a pair of oxen to plow the farmland

loans.name: Mil

texts.en:
Y. is 47 years old and a resident of Pursat province, Cambodia. She has two children: one is married and lives separately, and the other one is single and works as a construction worker. She is married to Lim, 46, who is a local construction foreman. Y. is a local farmer and has been working in this field since 1987.

She earns a good income because she has a lot of experience in her work. She is a struggling mother and a responsible neighbor. Recently, she became tired of hiring her neighbor's oxen to plow her farmland. So Y. is requesting a loan to buy a pair of oxen to plow her farmland and rent in her neighborhood.

loans.use: Buy a pair of oxen to plow the farmland and rent in the neighborhood

loans.name: Rebeca

texts.en: Rebeca is 39 years old, and is single. Rebeca is a snacks seller in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood in Mbeya. She is a member of the Kabwe group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $39. Every day she works at her business for 8 hours. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hoping that this loan will help her increase her profit and grow her business.

loans.use: Buy more items to sell in her business

loans.name: Lidya

texts.en: Lidya is widowed, and she takes care of 2 dependents. Lidya is a millet seller in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya. She is a member of the Kabwe group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $50. Every day she works at her business for 10 hours. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more millet to sell. She is hoping that with this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

loans.use: Buy more millet for resale

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is a cereals seller in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya. She belongs to Ilolo group loan. Every day she works at her business for nine hours.

She is requesting her first loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Tanzania, so that she can buy more cereals for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Eliza is 40 years old, married, and has seven children.

loans.use: To buy more cereals for her business

loans.name: Hilda

texts.en:
Hilda is a tailor in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya. She belongs to the Ilolo group loan. Every day, she works at her business for 10 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Tanzania, so that she can buy more tailoring items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Hilda is 25 years old, married, and has a one-year-old child.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring items for her business

loans.name: Yusta

texts.en:
Yusta is a clothes seller in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya. She is part of the Ilolo group loan (group code 2003). Every day she works at her business for 10 hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Yusta is 30 years old, married, and has six children.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Elshan

texts.en: Elshan lives in Khachmaz town. He is 27 years old and single. Three years ago he started in the dairy business. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy two cows to improve his dairy business.

loans.use: To buy two cows

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: C. is 53 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is a widow mother who has four children: the first one is married and lives separately, the second one runs a business as a local medical provider, and the other two attend school. C. currently is an assistant of the village consultant. C. has been facing difficulty with transportation for along time, she frequently hired the neighbor's taxi to work. Right now, she wants to reduce the cost of transportation; thus, she is asking for a loan to buy a used motorbike for riding to work and the family needs.

loans.use: To buy a used motorbike

loans.name: Aneth

texts.en:
Aneth is a snacks seller in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya. She belongs to the Makunguru group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $20. Every day, she works at her business for 11 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Tanzania, so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.

Aneth is 50 years old, widowed, and has five children.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a clothing and bag seller in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya. She belongs to Makunguru group loan (Group code 2004).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $105. She works 12 hours a day at her business. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothing and bags for her business. She hopes that with this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Grace is 42 years old, widowed, and has five children. She also cares for five additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy more clothing and bags for her business.

loans.name: Touch

texts.en: Mrs. Touch N. is a 35-year-old single woman and she lives in Ang Kor Ky village in Takeo province. She sells Pro Hok in the local market. Aside from this business, she is a clothes seller. Since this business is going well, she is applying for a loan to buy more fashion clothes to re-sell to earn more income. She hopes to increase her income to support herself.

loans.use: To buy more fashion clothes to re-sell to earn more income

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en: Tahir is 48 years old. He lives in the Guba region, in the Zerdabi village. He has been in the cattle breeding business for seven years. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 5 calves to improve his cattle breeding business. This man is married and has three children.

loans.use: To buy 5 calves

loans.name: Thea

texts.en:
Mrs. Thea K. lives in Ta Tai village in Takeo province. She is a tailor. Her husband, Mr. Kan Lounh, is a construction worker. Aside from this work, he is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates rice. Although they try to work hard, they still earn too little income to support their household.

Thus, Mrs. Thea K. decided to ask for a loan to buy a cow for breeding to earn more income to provide a better life for her family. She is 40 years old and the mother of two children who are both enrolled in the local school. Her husband is presented on the left of the picture.

loans.use: to buy a cow for breeding

loans.name: Nakry

texts.en: Mrs. Nakry K. lives in Ta Tai village in Takeo province. She is a tailor in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Keom Han, is a construction worker who earns a small income to support his family. Mrs. Nakry K. is requesting a loan to add to her savings to buy timber to build a new house for her family to live in. She is a 26-year-old mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the other is too young to work or study. Her husband is presented on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To build a new home.

loans.name: Ester

texts.en:
Ester is a businesswoman in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya. She belongs to the Makunguru group loan (Group code 2004).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $105. She works 11 hours every day at her business.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hoping that with this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  


Ester is 47 years old, married, and has seven children: She also cares for seven additional dependants.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: M. is 39 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He has four children: the first one, female, works in the garment factory, and the other three attend school. He is married to Pov, 37, who works in the garment factory and earns a salary of $80. M. is a motor taxi driver for more than two years. He is famous for his good and polite service. M. spends time taking his daughter and Pov to work and back home which always interrupted his business and sometimes his daughter and his wife need to take a other motor taxi to work. He gets up every early morning taking his clients to work and back home. Recently, M. is looking for a loan of $800 to buy a motorbike for his daughter and his wife as a mean to work. The loan will help the family attain a better standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his daughter and his wife as a mean to work

loans.name: Adija

texts.en:
Adija has been a business woman in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya for 5 years. She belongs to Makunguru group loan (Group code 2003).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125. Every day she works at her retail business for 10 hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Adija is 48 years old, divorced, and has four children: ages 26, 20, 18 and 16. She also cares for two additional dependents.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Sitha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sitha S., 27, and her husband, Mr. Thol Prum, 35, who live along national road number one about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, were married in 2000 and have two young daughters.

Sitha has been selling pork and vegetables for nine years. She buys these items from Koki market which is about 4 kilometers from her home and resells them in her village. Her husband has been a motor taxi driver for over ten years but his motorbike was stolen. That is why Sitha is requesting her first loan of $1,000. The loan will be used to purchase a motorbike for her husband so he can continue his motor taxi business and to dig a well for her family to use.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her husband's business and to dig a well for her family.

loans.name: Chuop

texts.en:
S. is 33 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She has four children, all of whom are students. She is married to Saveoun, 31, who owns a tourist car for public transportation. He has a net income of $7 per day.

S. has been producing traditional cupcakes for more than two years. She has earned a lot of clients because she is good at making traditional cupcakes. With her experience and good management of sales, she wants to increase her income. She wants to have a better and bigger house as her business is now spreading to the whole commune.

Recently, S. is looking for a loan to buy more equipment and powder stock for her cupcake stall. She dreams of having a degree for her children.

loans.use: To buy more equipment and powder stock for her cupcake stall

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.en:
Dilbar M. lives in the Istaravsha region of Tajikistan. It is the abuttal region so there are a lot of bazaars where people from all over the republic come to buy. Dilbar is married with three children. She is engaged in commercial services and trade, selling school accessories and educational books. She has been in the business for five years.

Dilbar applies to Kiva with the request of a business development loan of 1000 TJS for six months to expand her business. She thanks Kiva for its support and hopes for good future cooperation.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Roeun

texts.en:
Mr. Roeun S., 37, and his wife, Mrs. Sreymom Sorn, 29, live along national road number one about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1991 and have two daughters. One of them is a garment-factory worker and another one is still young.

Roeun has been a mason for 18 years. His wife has been a garment-factory worker for one year. Roeun is requesting his first loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike to drive to work, to dig a water well for use in his family and to concrete a wall of his house.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to drive to work, to dig one well and to concrete a wall of his house

loans.name: Tukae

texts.en:
Tukae has been a business woman in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya for 6 years. She belongs to Makunguru group loan (Group code 2005).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125. Every day she works at her retail business for 10 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Tukae is 35 years old, married, and has four children. She also cares for one additional dependent.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Bou

texts.en: Bou T. is 46 years old and resides with her husband in the Prey Veng province. She and her husband sell utensils and, together, make about US$4 per day. This couple has two school-aged children. Mrs. Bou T. would like to take out a loan to expand her utensil inventory to meet her clients' demands.

loans.use: To expand her utensil inventory.

loans.name: Sharif

texts.en:
M. Sharif first applied to the MicroInvest loan programme in 2009. Sharif works in the local bazaar where he sells potatoes, onions and carrots that he grows himself. He has sold self-grown vegetables for 15 years and it provides the family's income.

Sharif asks Kiva for the business-support loan of 800 TJS for eight months to implement the seasonal works.

loans.use: to implement the seasonal works

loans.name: Vidadi

texts.en: Vidadi is 21 years old and single. He lives in Khachmaz town. Two years ago he started an orchard business. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: To buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Ban

texts.en: Ban R., 49, is married and lives in the Prey Veng province with her husband. She works in a grocery store, making around US$5 per day, while her husband is a mechanic and earns US$3 per day. This couple has four children, two of whom are garment factory workers and two who are in school. Ban R. would like to request a loan to expand her grocery store by adding more products to meet her clients' demands.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store.

loans.name: Estwida

texts.en:
Estwida has been a retail woman in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya for 4 years. She belongs to Makunguru group loan (Group code 2005). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $125. Every day she works at her business for 11 hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Estwida is 37 years old, divorced, and has two children. She also cares for two additional dependent.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Ehrom

texts.en:
Ehrom M. is 25 years old and married. He lives in Istaravshan and is engaged in commercial service. Ehrom trades in small-wares, like enlargers, pins, and plastic packages. He has been in this business for six years. An increase in business turnover helped him to repay a previous loan and take the next loan step.

Ehrom asks KIVA for the financial support of a business development loan for 1600 STJ for six months. He will use the loan for the trade outlet opening in the crowed local bazaar. The loan will help him increase his business turnover and import more and different wares from China.

loans.use: To use for a trade outlet opening.

loans.name: Sim

texts.en: Sim S., 42, is married and lives with her two young children and her husband in the Prey Veng province. Since 1998, she has been running a grocery store from her home to earn a living and is able to make US$4 every day. Her husband runs a grinding mill for the local farmers. Beside this activity, he also raises pigs. On average, he makes US$3 per day. Two of their children are in school. Sim S. is asking for a loan to add her grocery’s inventory.

loans.use: To add her grocery’s inventory.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Mrs. Phalla K. is 35 and her husband, Mr. Sokha Mao, is 38. They live on an Island of Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 1991 and have four children: two sons and two daughters. All of the children are in school.

Phalla has been a silk weaver for twenty years. It’s a skill she learned from her sister. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who then takes them to sell at market in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been selling lottery tickets to villagers in his village for ten years. Phalla is requesting a loan for $350 to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Horn

texts.en: Horn S., 40, is a rice farmer who lives in the Prey Veng province. She grows rice two times a year and is able to make about US$1 every day. Her husband is a construction worker who builds houses. He typically earns US$2 per day. This family is also supported by one child who works as a construction worker. Horn S. would like to take out a loan to purchase a motorbike to transport construction materials.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Nuth

texts.en:
S. is 35 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh. He has two children: one is attending school and the other one is still young. He is married to Ratha, who is 27 and sells cloth in bulk to the market with a net income of $6 per day. S. has earned a living by hiring big umbrellas to the surrounding sellers at Dermkor market since 2005. He is famous for his good service and his friendly attitude. He earns a net income of $5.33 per day.

Recently, due to the demands of the family, S. has wanted to increase his income. Hence, he is asking for a loan of $1000 to buy a number of big umbrellas for his service. This loan will help his family have a more comfortable standard of living. He wants his children to have degrees.

loans.use: To buy a number of big umbrellas to expand his service.

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarin M., 36, and her husband, Mr. Mai Man, 43, were married in 1992 and have four children: one son and three daughters. Three of the children are in school. Besides her children, she also has an old mother living with her. The family lives in a small village off of National Road number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh.

Sarin has been selling fish for seventeen years. She buys them from Chbar Ampov market for resale at Takhmao market, and earns about $12.50 a day. Mr. Mai Man has been a construction worker for two years. Sarin is requesting a loan of $500 to dig a well to use in her family home and to build a fence around of her house.

loans.use: To dig a well to use in her family home and to build a fence around of her house.

loans.name: Muborack

texts.en:
Muborack P. was born in 1971 in Istaravshan. She is married with four children. Muborack trades in school accessories and educational books in the local bazaar. She brings goods from Uzbekistan and books from the Russian Federation, and has a good assortment.

Muborack wants to open a second trade outlet in another part of Istaravshan to increase business turnover. She thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: To open another trade outlet.

loans.name: Un

texts.en: Un S., 37, is a mother of three children and lives in Prey Veng, Cambodia. She is a good housewife and has run her grocery store since 2006. She makes US$1 every day. Her husband, pictured here, grows and sells rice. He also makes US$1 a day. Un S. needs a loan so that she can expand her grocery store.

loans.use: To expand her grocery store.

loans.name: Neema

texts.en:
Neema has been a fruit seller in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya for 4 years. She belongs to Benk group loan (Group code 2001).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $175. Every day she works at her business for 10 hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more fruit for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Neema is 38 years old, single, and has three children: ages 14, 9  and 6. She also cares for one additional dependent.

loans.use: To buy more fruit for her business.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Sok O., 48, is married and lives in the Prey Veng province with her husband. She works in a grocery store, making around US$1 daily to support her large family. Her husband is a farmer and earns US$2 every day. He grows rice two times a year. Sok O. would like to take out a loan to purchase more grocery products. She wants to diversify her products so she will have a lot of customers.

loans.use: To diversify her products.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is a 42-year-old woman. She earns a living through her work as a meat vendor. Her husband encourages her to work because he is confident that she will be successful. 

Imelda started her business when the owner of the slaughter house started to trust her and lent her meat on a consignment basis. This allowed her the flexibility she needed. Now, she is requesting a loan to purchase additional meat to sell. 

Imelda is married and blessed with 4 children. Two of her children study in school while the other two have already graduated. Her children are the reason why she plans to have her own slaughter house one day, to increase her profit.  

Through her hard work, she dreams that her youngest child will finish her school studies. She also hopes that after a year she will be able to renovate her house.

loans.use: To purchase 10 kilos of beef and 20 kilos of pork

loans.name: Chea

texts.en: Chea S., 31, is a good housewife who stays at home doing housework and cooking for her family members. Her husband has a business as a moto-taxi driver. On average, he makes US$6 per day. Chea S. would like to take out a loan of US$500 to purchase a trailer for her husband. With the trailer, she believes her husband can make more profit than before. Their family is pictured here.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer.

loans.name: Mrs. Vanny Sang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nine people who live in Pech Entrea village in Takeo province, Cambodia, have formed a village bank loan group and all the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Vanny S. was selected by the members to be village bank president. She is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. Aside from this plantation, she breeds pigs and chickens. Since her  chicken-breeding business is doing well, she wants to expand it by purchasing more chickens and chicken feed to earn more income to support her family. Her husband, Mr. Mak Thy, is a construction worker. Mrs. Vanny S. is 38 years old and the mother of five children, two of whom stay at home to do housework and help the parents work while the others are enrolled in the local school.

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Eight members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. Group members are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy chickens and chicken feed.

loans.name: Soeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Soeun A., 55, and her husband, Mr. Sam-at Preab, 62, live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1980 and have three children: one son, who is a mason, and two daughters. One of their daughters is married, but lives inside the family home, and another one is a silk weaver.

Soeun has been a silk weaver for 28 years, a skill she learned from her neighbor. She sells her finished products to the middleman, who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband has been a house constructor for 28 years as well.

Soeun is requesting her first loan of $800 to purchase silk material for her weaving business and to set up one more loom.

loans.use: To purchase silk material and to set up one more loom

loans.name: Soam

texts.en: Soam C., 30, is married and lives in the Prey Veng province with her husband, pictured here. She sells drinking water at the Neak Leung ferry station and is able to make US$3 per day. Her husband is a taxi promoter who is paid to get customers for taxis. On average, he makes US$5 per day. Soam C. is asking for a loan to purchase a motorbike for her husband so he can operate it when he isn't working at the taxi station.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Man S. is 37 years old and a resident of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She has three children: one is married and lives separately, and the other two attend school.

Man has been a dried fish seller since 1998. She has already completed her first loan cycle, which helped her to earn a good income with the money she invested. She has therefore decided to request a second loan cycle. She is requesting $1200 to buy one hundred kilograms of fish. She will dry the fish under the sunshine and then sell them in the retail market at a high price.

With this loan, she believes that she can earn a greater profit. With her profit, she wants to buy another small plot of living land next to her house. She dreams that her children will finish school and they can all live in a big house. Man S. was not available when the photograph was taken, so her husband is pictured instead.

loans.use: To buy one hundred kilograms of fish

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana has been a rice seller in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya for 4 years. She belongs to Benki group loan (Group code 2001).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $175. Every day she works at her business for 10 hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more rice for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Juliana is 38 years old, married, and has three children: ages 20, 17 and 14. She also cares for one additional dependant.

loans.use: To buy more rice for resale.

loans.name: Sivorn

texts.en:
Mrs. Sivorn P., 53, is a widow with five children. She has three sons and two daughters. Her daughters work as tailors. Both of them run their own businesses in Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. Two of her sons study at university and her other son is in college. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sivorn is a deputy commune leader and a tailor as well. She hopes to continue to support her children who are still in school; she wants to help them further their education.

She is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to purchase wood materials to build a wall in her house.

loans.use: To purchase wood materials to build a wall in her house.

loans.name: Chhem

texts.en: Chhem M., 27, is married and resides in the Prey Veng province with her husband. She works in a garment factory and makes US$3 per day. Her husband, pictured here, is a blacksmith and is able to make US$5 every day. This couple has one young child. Chhem M. would like to purchase blacksmith materials so that her husband can expand his business to have more income to raise their family.

loans.use: To purchase blacksmith materials.

loans.name: Phy

texts.en:
Mrs. Phy S., 44, and her husband, Mr. Yoem Lot, 45, were married in 1989. They have two sons. Both sons study in school. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Phy has been a silk weaver for over ten years. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in the market in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a motor taxi driver.

Phy is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase construction materials to build a fence around her house.

loans.use: To purchase construction materials to build a fence around her house.

loans.name: Umedahon

texts.en:
Umedahon T. is 32 years old. She lives in Isfara. Umedahon is divorced and bringing up her child alone. She is full of enthusiasm and readiness to work hard to ensure a good future for her child.

Umedahon works in the local bazaar where she sells shoes. She has a good assortment and repeat customers. Umedahon is a polite and charming woman. She attends to her customers respectably and people go far to buy her goods. Umedahon is asking KIVA to support her business with a loan of 1600 STJ for 6 months to import seasonal shoes.

loans.use: to import seasonal shoes

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong K., 31, is a widow and lives in the Prey Veng province with her two children. Since 2000, she has been selling clothes to earn a living and is able to make US$4 per day. Two of her children are in school. Hong K. would like a loan to expand her clothes inventory to meet her clients' demands.

loans.use: To expand her clothes inventory.

loans.name: Sam-At

texts.en:
Mrs. Sam-at M., 50, and her husband, Mr. Nat Mak, 49, who live on an Island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia, married in 1986 and have five children: four sons and one daughter. One of their children is a silk weaver and the other children attend school.

Sam-at has been a silk weaver for 30 years, a skill she learned from her mother. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village who then takes them to sell at the market in Phnom Penh. She also taught her husband to become a silk weaver. Besides weaving, Mr. Nat Mak raises pigs as well. Sam-at is asking for a loan of US$ 300 to purchase silk materials for her silk weaving business and to buy feed for raising pigs.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business and to buy feed for raising pigs

loans.name: Tom

texts.en:
Tom S., 32, is married and lives in the Prey Veng province with her three children. She works in a grocery store, making around US$5 each day. Her husband, pictured here, typically makes US$7 every day as a trailer driver. 

Inflation has driven up prices all across Cambodia and many Cambodians have faced economic struggles. Tom S. has approached CREDIT for a loan of US$1,200 to diversify her grocery items. She feels that this investment can increase her income and raise her standard of living.

loans.use: To diversify her grocery items.

loans.name: Tuty

texts.en:
Tuty K. has been an active client of our loan programme since 2006. She recommended herself as a serious and executive client. She has not had any loan repayment delays so today she is taking the next step. Tuty is married with one child and she lives in Istaravshan.

Tuty is engaged in commercial trade. Tuty sells shoes and characteristic Central Asia shoes called “kaloshy”. They are much in demand and she has repeat customers. Tuty is asking KIVA for a business support loan of 1000 STJ for 6 months for importing new seasonal wear.

loans.use: importing new seasonal footwear

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Um S. is 52 years old and resides with her husband in the Prey Veng province. She grows and sells rice to earn a living and is able to make US$3 per day, while her husband typically makes US$5 per day as a motor-taxi driver. This couple has two children, one is a student and the other is employed as a garment factory worker. Um S. would like a loan to purchase fertilizers and a water pump. The remaining money will be used to dig the well to irrigate her farm.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and a water pump.

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Mrs. Ny K., 56, and her husband, Mr. Meng Pen, 54, were married in 1979 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. One child is married and lives outside the family home; two sons have full-time employment in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 
 
Ny has been a silk weaver since she was 16 years old. She learned the skill from her mother. She buys raw silk materials for weaving from the market in Phnom Penh and also buys silk fabric from the villagers for resale at other provinces far away from her house. Mr. Meng Pen has been farming since 1979. Ny is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase silk for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Makunguru Group

texts.en:
Joyce has been a snack seller in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya for 4 years. She belongs to Makunguru group loan (Group code 2004). She currently earns an average monthly profit of $40. Every day she works at her business for 6 hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Joyce is 35 years old, married, and has three children. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Neema and Suzana. Each woman has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: So

texts.en:
Down a paddy road in a back-country village, in a house with five family members, lives N., 28, a widowed mother. She is a resident of Pursat Porvince, Cambodia. She has five children: the first two are married and live separately, two others help her with her work and live with her, and the last one is attending school. Orn, N.'s mother is 63 who lives with her.
This is the forth cycle of loan with HKL and the first cycle of loan with Kiva. N. earns living selling vegetables and fruits in the Psar Tmei Market, Pursat Province since 2004. She always gets up in the early morning to buy her goods from the farmers in bulk and hurries taking them to the market with the motor taxi driver. She earns a better income for her family for she is a manageable mother and a responsible neighbor. N. wants to reduce her family's expense and to help meet the family's demands. N. is looking for a loan of $ 500 to buy a motorbike for her business and her family. The loan will help the family attain a better standard of living.
This is a photo of her and her motor in her house.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for her business and her family

loans.name: Makunguru Group

texts.en:
Rose has been a snack seller in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya for 6 years. She belongs to Makunguru group loan (Group code 2004).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $450. Every day she works at her business for 10 hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Rose is 42 old, married, and has five children.  She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Edina, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business.

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreymom H., 38, and her husband, Mr. Nhor Hab, 40, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 1992 and have four children: one son and three daughters. Three of their children are in school and one is still too young to attend school. 
 
Sreymom and her husband have been selling beef in their village for over 10 years. She is requesting her first loan of $1000 to purchase cows for slaughter and resale at the market.

loans.use: To purchase cows for slaughter and resale

loans.name: Kabwe Group

texts.en:
Chelina has been a snack seller in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya for 7 years. She belongs to Maisha bora group loan (Group code 2101).  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $80. Every day she works at her business for 9 hours.  

She is requesting her firtst loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more bread for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business, improve her home and pay school fees for her children.  

Chelina is 45 years old, married, and has five children: ages 20, 17, 16, 14  and 12. She also cares for five additional dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Magreth, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more items for her business

loans.name: Vuy

texts.en:
Mrs. Vuy T., 41, and her husband, Mr. Sophy An, 46, live on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. They were married in 1982 and have six children: one son and five daughters. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home, one daughter is a silk weaver, and the other children are in school. 
 
Vuy has been a weaver since she was 17 years old. She learned the skill from her mother. Vuy buys raw silk from Phnom Penh and sells her finished products to the middleman in her village. Her husband has built wooden houses since 1979. He works in his village and in a nearby village. Vuy is requesting her first loan of $300 to purchase cotton thread materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase cotton thread for her weaving business

loans.name: Kahramon

texts.en:
M. Kahramon first applied to MicroInvest's loan programme in 2009. He lives in the B. Gafurov region of Tajikistan. Kahramon is married and has 2 children. He is a builder by background but livestock brings in the general family income. He has one cow, one bull and 5 rams.

Kahramon has experience in livestock over 4 years and he has the appropriate skills. Kahramon is applying to KIVA with a request for a business development loan of 1600 STJ for 6 months for building a summer barn. Kahramon gratefully thanks KIVA for its help and support.

loans.use: building a summer barn

loans.name: Sipha

texts.en:
Mrs. Sipha P., 37, and her husband, Mr. Chhang Sovann, 35, were married in 2000 and have two children: a son and a daughter--one is in school and one is too young for school. Besides her children, her elderly mother and a sister live with them. The family lives along National Road Number 6, about 29 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sipha and her husband sell food, coffee, and dessert in front of their house. The couple wants to start another business, a motorcycle cleaning service. To accomplish this goal, Sipha is applying for her first loan of $1000 to buy a pressure washer and an air compressor. She will use the rest of the loan to build her motorcycle cleaning shop.

loans.use: To purchase a pressure washer, an air compressor, and to build a motorbike cleaning shop

loans.name: Choeun

texts.en:
Mr. Choeun S., 49, and his wife, Mrs. Sinan Chea, 36, live along National Road Number 6, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh, Cambodia. They were married in 1982 and have five children: two sons and three daughters. One child is married and lives outside the family house, one daughter is a hair dresser, and three children are in school. One son studies at the university.

Choeun S. has been driving a taxi in his village for 5 years. His wife stays home to look after their house and take care of their children. He is requesting his first loan of $1000 to purchase one motorcycle for his son to drive to the university and to buy cosmetics for his daughter to sell at her hair salon.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his son to drive to school and to buy cosmetics for his daughter to sell at her hair salon.

loans.name: Ibrogim

texts.en:
O. Ibrogim lives in the B. Gafurov region. He is married and has 3 children. Ibrogim has the reputation of a hard-working and good father since he considers family stability as the main aim in life. He works in a collective farm but livestock brings in the general family income.

Ibrogim raises and sells livestock. His wife helps him in taking care of the animals. Ibrogim asks KIVA for the business support loan of 3000 STJ for 8 months to purchase a pedigreed bull. Ibrogim thanks KIVA for its support and wishes all the best in future.

loans.use: to purchase a pedigreed bull

loans.name: Kabwe Group

texts.en:
Pendo has been a groundnut seller in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya for 9 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $40. Every day she works at her business for 9 hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more groundnuts for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Pendo is 38 years old, married, and has two children: ages 16 and 14. She also cares for two additional dependent. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member,Sarah, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more groundnuts for resale

loans.name: Kabwe Group

texts.en:
Agnes has been a clothes seller in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya for 7 years.  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $130. Every day she works at her business for 10 hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Agnes is 40 years old, married, and has three children: ages 24, 17 and 11. She also cares for three additional dependent. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Adestelia, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Sarat

texts.en:
Mr. Sarat C., 41, and his wife, Mrs. Thea Nhem, 36, were married in 1990 and have two children: a son and a daughter, who are both in school. The family lives along National Road Number 6, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Sarat has been driving taxi in his village and the adjacent village for 6 years. His wife has been selling Khmer noodles (vermicelli) in her village for 2 years. Currently, Sarat and his wife stay with their parents but they would like to live in a home of their own. Sarat is asking for a loan of $1,200 to purchase a house for his family.

loans.use: To purchase a house for his family.

loans.name: Man

texts.en:
Mr. Man M., 42, and his wife, Mrs. Amminas Man, 43, were married in 1980 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. Two of their children are married but live with the family and the other three children attend school. The family lives on National Road Number 6, about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Man has been a fisherman for 15 years, a skill he learned from his parents. He catches fish from the Mekong River near his village. Mrs Amminas Man sells the fish her husband catches to the villagers. Man is applying for his first loan of $300 to purchase nets for his fishing business.

loans.use: To purchase nets for his fishing business.

loans.name: Khursheda

texts.en:
R. Khursheda has been an active client since 2002. She works with MicroInvest because she trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure. Thanks to the previous loans she could improve her business terms.

Khursheda started the business practically from scratch but today she has her own trade outlet selling children's and women's wear. She brings her assortment from Istaravshan, Uzbekistan, and Kyrgyz Republic. She has good taste so she has repeat customers who come to buy her goods.

Khursheda is married with 2 children Her husband helps her to trade in the bazaar. Khursheda is applying to KIVA with the request for a business development loan of 3000 STJ for 5 months for importing a new seasonal assortment from Uzbekistan.

loans.use: importing a new seasonal assortment

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Mr. Sophea P., 44, and his wife, Mrs. Sokorb Po, 42, have been married for 21 years and have five children: four sons and one daughter, who is married and lives outside the family home. Two children study music, one child attends school and another one is too young for school. The family lives in a small village off of National Road Number 2, about 20 kilometers south of Phnom Penh.

Sophea and his wife have been selling fish for twenty years. They buy them from fishermen in his village and resell the fish at the Takhmao market, earning about $12.50 a day. The couple needs the money to buy music instruments for their two children who are studying modern music. Sophea is asking for a loan of $300 to purchase musical instruments for them.

loans.use: To purchase musical instruments for his children.

loans.name: Djamil

texts.en: Djamil is 23 years old. He is single and lives in Ashagi-Zeyid village, in the Khachmaz region. He has been in the sheep breeding business for 4 years. Djamil is requesting a loan of 2000 AZN to buy 25 additional sheep to expand and improve his business.

loans.use: To buy 25 sheep

loans.name: Livann

texts.en:
Mrs. Livann T., 39, has been married 15 years and has two children: a son and a daughter, both of whom attend school. She lives with her mother on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Livann has been a silk weaver for 20 years. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then sells them at the market in Phnom Penh. Her husband has full-time employment. Livann is requesting a loan of $500 to maintain the land around her house and to pay for house repairs.

loans.use: To maintain the land around her house and to pay for house repairs.

loans.name: An

texts.en:
Mrs. An C., 64, is widowed with one daughter. They live in a small village along National Road Number 5, about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh, Cambodia.

An has been selling fish for 28 years; she buys them from the kilometer number 9 market for resale at the Prek Phnao market. Her daughter helps her in the business. An is requesting her second loan of $1000 to maintain the land around her house.

loans.use: To maintain the land her house.

loans.name: Koeun

texts.en:
Mr. Koeun U., 42, and his wife, Mrs. Thoeun Me, 38, were married in 1989 and have two children: a son who is a boat pilot and a daughter in school. The family lives in a small village across from the Mekong River, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, Cambodia. 

Koeun has been a mason for 3 years. His wife has been selling Cambodian cupcakes (akor) for 20 years. Akor is a cake made of flour, sugar, and coconut milk. The batter is poured into small cups and steamed. Thoeun buys ingredients from the market and sells the cakes in the nearby village.

Koeun needs additional equipment for his job and he is requesting his first loan of $1000 to purchase a construction crane for his business.

loans.use: To purchase a construction crane for his business.

loans.name: Ilolo Group

texts.en:
Rusia has been a alcohol seller in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya for 3 years.  She currently earns an average monthly profit of $60. Every day she works at her business for 10 hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more alcohol for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Rusia is 38 years old, married, and has five children.  She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Ross, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more alcohol items for her business.

loans.name: Ilolo Group

texts.en:
Hilda has been a snack seller in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood of Mbeya. Every day she works at her business for 9 hours.  

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items  for her business. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  

Hilda  is 39 years old, married, and has five children.  She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Regina, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more items

loans.name: Koem's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of five members. Its leader, N., 34, is a widowed mother of two children: both of them are students. She has owned a shop providing food from morning till late afternoon since 2001. She is famous for she is good at cooking food and her service is good; she attracts a lot of customers with her food.

Because her business is located on a busy corner, she now wants to increase her income for her children's needs. So N. is looking for a loan to buy more chairs and tables for her business and a bicycle for her child to ride to school. The loan will help the family have a more comfortable living.

The other members of the group are:

S., 25, who owns a grocery store and is looking for a loan to buy more inventory for her store;

S. R., 26, who works in a pure drinking water company and is requesting a loan to buy a motorbike for his work; K., 24, who is a local farmer and is taking a loan to buy rice in bulk to stock in her stall; and P., 37, who is a local farmer and is taking a loan to buy pigs for her pig pen. K. was not available for the photograph so his wife's picture was taken instead.

loans.use: To buy more chairs and tables for her business and a bicycle for her child to ride to school

loans.name: Moeun

texts.en:
Mr. Moeun M., 32, and his wife, Mrs. Thim Chab, 28, were married in 2003 and have two young sons. The family lives in a small village across the Mekong River, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia. 

Moeun has been selling ice cream for 4 months. He buys it from a company in Phnom Penh and sells it in his village. Before starting this business he drove a taxi. His wife is a silk weaver but she has stopped for a while to take care of their young boys. Moeun is asking for a loan of $300 to purchase a motorcycle to carry ice cream.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for his ice cream business.

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.en:
B. Ibrohim has been associated with MicroInvest since 2003. He lives in the B.Gaurov region and has a large family. Ibrohim is engaged in commercial service and sales. He sells food products in the local bazaar (sugar, conserves, slated tomatoes, cucumbers, coffee, tea, vegetable, cotton oil, etc). He also sells household wares (shampoo, soaps, cleaning powders, etc), products that he buys in Istaravshan and Uzbekistan. 

Ibrohim's professional background is that of a school teacher. He sells in the local bazaar and his children help him. Ibrohim wants to import household wares that are made in the Russian federation as they are popular and the quality is good.  Ibrohim asks KIVA for business support in the form of a loan of 4100 STJ over 3 months. This loan will permit him to increase his sales turnover and expand his business.

loans.use: To increase his sales turnover and strengthen the existing business.

loans.name: Lutfullo

texts.ru:
Лутфулло  Шарипов 1973 года рождения, он женат и имеет троих детей. Он сотрудничает с Микроинвест с 2007 года. Занимается разведением скота более десяти лет. Дома содержит несколько голов кота. На полученный кредит приобрел корм и скот. В  свободное время сажает овощи и деревья с фруктами.
О кредите узнал у своего  друга, условия понравились ему и он получил кредит. Планирует увеличить поголовье скота за счет дальнейшего кредитования и расширения бизнеса.
texts.en:
Lutfullo S. was born in 1973, he is married and has three children. He has been a client with MicroInvest since 2007. He raises cattle for more than ten years. He has several heads of cattle at home. He will use the loan to buy fodder and cattle. In his spare time he sows vegetables and plants fruit trees.

Lutfullo found out about the loan program from his friend. He liked the terms and took out a loan. He plans to increase the head count of his livestock by continuing to use loans and expanding his business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cattle and fodder

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.en:
K. Zuhro first applied to Kiva's partner, MicroInvest, in 2005 when she decided to open a business selling toys, perfumes and gift units. Zuhro, thanks to previous loans, could improve her existing business terms and open her own specialized trade outlet. Her husband helps her to import the goods from China and Uzbekistan.

Zuhro is a very polite and kind by nature person and it's a pleasure to talk with her. Zuhro has repeat customers and she wants to import a new toy assortment from China. Zuhro applies to Kiva to request the business-development loan of 4100 STJ for 4 months. Zuhro thanks Kiva for the financial support of small entrepreneurs all over the world.

loans.use: To import a new toy assortment from China

loans.name: Amirkhan

texts.en: Amirkhan is 45 years old. He lives in Khachmaz region, in the Yeni-Hayat settlement. He is married and has four children. He has 10 years of experience in the orchard business. Now he needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides for improving his orchard business.

loans.use: To buy seedlings, fertilizer and pesticides

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is 38 years old. He lives in the Khachmaz region, in the Pirgulu-Oba village. He is married and has one child. Three years ago he started a taxi business. Now he needs a loan of 1500 AZN to buy spare parts for improving his taxi business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Améyo Élisabeth

texts.fr: Z. améyo  est une dame qui habite le quartier d’agoè Zongo, elle a pour activité la vente de charbons de bois en gros et quelques fois en détail. Elle fait ce commerce dans le marché local d’agoè zongo et ce depuis 1999, elle s’approvisionne au marché de gbadagbo. Actuellement son stock a diminué et c’est pour pouvoir augmenter son stock qu’elle sollicite  un crédit auprès de wages pour acheter 10 sacs de charbons. Elle est divorcée de son mari et a 05 personnes à charges, c’est avec ce commerce qu’elle arrive à entretenir sa famille.
texts.en:
Z. Améyo is a woman who lives in the Agoè Zongo district. Her work involves selling charcoal wholesale and sometimes retail. She has been in this business since 1999 at the local marketplace of Agoè Zongo. She supplies herself at the Gbadagbo marketplace. Right now, her inventory is reduced. To increase it, she’s requesting a loan from WAGES in order to buy 10 sacks of charcoal. She is divorced from her husband and has five people to support. This commerce of hers is how she manages to provide for her family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a 37-year old woman dreaming to have more capital to sustain the needs of her family. She hopes that her three children will finish their studies so that they will not experience what she experienced before.

She is engaged in fish vending on a consignment basis with a fish dealer. The dealer trusted them with bulk of fish, in turn she became a dealer in the town of Bugasong. The retailers in her neighborhood serve as her customers.

She needs additional capital to increase the volume of fish she would be trading to augment her income.

loans.use: purchasing of 118 kilos of different kind of fish

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Saharou

texts.fr: Ce monsieur est marié et a un enfant à charge, sa femme est une revendeuse. saharou a pour activité la vente de produits génériques, il fait ce commerce depuis 2003, il fait son commerce de façon ambulante.il n’a jamais obtenu de crédit de wages et sollicite actuellement son premier crédit pour s’acheter un lot de produits génériques.
texts.en:
This is a gentleman who is married and has a child to support. His wife is a retailer. Saharou’s work involves selling generic pharmaceutical products. He has been in this business since 2003 and goes door-to-door in his work. He has never obtained a WAGES loan before and is currently applying for his first loan in order to buy some generic pharmaceuticals.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy medicines

loans.name: Amadeu Artur

texts.pt:
Amadeu Artur M. é natural da cidade de Maputo, tem 31 anos de idade, casado maritalmente e pai de uma filha com 5 anos de idade qual estuda na primeira classe. Alem da sua família sustenta a mãe enviando dinheiro periodicamente.

Amadeu estudou até 12ªclasse e parou quando a família foi abalada por problemas sociais tendo um irmão gravemente doente e ele era obrigado a tomar conta dele assim perdeu o ano dê arrumou um emprego. Aos 14 anos mudou se da cidade de Maputo para distrito de Boane junto com os pais.

Amadeu trabalha no distrito de Marracuene que dista a 60km do distrito em que tem a sua família como auxiliar administrativo a 9 meses, antes trabalhou numa ONG Helvetas. Tem um salário mensal de 2524,00mt trabalhando das 7:30 as 15:00h. Vive numa casa própria.

Para Amadeu este é o seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva, com qual pretende Continuar com a construção da sua casa concretamente na reabilitação. Futuramente vai solicitar mais empréstimo para a sua ampliação diz ser pequena para as suas intenções.
texts.en:
Amadeu Artur M. is a native of the city of Maputo. He is 31 years old, married, and the father of a 5 year old daughter who is in the first grade. Besides his family he also supports his mother by sending her money periodically. Amadeu went to school through the 12th grade and stopped when his family was shaken by social problems. He had a brother who was gravely ill, and he was obliged to take care of him. He lost a year trying to find a job. When he was 14 years old he moved from Maputo to the district of Boane with his parents. Amadeu works in the district of Marracuene that is 60 km from the district in which his family lives. He has been an administrative assistant for 9 months, and before that he worked for the NGO, Helvetas. He has a monthly salary of 2,524MT working from 7:30am until 3:00pm. He lives in his own home. This is Amadeu's first loan with Hluvuku and with Kiva, with which he intends to continue the construction on his home that is well into rehabilitation. In the future he is going to solicit another loan and he says it will be small for his intentions.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en: Daniel is 30 years old. He is single and lives in Khudat town. This man has been in the auto-repair business for three years. Now he needs a loan of 1500 AZN to buy spare parts and things necessary for repairing cars.

loans.use: To buy spare parts

loans.name: Celeste Ernesto Mucavele

texts.pt:
Celeste Ernesto G. é natural de Mafuiane uma das localidade do distrito de Namaacha um dos distrito da província do Maputo, tem 42 anos de idade, é casada e mãe de 5 filhos com idade entre 27, 25, 23, 19 e 16 anos respectivamente. Sustenta dois filhos e 4 netos que vive com eles.

Celeste estudou até 5ªclasse do antigo sistema de educação, não continuou por falta de condições onde viu se obrigada a ir ao lar cedo. Mudou se de mafuiane para uma zona chamada Bloco 2 quando se casou numa casa da empresa do marido local que vivera 10 anos e depois saíram para Km 16 onde vive até data hoje. Vive numa casa própria.

Celeste é comerciante desde 1981 onde aprendeu através das amigas tendo começado por vender frutas adquiridas nos citrinos 3 de Fevereiros citas no distrito de Boane. Tem um estabelecimento a 9 anos, onde abre as 6horas e fecha as 18h da segunda-feira a sábado. Tem um rendimento mensal de 6000,00mt e não poupa nada devido a altos encargos familiar.

Para Celeste este é p seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva, com qual pretende aumentar o seu estoque ampliando assim as suas vendas, ela pretende pagar antes do tempo para solicitar outro empréstimo afim de melhorar as condições habitacionais da sua família.
texts.en:
Celeste Ernesto G. is a native of Mafuiane, one of the localities in the district of Namaacha which is one of the districts of the province of Maputo. She is 42 years old, married, and the mother of 5 children with ages 27, 25, 23, 19, and 16 respectively. She supports 2 children and 4 grandchildren who live with them. Celeste went to school until the 5th grade in the old system of education. She did not continue because of a lack of conditions and she felt obligated to be in the home early. She moved from Mafuiane to a zone called Block 2 when she was married in a house of her husband's work where they lived for 10 years. Later they moved to Km 16 where they live today. She lives in her own home. Celeste has been a merchant since 1981 which she learned through her friends and started selling fruits she acquired in the district of Boane. She has had an establishment for 9 years where she opens at 6:00am and closes at 6:00pm. She has a monthly income of 6,000MT and does not save anything due to the high costs of living. This is Celeste's first loan with Hluvuku and with Kiva, which she intends to use to increase her stocks and grow her sales. She intends to pay it off before maturity so she can solicit another loan and improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase staple products

loans.name: Daniel Widasse

texts.pt:
Daniel Widasse S. é natural do distrito de Boane província do Maputo tem 29 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e pai de 2 filhos com idade entre o primeiro com 4 anos e o segundo com 18 meses. Alem dos filhos sustenta mais 4 pessoas dois irmãos, uma madrasta e a sua mãe que vive com eles.

Daniel estudou até 10ªclasse do ensino técnico profissional como docente e parou por falta de condições. Daniel trabalha como docente a 8 anos com um horário das 7h até as 14:30h, tem um salário mensal de 5500,00mt.

Para Daniel este é o 5º empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva, os primeiros nos valores seguintes, 5200,00mt; 6500,00mt; 10500,00mt e 10500,00mt respectivamente e este no valor de 15200,00mt que também vai aplicar na construção da sua casa. Futuramente Daniel pretende solicitar outro empréstimo para compra de viatura.
texts.en:
Daniel Widasse S. is a native of the district of Boane in the province of Maputo. He is 29 years old, married, and the father of 2 children. The first is 4 years old, and the second is 18 months old. Besides his children he also supports 4 other people, 2 brothers, a stepmother, and his mother who all live with them. Daniel went to school until the 10th grade learning to teach professional technicians, but he stopped due to poor conditions. Daniel has worked as a professor for 8 years with a schedule from 7:00am until 2:30pm. He has a monthly salary of 5,500MT. This is Daniel's fifth loan with Hluvuku, and his first with Kiva. The earlier loans were in the following amounts: 5,200MT, 6,500MT, 10,500MT, and 10,500MT respectively. This loan is for 15,200MT that will also be applied to the construction of his home. In the future Daniel intends to solicit another loan to purchase a vehicle.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction materials

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en: Oksana, married with two sons named Alexander and Konstantin, has been operating a small clothing sales business for several years, earning an income of about 2,000 UAH per month. Hard working and honest, Oksana always repays money on time and believes that honesty and integrity are always rewarded. She would now like to borrow 1,500 UAH to fix her apartment.

loans.use: To fix her apartment.

loans.name: Mandjat

texts.en: Mandjat, a 40-year-old mother of two children, lives in Khachmaz Region in Niyaz-Oba village, where 10 years ago she started an orchard business. Now she needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy fertilizer and seedlings for improving the business.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings

loans.name: João Heitor Elias

texts.pt:
João Heitor Elias M. é natural de Maputo no distrito de Boane, casado maritalmente e pai de um filho com um ano de idade, para alem da sua família sustenta os seus pais enviando géneros alimentícios. 

João estudou até 7ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeiras, desta viu obrigado a procurar emprego muito cedo, onde encontra se a trabalhar numa empresa agrária de produção de Banana de nome Bananalandia, tem um salário mensal de 1749,00mt.

João vive na casa da sagraria dai que com este empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção para começar a construção da sua própria casa.
texts.en:
João Heitor Elias M. was born in Maputo, in the district of Boane. He is married and the father of a one-year-old child. Besides his family he supports his parents by sending them food. João went to school until the 7th grade and then stopped due to lack of finances. He was forced to look for work early on, and found a job at an agricultural company that produces bananas, called Bananalandia. His monthly salary is 1749.00 MT. João lives in a house that belongs to the company, but with this loan he intends to purchase construction material and begin building his own house.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material

loans.name: Mónica Silvestre

texts.pt:
Mónica Silvestre J. é natural da província da Zambézia uma das centrais do pais, tem 30 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de um filho de 7 anos de idade, apenas sustenta este filho.

Mónica estudou ate 10ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeiras, Mónica mudou se de cidade quando foi contratada pela educação depois de se formar como professora do ensino básico onde teve afectação na província do Maputo.

Mónica trabalha como professora com um horário das 7h as 12h, tem um rendimento mensal de 2900,00mt, vive numa casa própria. Para Mónica este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva. assim constitui maior sonho para Mónica a conclusão das obras de forma a ver a sua família em melhor condições habitacionais.
texts.en:
Monica Silvestre J. was born in the central province of Zambezia. She is 30 years old, single, and the mother of a seven-year-old child. She only supports this child. Monica went to school until the 10th grade, and then stopped due to lack of finances. Monica left her city after she graduated as an elementary school teacher and was contracted to work in Maputo. Monica works as a teacher from 7:00 a.m. to 12:00 p.m. Her monthly income is 2900.00 MT, and she lives in her own house. This is Monica’s second loan through Hluvuku and her first with Kiva. Her greatest dream is to finish the construction of her house so that her family can have better living conditions.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material

loans.name: Zokhrab

texts.en: Zokhrab, 37, lives in Khachmaz town, where he is the married father of one child. Four years ago he started a taxi business and is now requesting a loan of 1500 AZN to buy spare parts and repair his car to improve the business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts and repair his car.

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla, a widow with two children, sells various home products at the central market in Melitopol city, earning a monthly income of about 1,700 UAH. In business for 14 years, she used to sell spare parts for bicycles, but low profits led her to change inventory. Alla lives with her younger daughter in a house and helps her other daughter who now lives separately.

Alla would like to get a loan of 4,500 UAH to increase her assortment of products. She says that the loan will help her to increase profits, thereby enabling her to better assist her daughters.

loans.use: To increase assortment of products.

loans.name: Mwanahamis

texts.en: Mwanahamis  C. is a Tanzanian  micro-entrepreneur and a married woman. She runs a business selling charcoal at  Vingunguti  Ward in Dar es Salaam. Charcoal is a main source of power in Africa due to unstable availability and high charges for electricity power. She purchases her stock wholesale direct from the producers and sells retail to her customers. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000 to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Zeca Francisco

texts.pt:
Zeca Francisco C. é natural da província de Sofala no centro do pais, tem 46 anos de idade, é casado maritalmente e pai de 5nfilhos com idades entre 29; 24; 15; 9 e 3 anos respectivamente, apenas sustenta 4 filhos dado que o primeiro já tem sua casa e trabalha assalariado.

Zeca estudou até 4ªclasse e parou quando perdeu o seu pai, aos 22 anos de idade mudou se da zona quando se incorporou nos serviços militar obrigatório tendo lhe levado até a província do Maputo, em 1992 foi desmobilizado assim recebe mensalmente uma pensão militar.

Zeca trabalha como guarda com um horário das 7h as 18h, tem um salário mensal de 6000,00mt, vive numa casa própria, este é o seu segundo empréstimo na Hluvuku e primeiro no Kiva. assim pretende pagar antes doo tempo para solicitar outro afim de mobilar a sua casa.
texts.en:
Zeca Francisco C. was born in the central province of Sofala. He is 46 years old, married, and the father of 5 children aged 29, 24, 15, 9, and 3 respectively. He supports 4 of his children, since the oldest already has his own house and a job with a salary. Zeca went to school until the 4th grade and then stopped when he lost his father. When he was 22 years old he left home because he was drafted into military service, which took him to Maputo. In 1992 he left the military service and now receives a monthly military pension. Zeca works as a guard from 7:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. and receives a monthly salary of 6000.00 MT. He lives in his own house, and this is his second loan through Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. He intends to pay off this loan ahead of time so that he can request another loan to furnish his home.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material

loans.name: Fatuma Seleman

texts.en: Fatum Seleman M., a married Tanzanian woman, has operated a pharmacy in Vingunguti ward in Dar es Salaam for four years, purchasing her business stocks from the Kariakoo wholesale shops. She is now requesting a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to expand the business

loans.use: To expand the business.

loans.name: Dolnad

texts.en: Dolnard  K. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur and business man . He runs a food shop in Lumo ward of Dar es Salaam. Shop businesses are very common in Tanzania. He is married with three children. He sells a variety of items to customers, including serial crop products such as beans, groundnuts, wheat flower, maize flower and cashew nuts. He has been in this business for six years, Income generated from his food shop is used to meet daily family expanses including paying school fees. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,200,000 to buy more items for resale.

loans.use: To buy more beans, groundnuts, wheat flower, maize flower and cashew nuts to resell

loans.name: Nasra

texts.en:
Nasra I. is a Tanzanian entrepreneur and businesswoman. She runs a shop selling clothes in the Vituka ward in Dar es Salaam. She sells both used clothes and new clothes for women and children. She purchases the items from Kariakoo wholesale shopping center. The used clothes are purchased from Karume used clothes city market.

She has been running the business for six years.

She needs a loan of Tshs 1,400,000 to expand the business by buying more inventory.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Kibinda

texts.en: Kibinda K. runs cosmetic shops at Buguruni Ward in Dar es Salaam. She is married with three school children. She purchases the shop items from both Kariakoo wholesale shops and retail shops. She sells to retail customers. She has been running the business for four years. Her family depends on the business for its daily needs. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to buy more products.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Anna

texts.en: Anna K. is a pharmacist. She runs a pharmacy shop in the Buguruni ward in Dar es Salaam. She is an entrepreneurial Tanzanian married woman with three children. She purchases her products from wholesalers in Kariakoo city market and from retail shops. She has been in the business for two years. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 800,000 to purchase more inventory to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: To buy more inventory

loans.name: Irene

texts.en: Irene F. is a Tanzanian entrepreneurial married woman with two school children. She runs a clothing shop and Kiosk at Kisiwani in Bugruni ward in Dar es Salaam. She sells traditional clothing (Vitenge and Kanga) to customers in her shop. She purchases the clothing from Mnazi mmoja traditional clothing wholesale shops and sells at retail to customers in her shop. She has been in the business for four years, and she has also managed to open a soft drink business selling a variety of soft drinks. She needs a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Godwin

texts.en: Godwin T. runs a fruit shop at Kisiwani in Buguruni ward in Dar es Salaam. He is married with four children in primary school. He sells a variety of fruits in his shop. He purchases the fruit wholesale from the Buguruni city market and sells at retail to customers in his shop. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 800,000 to increase his inventory.

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Matata

texts.en:
Matata J. is a micro-entrepreneur. He runs a loaf shop at Kisiwani in the Buguruni ward of Dar es Salaam. He purchases the business items wholesale from the bakery producers and sells retail to customers in his shop. He is sometimes supplied as an agent.

He has been in the business for six years. Income generated is used to meet his family's daily demand. He is requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000 to buy more business stock.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Marry

texts.en: Mary L. is an enterprising Tanzanian business woman. She has been running a beauty salon at Yombo Vituka ward in Dar es Salaam for four years. She is married and has three school children. She purchases products for her business from the wholesale shops in the Kariakoo city trading center. She is requesting a loan of Tshs 800,000. to help improve her business.

loans.use: Improve her business

loans.name: Qorimakis Group

texts.es:
Este banco se denomina  “QORIMAKIS”, nombre quechua; que etimológicamente significa, Qori oro y Makis significa manos; la traducción vendría hacer “manos de oro”; Este grupo conformado por 13 miembros, están situados en la zona sur  de la ciudad del Cusco.

Los socios se dedican a diferentes actividades, 04 de ellos son artesanos, trabajan con arcilla, madera, cuero, y otros elementos, otros 03 socios son comerciantes minoristas ellos compran y venden papas en el mercado central, otros 02 se dedican a la compra de ropa al por mayor en la capital y la traen a Cusco a vender, otros 02 socios tiene su pequeña librería y comprarán útiles escolares para vender en su barrio, en 02 semanas más se iniciarán la labores escolares en los diferentes colegios de Perú,  dentro de los pequeños negocios en los que invertirán estos socios están los pagos de las matrículas y otros gastos personales.

Los socios agradecen el apoyo prestado mediante este medio y se comprometen a pagar las cuotas y el total de la deuda en el plazo determinado.
texts.en:
This bank is called "QORIMAKIS", a Quechuan name, which etymologically speaking, comes from "Gold" (Qori) and Hands (Makis): so the name translates as "Golden Hands". This group consists of 13 members, from the southern area of the town of Cusco. The members work in different areas. Four are artisans working with clay, wood, leather and other materials. Another three members are retail merchants who buy and sell potatoes in the central market. Another two members work buying clothes wholesale in the capital and bringing them to Cusco to sell. Another two members have a small stationary shop and buy school equipment to sell in their area: in two more weeks' time the school term will start in Peru's different schools. The small businesses in which these members have invested provide the money to pay school fees and other personal expenses. The members are very grateful for the support lent through this means and promise to promptly repay the entire loan within the agreed time.

Translated from Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for artesanal activities,clothes to sell and general school materials.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima M. A. has run a business for three years selling a variety of fruits at Yombo Vituka ward in Dar es Salaam. She is married with two children.

She purchases fruit from the Buguruni city fruit market center and sells to customers at retail in Vituka. The fruit Halima sells includes paw paws, mangoes, oranges, avocados, bananas, and watermelon. She also sells a variety of green vegetables. Halima is requesting a loan of Tshs 600,000 to help build up her business.

loans.use: Build up the business

loans.name: Marlon Jose
